Title: Software Developer II
Job_Description:
IDT is the leading manufacturer of custom oligonucleotides and proprietary technologies for genomics applications. Our work is complex and cutting-edge, and our team members are curious, creative thinkers who understand that good data drives smart decisions. At IDT, we realize that although science may be uniform, people are unique. We promote a culture where engaged people are motivated and have opportunities to achieve their full potential, as part of one global team.
IDT is proud to work alongside a community of nine fellow Danaher Life Sciences companies. Together, we’re pioneering the future of science and medicine, developing products that enable researchers in the fight to save lives.

Software Developer II
Location: REMOTE (USA)

Purpose statement:
The Software Developer II provides development and maintenance services for Enterprise class Manufacturing Execution Systems. This position includes requirements definition, analysis, development, testing, implementation, and support to deliver benefits to the organization, its customers, and other business partners. This position also acts as a resource for other colleagues, as well as leading small projects with manageable risks and requirements.


Perform software development activities using established development practices, following design and coding standards, code reviews, code versioning, continuous builds, unit/integration testing, & deployments.
Provide technical expertise and recommendations in assessing new IT software projects and initiatives to support and enhance our existing software systems
Provides Software Developer I Associates with mentorship, guidance, and training on IT standard work and collaborates with managers on the development of Software Development I associates.
Actively coordinates with Business Analysts and stakeholders to assist in the creation of system design and functional specifications for new development projects
Investigate and resolve application functionality, root cause analysis, related issues, and provide support/troubleshooting of our software systems


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or MIS. (Preferred)


Minimum of 3 years of experience in a software development group (Required)
Experience with enterprise software applications. (Preferred)
Minimum of 3 years using C# or similar object oriented language


Shift Differentials (Extra Compensation for less traditional shifts)
Generous Paid Time Off Accruals
16 Hours PAID Volunteer Time Off
10 Paid Holidays
Up to eight (8) weeks of 100% paid parental leave to eligible U.S. associates
401(k) with Company Match
Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance Options

Integrated DNA Technologies (IDT) conducts drug screens and background checks on applicants who accept employment offers.

When you join us, you’ll also be joining Danaher’s global organization, where 80,000 people wake up every day determined to help our customers win. As an associate, you’ll try new things, work hard, and advance your skills with guidance from dedicated leaders, all with the support of powerful Danaher Business System tools and the stability of a tested organization.

Title: Software Developer II
Job_Description:
Wondering what’s within Beckman Coulter Diagnostics? Take a closer look.
At first glance, you’ll see that for more than 80 years we’ve been dedicated to advancing and optimizing the laboratory to move science and healthcare forward. Join a team where you can be heard, be supported, and always be yourself. We’re building a culture that celebrates backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives of all our associates. Look again and you’ll see we are invested in you, providing the opportunity to build a meaningful career, be creative, and try new things with the support you need to be successful.

Beckman Coulter Diagnostics is proud to work alongside a community of six fellow Diagnostics Companies at Danaher. Together, we’re working at the pace of change to improve patient lives with diagnostic tools that address the world’s biggest health challenges.

The Senior Software Engineer for Beckman Coulter Diagnostics is responsible for the design and develop of software .

This position is part of the software development team located in Chaska, MN and will be remote but the preferred to find candidates in Chaska, MN. At Beckman Coulter, our vision is to relentlessly reimagine healthcare, one diagnosis at a time.

You will be a part of the software development team and report to the Senior Manager of Software Engineering responsible for working closely with Product owner and Architects to understand the requirements and architecture, work on converting the assigned feature requirements into design, code and unit tests prior to release for verification. If you thrive in an amazing role and want to work to build a world-class software platform organization—read on.


Understand the overall requirements of the product/platform and specifically for the assigned feature/module.

Design and Develop Software as per the product architecture and requirements.

Code and unit testing of the feature/modules including appropriate design reviews and code inspections.

Ensure adherence to the software development processes.

Investigate software / system problems to isolate the root cause and provides innovative solutions.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams (locally & globally) to ensure product releases meet quality, performance, scalability, reliability and schedule goals.

Work an 8 hour days shift with flexible timing to work with global team based in India, France and Germany.


Proven ability to work in iterative release product environment, with focus on challenging quality and delivery goals

5+ years overall software development experience, solid experience in Software Design & Architecture and Bachelor degree in Computer Science / Software Engineering OR a related field OR Master's Degree in field with 3+ years experience OR Doctoral degree in field with 0+ years experience

Insight in Windows architecture framework .NET 4 and C# Programming Language as well as Azure experience

Great Exposure to Continuous Integration, delivery and deployment, version Control

Effective Technical Communication, Rapid Prototyping and problem solving skills



Exposure to Design Control and Healthcare domain is a (+)

SQL is a plus

At Beckman Coulter Diagnostics we believe in designing a better, more sustainable workforce. We recognize the benefits of flexible, remote working arrangements for eligible roles and are committed to providing enriching careers, no matter the work arrangement. This position is eligible for a remote work arrangement in which you can work remotely from your home. Additional information about this remote work arrangement will be provided by your interview team. Explore the flexibility and challenge that working for Beckman Coulter Diagnostics can provide.

When you join us, you’ll also be joining Danaher’s global organization, where 80,000 people wake up every day determined to help our customers win. As an associate, you’ll try new things, work hard, and advance your skills with guidance from dedicated leaders, all with the support of powerful Danaher Business System tools and the stability of a tested organization.

Title: Software Developer II
Job_Description:
At ChemTreat, we understand and respect the awe-inspiring power of water to impact industries, and to sustain and enhance lives. Our 2,000 associates across North and South America maximize this power for our customers—from power producers to food and beverage companies to the automotive industry.

When you join the nation's largest and fastest growing specialty chemical company dedicated solely to industrial water treatment, you’ll work side-by-side with those customers, helping them save millions of dollars and grow their businesses, all while protecting people and the environment. Our “whatever-it-takes” mindset allows us to turn our 50 years of experience and innovative thinking into meaningful outcomes for our customers—and rewarding careers for our people.

ChemTreat is proud to be one of Danaher's Water Quality companies . Motivated by the highest possible stakes of climate change and global health, we’re working together within a rapidly digitizing industry to find innovative technologies that guarantee the safety of our water and our environment.

https://wi.st/3vH5OUK


The Business Intelligence Developer will be instrumental on the development implementation of (BI) solutions, using Power BI that provides timely, accurate, and meaningful information to key users and decision makers across the company so they can effectively analyze business patterns and trends and make informed decisions. This involves gathering and understanding business needs and rules and documenting business requirements.

What Will I Be Doing?
Capture business, technical and operational requirements and create/communicate Cloud/Business Intelligence solution options (e.g., visualizations, etc.).
Applies Cloud/BI best industry practices to successfully design, build and implement solutions to meet the needs of the business.
Review Cloud/BI designs to ensure compliance with corporate objectives for data security, integrity, quality, performance, management, scalability, and reliability.
Develop quality control measures, testing measures, and the accuracy of data standards and consistency to support deployment of solutions for the businesses and IT.
Responsible for prototyping solutions, preparing test scripts, and conducting tests and for extraction, loading, cleansing, and data modeling for Cloud/BI solutions.

What Makes Me Qualified?
Four-year degree in Engineering , Information Science or equivalent. Master’s degree preferred.
Know how to integrate with different data sources
Strong understanding experience with Power Platform (e.g., Power BI, Power Automate, Power App)
Understand Data Modeling, Data Warehousing and Data Mart (dimension and fact tables) concepts and best practices
Work history of successful software design on API and Microservice based architecture
Strong analytical, problem-solving and metadata skills.
Advanced SQL, DBMS and NoSQL databases skills
Hands-on DAX experience

What Makes Me Stand Out?
Familiarity with AWS and Azure Cloud Services
Business acumen - Ability to obtain essential information about a situation, focus on the key objectives, recognize the feasible options, select an appropriate course of action and set in motion an implementation plan to execute solutions that include buy-in from stakeholders.
Excellent analytic skills - Ability to capture relevant information from VOC sessions and conversations with stakeholders or identify gaps independently; and ability to break down complex situations into discrete steps and/or the concrete tasks necessary to solve problems.
Customer focused - They take a personal interest and have a passion for meeting internal or external customers’ business needs. This means being fully available to the customer and becoming the advocate of customer issues within the organization.

What Makes This Opportunity Exciting?!
You will receive our comprehensive benefits package starting on the first day of employment
Flexible scheduling that allows work/life balance
Unlimited growth opportunity
You get to be a part of an innovative environment!

The salary range for this role is 93-112K. This is the range that we in good faith believe is the range of possible compensation for this role at the time of this posting. We may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range and this range is only applicable for jobs to be performed in Colorado. This range may be modified in the future.
This job is also eligible for bonus/incentive pay.
We offer comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off, medical/dental/vision insurance and 401(k) to eligible employees.
You can apply for this role through the Careers Page at https://jobs.danaher.com/global/en/ (or through the Workday “Find Jobs” function if you are a current employee)

Title: Software Developer II
Job_Description:
Wondering what’s within Beckman Coulter Diagnostics? Take a closer look.

At first glance, you’ll see that for more than 80 years we’ve been dedicated to advancing and optimizing the laboratory to move science and healthcare forward. Join a team where you can be heard, be supported, and always be yourself. We’re building a culture that celebrates backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives of all our associates. Look again and you’ll see we are invested in you, providing the opportunity to build a meaningful career, be creative, and try new things with the support you need to be successful.

Beckman Coulter Diagnostics is proud to work alongside a community of six fellow Diagnostics Companies at Danaher. Together, we’re working at the pace of change to improve patient lives with diagnostic tools that address the world’s biggest health challenges.

The Business Applications Analyst – IT for Beckman Coulter Diagnostics is responsible for supporting and improving the Logistics and Distribution Oracle and bolt-on systems which execute the shipping processes.

This position is part of the Information Technology (IT) Department located in Hebron, Kentucky and will be on-site at Beckman Coulter, our vision is to relentlessly reimagine healthcare, one diagnosis at a time.

You will be a part of the Operations Information Systems (OIS) team and report to the Senior Business Applications IT Manager responsible for Logistics & Distribution + Manufacturing. If you thrive in a complex environment role and want to work to build a world-class Logistics and Distribution organization—read on.


Identify and solve complex technical and operational problems related to Logistics & Distribution and Manufacturing in environment with highly integration shipping conveyors, robotic pick cell, and picking systems such as Pick & Put.

Drive system implementations through coordination with Business Operations teams to understand gaps, opportunities, and enhancements. Ability to translate those Operational requests into technical solutions within Oracle and related system tools is important.

Develop detailed and comprehensive test plans, unit test systems and coordinate testing with the business users for the unit tests, System Integration Tests (SIT) and User Acceptance Tests (UAT).

Drive standardization of Business Process and System flow documents, functional specifications, and system design specifications along with Oracle configuration documentation while recognizing the broader impact across modules, regions, and functions.

Manage implementation and support of Oracle EBS modules like Oracle WMS, Mobile Applications (MSCA), INV, OTM/GTM, shipping, transportation, and manufacturing.

Research current technologies to drive transformation in our Supply Chain, utilizing digital technologies like Oracle ECC, RPA, AI, and Predictive Analytics.

Value Stream Mapping, Standard Work, 5S, Kanban & Practical Problem Solving.


Bachelor’s degree with 9+ years experience OR Master’s degree with 7+ years in field experience OR Doctoral degree in field with 4+ years experience.

Implementation experience in Logistics systems like Oracle WMS, Mobile Applications (MSCA), INV, OTM/GTM, Shipping, Parcel Execution systems

Strong knowledge of Logistics and Distribution processes and shipping operations in a large warehouse with integrated software and hardware systems.

Technical skills, including writing SQL queries, using TOAD/SQL Developer

Confident and practiced ability to communicate with business/operations staff of all levels (warehouse to directors) to support their needs in daily operation, small and large enhancement projects.

At Varian, a Siemens Healthineers Company, we bring together the world's best talent to realize our vision of a world without fear of cancer. Together, we work passionately to develop and deliver easy-to-use, efficient oncology solutions.

Title: Software Developer II
Job_Description:
A wholly owned subsidiary of Danaher Corporation (NYSE: DHR), Sea-Bird Scientific ( www.seabird.com ) is headquartered in Bellevue, Washington. Sea-Bird Scientific is the world’s largest developer and manufacturer of products for the measurement of salinity, temperature, pressure, dissolved oxygen, fluorescence, nutrients and related oceanographic parameters in marine waters. We offer products to support best-in-class oceanography and climate science. We offer an entrepreneurial environment that is team-centered, customer-driven, quality-focused, and growth-oriented.

Working at Sea-Bird Scientific gives you access to a robust career development process and challenging stretch opportunities. Sea-Bird Scientific is proud to be one of Danaher's Water Quality companies . Through strong customer partnerships, the water platform advances the quality and delivery of water. Want to help us in this mission?

About the Role:
This role provides high quality repair and preventative maintenance services and new instruments for Sea-Bird Scientific equipment.

We are looking for an Operation Technician that utilizes an advanced understanding of electronic theory and mechanical aptitude to troubleshoot and/or repair instrumentation and components. The Operation Technician will also identify process inefficiencies, recommend solutions, and implement corrective actions leading to continuous improvement.

What Will I Be Doing?
Follow detailed assembly instructions in a variety of formats (i.e, drawings, schematics, bills of material, internal procedures or some combination thereof), and report work completed on a daily basis to ensure that all services are completed efficiently, on time, and correctly according to specifications
Provide advanced diagnostic and troubleshooting of instrumentation in a structured and logical manner, and integrate any learnings into work instructions on multiple instrument platforms that will help identify potential improvements to workflow or opportunities that benefit the customer
Perform advanced repairs and services including soldering, wiring, replacing damaged components and effectively use escalation paths and relationship networks within Sea-Bird for difficult repairs or services
Perform hydrostatic pressure tests and water bath testing, as required.
Coordinate efforts with other team members to meet daily, weekly and monthly targets and departmental goals and to understand and meet quality and delivery requirements
Lead or co-lead Kaizen events to meet customer need

Am I Qualified?
2 years technical degree in Electronics, military technical training, or equivalent work experience
3-5 years related experience in a manufacturing or service environment
Demonstrates advanced level of mechanical aptitude
Ability to read and interpret basic drawings, schematic and wiring diagrams
Demonstrated strong knowledge of and ability to solder, use of power supplies, digital multimeters, and oscilloscopes
Ability to use Microsoft Office Suite, Oracle experience required.
Ability to learn and use scientific and/or plotting software

What Makes This Opportunity Exciting?
We offer full flexible and comprehensive benefits to help meet the needs of today's varied lifestyles starting day one!
Lots of independence with a supportive team and manager!
Comprehensive training that includes on-the-job mentorship through more senior coworkers
You get to be a part of making a difference in the environment!

When you join us, you’ll also be joining Danaher’s global organization, where 80,000 people wake up every day determined to help our customers win. As an associate, you’ll try new things, work hard, and advance your skills with guidance from dedicated leaders, all with the support of powerful Danaher Business System tools and the stability of a tested organization.

Title: Software Developer II
Job_Description:
Do you want to help advance scientific discovery, improving quality of life around the world? We do, too.
Molecular Devices has the opportunity to be the innovation partner that empowers scientists to fast-track research breakthroughs, leading to earlier diagnoses and safer drug treatments. We’re a dynamic, female-led life science solutions provider of high-performance bioanalytical measurement systems, software, and consumables. With Molecular Devices, you’ll grow your career with best-in-class teams in a culture of collaboration engagement, diversity, and inclusion.
Molecular Devices is proud to work alongside a community of nine fellow Danaher Life Sciences companies. Together, we’re pioneering the future of science and medicine, developing products that enable researchers in the fight to save lives.

Job Summary:
Our innovative analytical solutions for cell and protein biology empower scientists to achieve landmark discoveries. We are looking for a successful software engineer, someone with agile software skills and knowledge of technology and instrumentation used in research laboratories . The successful candidate will drive product development to further grow the strategic position of Molecular Devices, and will report to the Engineering Manager.
Duties and Responsibilities
Our innovative analytical solutions for cell and protein biology empower scientists to achieve landmark discoveries.
Adhere to high-quality development principles while delivering solutions timely and on-budget.
Guide team development efforts towards successful project delivery.
Collaborate with other software developers, business analysts and software architects to plan, design, develop, test, and maintain web- and desktop-based image analysis applications.
Write proof of concept code for quick demonstration.
Analyze and resolve technical and application problems.
Assess opportunities for application and process improvement and prepare documentation of rationale to share with team members and other affected part and provide technical leadership.
This is an Evergreen Requisition for posting.


Master Degree in Computer Science or related field
Strong understanding of JavaScript design patterns and MV* frameworks (Angular, Typescript, D3, Highcharts, FabricJS, Node)
7+ years’ experience with strong Angular skills
Experience in leading projects while being hands on


Experience with image processing technologies such as WebGL/ITK/VTK/WASM
Comprehensive understanding of object-oriented and service-oriented application development techniques, best practices and theories.
Knowledge of REST fundamentals, Java, Spring and Python
Cloud experience and understanding of Big-Data Cloud Scalability

Title: Software Developer II
Job_Description:
Scope AR is the pioneer of enterprise-class augmented reality solutions, delivering the industry’s only cross-platform AR tools for getting workers the knowledge they need, when they need it. The company is revolutionizing the way enterprises work and collaborate by offering AR tools that provide more effective and efficient knowledge-sharing to conduct complex remote tasks, employee training, product and equipment assembly, maintenance and repair, field and customer support, and more.

The company’s device-agnostic technology supports smartphones, tablets and wearables, making it easy for leading organizations like Johnson & Johnson, Danaher, Lockheed Martin, Honeywell, and others to leverage AR as a new way to scale their organizations globally, with greater efficiency.

Working at Scope AR provides you the opportunity to have a real and major impact on the way products around the globe get created and how work gets done.

Title: Software Developer II
Job_Description:
A wholly owned subsidiary of Danaher Corporation (NYSE: DHR), Sea-Bird Scientific ( www.seabird.com ) is headquartered in Bellevue, Washington. Sea-Bird Scientific is the world’s largest developer and manufacturer of products for the measurement of salinity, temperature, pressure, dissolved oxygen, fluorescence, nutrients and related oceanographic parameters in marine waters. We offer products to support best-in-class oceanography and climate science. We offer an entrepreneurial environment that is team-centered, customer-driven, quality-focused, and growth-oriented.

About the Role:
We are looking for a Calibration Technician that will utilize a variety of hand and power tools, fixtures, jigs, test equipment and work instructions to correlate the readings of specific instruments to those of a known standard that checks for accuracy and/or drift.

What Will I Be Doing?

Use proprietary software to view daily work assignments, begin and end calibrations, track instrument data, and track equipment performance

Operate hardware such as manual deadweight pressure testers, hydraulic pressure testers, ovens, chillers, calibration bath hardware, pressure vessels, etc.

Interpret calibration results and evaluate sensor performance without oversight while recognizing and driving root cause analysis on sensor or system failures.

Understand and meet quality and delivery requirements

Provide hands-on job function training to coworkers as needed

Participate in Kaizen events

Will also cross-train with other areas and may be responsible for transporting and maintaining units on storage shelves, collecting data and information from other areas, and participating in daily organizational meetings.

Am I Qualified?

2 year technical degree or equivalent experience

1-3 years of related work experience

Excellent electro-mechanical skills, including troubleshooting

Excellent attention to detail, and ability to perform precise procedures consistently

Knowledge of necessary instruments and tool

Ability to read and follow internal procedures in English

Ability to collect data, and establish facts in support of projects or troubleshooting efforts

What Makes Me Stand Out?
Demonstrated knowledge of Metrology
Ability to be a team player
Ability to be a self motivator
High computer skills

Title: Software Developer II
Job_Description:
This position is located onsite at the company location in Bellevue, WA.

About Sea-Bird Scientific

A wholly owned subsidiary of Danaher Corporation (NYSE: DHR), Sea-Bird Scientific ( www.seabird.com ) is headquartered in Bellevue, Washington. Sea-Bird Scientific is the world’s largest developer and manufacturer of products for the measurement of salinity, temperature, pressure, dissolved oxygen, fluorescence, nutrients and related oceanographic parameters in marine waters. We offer products to support best-in-class oceanography and climate science. We offer an entrepreneurial environment that is team-centered, customer-driven, quality-focused, and growth-oriented.

Working at Sea-Bird Scientific gives you access to a robust career development process and challenging stretch opportunities. Sea-Bird Scientific is proud to be one of Danaher's Water Quality companies . Through strong customer partnerships, the water platform advances the quality and delivery of water. Want to help us in this mission?


This is an exciting opportunity to make a significant impact in improving and sustaining our oceanographic instruments that are vital to improving our understanding of the oceans and our climate! You will optimize the design, manufacturability, and testing processes for Sea-Bird Scientific’s products. These complex products are designed to be deployed in the ocean for a variety of uses and withstand harsh environments while maintaining accuracy in data collection to support oceanographic research and the scientific community.

We are looking for a smart, innovative, and high-energy mechanical engineer who is driven to continuously improve our ability to deliver market leading technology with a focus on quality, reliability, and performance.


Improve DFM in all points of production
Develop innovative solutions to existing design constraints through redesign efforts to capture VAVE/Scrap savings
Collect appropriate data to define, identify, analyze, and improve manufacturing throughput and product quality.
Support Manufacturing in optimizing the design of fixture/tools for the ease of manufacturing and cost optimization
Supports Engineering team to sustain existing products per program and resource needs.
Performs troubleshooting, diagnoses and resolves problems to component, module level, or system level.
Develop test plans and conduct in-house and field testing that cover the expected customer use environment and operation conditions.
Analyze and develop system and sub-system requirements and relationships with component specifications
Interact with machine shops and vendors throughout the design cycle for optimizing the design from manufacturability and cost stand points
Generation of Engineering Change Orders (change to the existing designs or introducing new designs plus V&V and release).
Generation of Verification and Validation test protocols (Software, Hardware and System) and the execution of the test cases.

Qualifications
Degree in Mechanical, Manufacturing, or Systems Engineering - (BS + 2 yrs exp, MS + 1 yrs exp).
1+ years’ experience in mechanical engineering or related manufacturing engineering field
Hands on experience with either Mechanical or Electrical testing
SolidWorks experience, modeling and GD&T (other computer-added design software tools)
Understanding of fabrication methods and design constraints
Proficient with Microsoft Office applications (mainly Word, Excel)


Electrical-mechanical, process improvement, machining, or DFM background
Some software/programming experience is a plus (C, C++, python, Matlab)

Purpose statement:
The Software Developer II provides development and maintenance services for Enterprise class Manufacturing Execution Systems. This position includes requirements definition, analysis, development, testing, implementation, and support to deliver benefits to the organization, its customers, and other business partners.


Perform software development activities using established development practices, following design and coding standards, code reviews, code versioning, continuous builds, unit/integration testing, & deployments.
Provide technical expertise and recommendations in assessing new IT software projects and initiatives to support and enhance our existing software systems
Provides Software Developer I associates with mentorship, guidance, and training on IT standard work
Actively coordinates with Business Analysts and stakeholders to assist in the creation of system design and functional specifications for new development projects and building consistent and dependable solutions using knowledge of best practices and business processes. Will provide assistance and advice to business users in the effective use of applications and information technology
Investigate and resolve application functionality, root cause analysis, related issues, and provide support/troubleshooting of our software systems


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or MIS. (Preferred)


Minimum of 3 years of experience in a software development group (Required)
Experience with enterprise software applications including Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services (AWS), Google Cloud, C# or other .NET applications
Must be highly organized and have the ability to maintain several projects at one time. May lead small projects with manageable risks and resource requirements.
Must be able to interact in a professional manner with customers, employees, and all levels of management
Ability to analyze situations accurately, utilizing a variety of analytical techniques in order to make well informed decisions.


Generous Paid Time Off Accruals
16 Hours PAID Volunteer Time Off
10 Paid Holidays
Up to eight (8) weeks of 100% paid parental leave to eligible U.S. associates
401(k) with Company Match
Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance Options

Title: Software Developer II
Job_Description:
Do you want to help advance scientific discovery, improving quality of life around the world? We do, too.
Molecular Devices has the opportunity to be the innovation partner that empowers scientists to fast-track research breakthroughs, leading to earlier diagnoses and safer drug treatments. We’re a dynamic, female-led life science solutions provider of high-performance bioanalytical measurement systems, software, and consumables. With Molecular Devices, you’ll grow your career with best-in-class teams in a culture of collaboration engagement, diversity, and inclusion.
Molecular Devices is proud to work alongside a community of nine fellow Danaher Life Sciences companies. Together, we’re pioneering the future of science and medicine, developing products that enable researchers in the fight to save lives.

Job Summary:
Our innovative analytical solutions for cell and protein biology empower scientists to achieve landmark discoveries. We are looking for a successful software engineer, someone with agile software skills and knowledge of technology and instrumentation used in research laboratories . The successful candidate will drive product development to further grow the strategic position of Molecular Devices, and will report to the Engineering Manager.
Duties and Responsibilities
Our innovative analytical solutions for cell and protein biology empower scientists to achieve landmark discoveries.
Adhere to high-quality development principles while delivering solutions timely and on-budget.
Guide team development efforts towards successful project delivery.
Collaborate with other software developers, business analysts and software architects to plan, design, develop, test, and maintain web- and desktop-based image analysis applications.
Write proof of concept code for quick demonstration.
Analyze and resolve technical and application problems.
Assess opportunities for application and process improvement and prepare documentation of rationale to share with team members and other affected part and provide technical leadership.
This is an Evergreen Requisition for posting.


Master Degree in Computer Science or related field
Strong understanding of JavaScript design patterns and MV* frameworks (Angular, Typescript, D3, Highcharts, FabricJS, Node)
7+ years’ experience with strong Angular skills
Experience in leading projects while being hands on


Experience with image processing technologies such as WebGL/ITK/VTK/WASM
Comprehensive understanding of object-oriented and service-oriented application development techniques, best practices and theories.
Knowledge of REST fundamentals, Java, Spring and Python
Cloud experience and understanding of Big-Data Cloud Scalability
#LI-DR1

Title: Software Developer II
Job_Description:
Our vision is to transform the customer experience with industry leading self-service digital tools driven by rich data. We need your help to build and maintain our database and enable best in class solutions with data. You are responsible for executing a structured approach to the collection, creation, and maintenance of master product data in our content management and PIM system supporting the Business and digital team of Hengstler-Dynapar in the EMEA and US region. You will be a Power User responsible for the integrity of the organization’s master product data systems. You will drive data integrity through data governance, change management, data ownership, and quality assurance.

You will be accountable for maintaining and managing the product information in our content management and PIM systems. You will work Business and digital team of Hengstler-Dynapar. to ensure data is available to be consumed by customer facing systems such as online systems including website, ecommerce and site search systems and offline assets such as product datasheets and catalogs. You will also partner with internal subject matter experts such as product management and engineering to understand key attributes for all product types, collect and implement attribute data for all SKUs.

This is a remote role with limited travel


Be the Power User and advocate the use of centralized data/PIM platform
Acquire and maintain product data from multiple data sources. Manages and executes data requests in support of business processes, new product sales initiatives
Drives excellence and ensures continuous improvement in quality of data through cleansing and best practices for data construction
Make data available for use in CMS and front-end website systems by partnering with web developers, agencies, and IT
Reports KPIs related to material master data management and drives a system of actions to complete requests in accordance with Data management process
Understand, adapt, and improve document management process to enable more efficient data updates and partner with stakeholders to establish standards, governance, and system administration where no processes are in place
Upload images and product documents into asset management system with all necessary metadata to maintain system search standards
Create, review, edit, and upload product content/media with a goal of achieving complete and quality data for all product groups
Works collaboratively as a data steward within teams to ensure clear understanding of business requirements that are managed in concert with PIM data
Work with regional teams to ensure that data translations are completed within the required timeframe and to a high standard.

Support and train stakeholders and local users on centralized data platform


Bachelor’s degree and at least 2 years of experience in e-commerce or PIM systems with a strong track record in working in ecommerce/digital space. Preference given to previous experience with major PIM solutions such as Akeneo, Salsify or Perfion.

Fortive is a diversified industrial growth company comprised of global businesses that are recognized leaders in attractive markets. With more than $6 billion in annual revenues, Fortive’s well-known brands hold leading positions in field instrumentation, transportation, sensing, product realization, automation and specialty, and franchise distribution.

Fortive is headquartered in Everett, Washington and employs a team of more than 24,000 research and development, manufacturing, sales, distribution, service and administrative employees in more than 40 countries around the world. Our team grows by tackling challenges that accelerate progress and further their careers. With a culture rooted in continuous improvement, the core of our company’s operating model is the Fortive Business System. For more information please visit: www.fortive.com .

The position is with Specialty Product Technologies (SPT). Specialty Product Technologies (SPT) has grown to be a global leader as a core technology company comprised of several strong product lines. SPT designs, manufactures, and markets innovative products, services, and technologies to deliver manufacturing/operational efficiencies, cost-effective solutions, and high-quality products demanded by today’s industrial automation marketplace.

Every SPT product line has earned a “best in class” reputation and has been built on a solid foundation of achievement over a long period of time with proven reliability in the most rigorous and demanding applications. Each product line is considered essential components in the markets and applications they serve.

Founded in 1901 as the Veeder Manufacturing Company, the company joined the Danaher portfolio in 1986 and has continued to grow. Today, SPT is part of the Fortive Corporation. The SPT product lines encompass the solid brands of Eagle Signal, Joslyn Clark, Namco Controls, Superior Electric, Thomson Nyliner, and Veeder-Root. SPT product lines can be found in a wide variety of applications and industries.
We Are an Equal Opportunity Employer

We value and encourage diversity and solicit applications from all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, age, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or other characteristics protected by law. Fortive and all Fortive Companies are also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for applicants with disabilities. Title: Staff Software Engineer
Job_Description:
Qualitative UX Researcher

This position is located at our Loveland, Colorado location. It is a hybrid position where you can work part-time at the Company location identified above and part-time remotely from your home.

About Hach:
Our work at Hach ensures water quality for people around the world. Our customer partnerships, passionate experts, and reliable, easy-to-use solutions make water analysis better—faster, simpler, greener, and more informative. As a member of our team, you’ll get to make an immediate, measurable impact on a global scale, within industries from aviation to manufacturing to mining. You’ll also be part of an environment that fosters career growth and professional development, with kindness at its core. And you’ll be part of our mission, which drives us to develop water quality solutions that protect the health and safety of all living things.
Overview

Are you curious, empathetic, and interested in understanding how and why people use new devices and technologies? Are you good at talking to customers and helping get to the bottom of why they like or hate a product? Do you care and think critically about how human interaction matters in product design?

Hach values the user experience, and the UX Team is focused on building highly efficient, high-value experiences. We’re iterative in our research, our leadership takes time to help grow your UX career, and we attend regular training to increase our collective UX knowledge.

If this inspires you, then you should consider becoming our newest team member.
Responsibilities

We need an agile Qualitative User Experience Researcher who will move quickly to provide insight which inspires and helps us deliver amazing end-to-end products and experiences.

Our culture moves and iterates fast! Your creativity, dexterity, and ability to be an amazing partner across all disciplines of design, engineering, data science, market research, planning, and other project teams across Hach will enable your success.


Knows the strengths and weaknesses of different user research methods, and when to apply them
Exceptional behavioral data-collection and analysis skills, e.g., designing, conducting, and analyzing all kinds of user data.
Can objectively observe, interact with, and collect data from users, e.g. interviews, user testing, etc.
Able to distill research findings into actionable insights for product development
Comfortable with fast-paced work environment and responsibilities for multiple projects at any given time.
Excellent writing, communication, presentation, interpersonal, and analytical skills; the ability to communicate complex concepts clearly and persuasively across different audiences and varying levels of the organization.
Qualifications
2+ years’ experience as a researcher on an end-to-end product - creating research agendas and schedules, defining and tracking user experience goals and metrics, driving execution on projects, and managing the work of additional resources.
Hands-on experience with user testing, field research, survey design, online user research and experimentation tools, or usage data analysis.
Experience with a broad range of research methodologies (qualitative and quantitative techniques) and the right balance between the two.
The ability to work in front-end generative spaces as well as throughout product development that involves more iterative, rapid, and evaluative methods.
A BA/BS in a research related field with significant academic or industry experience are a huge plus!. A MA/MS or PhD in psychology, human factors, HCI, behavioral science or related field preferred.


Leadership skills to influence across and up the organization to bring customer empathy and understanding to the table.
Strong oral and written communication skills; experience presenting to executive-level audiences; proven track record of bringing clarity to messy data stories.
A true advocate for the design of inclusive and excellent user experiences for customers
Demonstrated ability to visualize and present rich research data simply and clearly.
A track record of moving beyond data by translating customer needs, behavior, and insights into user requirements, and work with engineers, program managers, and designers to develop specs that achieve an intuitive and usable experience for customers.
Strong aptitude for learning new technologies and demonstrated agility and flexibility in decision making and the way you work. You demonstrate an openness and growth mindset in all that you do
Comfortable working in ambiguous product areas, informing new opportunity spaces and high value customer experiences


Experience with Atlassian Suite


The salary range for this role is 95K - 115K. This is the range that we in good faith believe is the range of possible compensation for this role at the time of this posting. We may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range and this range is only applicable for jobs to be performed in Colorado. This range may be modified in the future.
This job is also eligible for bonus/incentive pay.
We offer comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off, medical/dental/vision insurance and 401(k) to eligible employees.
You can apply for this role through the Careers Page at https://jobs.danaher.com/global/en/ (or through the Workday “Find Jobs” function if you are a current employee)
No amount of pay is considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable. The amount and availability of any bonus, commission, benefits, or any other form of compensation and benefits that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company’s sole discretion, consistent with the law.

When you join us, you’ll also be joining Danaher’s global organization, where 80,000 people wake up every day determined to help our customers win. As an associate, you’ll try new things, work hard, and advance your skills with guidance from dedicated leaders, all with the support of powerful Danaher Business System tools and the stability of a tested organization.

Title: Staff Software Engineer
Job_Description:
What We Value

We believe that real breakthroughs come from teams that think big and respect each other’s differences – different ideas, different perspectives, and different experiences. We encourage all voices to be heard, both internally as we collaborate and externally as we listen to our customers’ most pressing needs. And we would love to have you on this journey with us!

The Director of User Experience will be responsible for setting up Videojet’s first User Experience organization. As the industry continues to evolve, Videojet wants to continue to offer our customers a best-in-class user experience, inclusive of both user interface and user aspects of product design. To do this, we will augment our existing engineering and product organizations with dedicated, trained, and experienced user experience professionals. The Director will be primarily responsible for executing this vision by acting as the chief customer advocate for the design of our products. In the first year, this will include designing processes and systems for the UX organization that ensures successful cross-functional collaboration, designing the right organizational structure and then bringing on top talent to fill the new team. What defines success in the role?

This role is a unique opportunity to be the leading figure and driving force for the creation of a new user experience program for hardware and software at Videojet, including both new and established products. Fundamentally, success in this role is developing a consistently best-in-class user experience across all our customer segments that drives meaningful sustainable differentiation for Videojet that fuels our accelerated growth.


Be the User Experience thought leader for Videojet with an evangelist mindset that brings customer user experience to the forefront of all Videojet product innovation
Be skilled at understanding customer workflows, and then designing product workflows that adapt to the customer, rather than the other way around
Develop Videojet’s User Experience playbook, leveraging industry and Danaher best practices while owning continuous improvement of this playbook; apply these processes in a way that keeps the team nimble and successful in a culture that values moving fast and iterating quickly
Assess technologies, innovations and competitive products to identify new ways to promote UX design into our products and solutions
Work collaboratively with project core team members throughout the development process including engineers, product managers, project managers, technical support, and many more to ensure technical specifications meet customer needs
Lead continuous customer validation throughout the technology and product development process to ensure that the product being developed will deliver a compelling value proposition to the customer
Tell the customers’ stories and strategic implications to the Senior Leadership Team to drive Videojet product and corporate strategy and resourcing decisions The candidate will visibly embody the following traits:

Interpersonal and interviewing skills to establish rapport and connect with customers
Multicultural awareness allowing them to work well with customers and associates throughout the world across multiple time zones
Works effectively in matrixed organizations, showing the right balance between conviction of key ideas and sufficient flexibility to adapt to change
Able to influence without direct authority; strong negotiation, collaboration and influence management skills
Ability to communicate, demonstrate and prioritize the value of UX design decisions to key project stakeholders
Ability to explain and get buy-in on abstract design concepts and rationale, both verbally and visually Requirements:

Degree in related field, such as Human Factors Engineering, Information Architecture, Interactive Design, Cognitive Science, or equivalent.
Work experience - 10+ years as a key user experience designer, with some of that experience as a people manager, and some being with industrial products
Experience working on multiple product platforms and multiple simultaneous projects, ensuring teams can stay focused on creating an amazing experience for customers
Strong skills in rapid prototyping and iterative design process
Expert knowledge in interface design standards and best practices
Mastery of UX design processes and methodologies including building tools such as personas, usage scenarios, user flows, sitemaps, wireframes and style guides
Mastery of prototype/mockup methods and tools
Level of travel required. Moderate (As high as 25-40%) across the globe; including regular visits to Videojet Headquarters in Illinois, as well as visits to customers and R&D design centers Our Offer

We grow talent; we give you the opportunity to develop your career based on your strengths. Videojet is a career destination for engaged, passionate and hardworking people who are driven to seek innovation, growth and opportunity.

A career with Videojet will push you and challenge you, providing growth opportunities and the prospects to advance your career. If you are a driven high achiever, you will work with committed, like-minded people, giving you the support to reach your full potential. At Danaher, your potential is amplified. Our culture of continuous improvement defines who we are, drives our success, and translates to a career without limits for our team of 65,000 intellectually curious associates.
Danaher Corporation and all Danaher Companies are equal opportunity employers that evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, age, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other characteristics protected by law. The “EEO is the Law” poster is available here .

As an associate, you’ll try new things, work hard, and advance your skills with guidance from dedicated leaders, all with the support of powerful Danaher Business System tools and the stability of a tested organization.

Facilities Technician
FULL-TIME
$28/hr
POSITION SUMMARY:

Responsible for general facility maintenance including installation, troubleshooting, and maintenance of production equipment, to include preventive and predictive maintenance techniques.
Provide or request purchased tools and equipment as authorized.
ORD-04 WS-04

Title: Sr. Manager of Software Engineering
Job_Description:
Want to lead a team of experienced Project & Program Managers for the development of new technological products in the Aerospace Industry? The Director, PMO is responsible for the Aerospace BU Project Management Office.

Responsibilities include leading the NPI & NPD projects teams, the coordination and completion of the project’s portfolio on time, within budget, while monitoring and controlling risks and project’s scope. The Director, PMO makes decisions on project activities to balance scope, schedule, and cost while keeping in mind the strategic impact to the business and the company’s priorities. Oversee all aspects of assigned projects, set deadlines to meet the master schedule, assign responsibilities and hold team members accountable; communicate with the customer and internal stakeholders, and monitor and control progress of projects.

This position is part of the Aerospace PMO Department and will be located remotely (UK or USA based).


Oversee profitable growth with the customer in mind throughout project execution.

Manage international teams assigned to support the portfolio and project teams with business strategy.

Collaborate with all functions to leverage project execution and capture strategies and resources through the design and manufacturing phases of the projects in the portfolio.

Grow relationships in the customer community and with large industry primes to service existing projects and find new and unique ways to deploy our technology and services to meet customer needs.

Ensure effective contract management of our contracts that balances financial, operational, commercial and technical risks appropriately for both customer and Pall Aerospace interests.

Establishes governance structure that identifies key performance indicators, sets milestones, and establishes a reporting cadence

Proactively identifies and resolves issues and makes recommendations for continuous improvements to existing processes

Ensures that the product management process abides by all defined cross-discipline standards and all compliance and regulatory requirements

Provide consistent leadership to the Project Management to ensure effective and efficient execution of assigned projects

Drive an engaging team culture through to achieve delivery of distinctively high-quality products and services; to include performance, reliability, cost and on-time delivery.

Identify and close skill gaps within the team while also guiding and mentoring the team.

Lead Performance and Development Process for all direct reports, including providing coaching and development opportunities that will allow everyone’s potential to be maximized.

Drive the annual engagement survey as well as leads the execution of follow up activities, both for the organization as well as with people leaders.

Apply DBS Processes

Develop and continuously improve processes, including all relevant tools from the DBS Growth and Leadership domains.

Link business needs and opportunities to DBS and develop a roadmap to close gaps, install/improve process, and sustain results.

Actively manage a DBS kaizen funnel to provide visibility of events, focus on gap closure, and sustainment. Schedule, charter, and facilitate events according to the phases of this funnel.

Directly provide formal and informal DBS training and coaching. Augment with additional resources (DBSO, outside resources) where applicable, and improve DBS training and facilitation by pursuing certification in DBS tools for yourself and others.


Bachelor’s degree in business or related engineering discipline. MBA preferred.

PMP or equivalent certification required.

10+ years of Project management experience, with emphasis on support and sustainment programs.

7+ years people management experience, directly and indirectly leading organizations of 10 or more individuals, globally.

Danaher Business System (DBS) experience is a plus.



Experience with compiling, managing, and maintaining key documentation for projects.

Knowledge of the Global Aerospace Marketplace with experience ideally in filtration and separation processes or related discipline such as aircraft systems for fuel, hydraulics, air and/or lube.

Demonstrated track record leading large scale aerospace and Defense business capture efforts.

Knowledge of the regulatory and quality requirements for the Aerospace and Defense industry and customers.

Title: Sr. Manager of Software Engineering
Job_Description:
Aldevron is an industry pioneer with a core competency in manufacturing for gene and cell therapy. We supply high-quality plasmid DNA, mRNA and proteins to our clients, who are breaking new ground on the world’s most important and challenging solutions to benefit us all. We're looking for innovative, forward-thinking individuals who share our goals of advancing science and making an impact on the world.

Aldevron is proud to work alongside a community of nine fellow Danaher Life Sciences companies. Together, we’re pioneering the future of science and medicine, developing products that enable researchers in the fight to save lives.

This position is part of the Project Management Department located in Fargo, ND and will be hybrid. At Aldevron, we combine best-in-class products and service with the ideal operating environment to lay the groundwork for vital new discoveries worldwide. You will be a part of the Training and Enabelement Team and report to the Manager, Training and Enablement, Project Management, responsible for process improvements and training within the Project Management Department.


Lead, manage, and implement projects identified by the Project Management Leadership Team as critical need for the continued development of the Project Management team
Create accurate and effective project plans, including timelines and task ownership
Develop metrics to measure and continuously monitor success of initiatives
Assist in the development of and coordinate the Project Management onboarding process for new associates
Develop a set of SMEs within Project Management to effectively train new team members


Bachelor’s degree in Project Management or related field, or equivalent experience coordinating projects and/or training programs
Ability to teach, engage, and influence others
Demonstrated success supporting multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment


Project Management or Project Coordination
Training or Change Management

At Aldevron we believe in designing a better, more sustainable workforce. We recognize the benefits of flexible, hybrid working arrangements for eligible roles and are committed to providing enriching careers, no matter the work arrangement. This position is eligible for a hybrid work arrangement in which you can work part-time at the Company location identified above and part-time remotely from your home. Additional information about this hybrid work arrangement will be provided by your interview team. Explore the flexibility and challenge that working for Aldevron can provide.

When you join us, you’ll also be joining Danaher’s global organization, where 80,000 people wake up every day determined to help our customers win. Knows the strengths and weaknesses of different user research methods, and when to apply them
Exceptional behavioral data-collection and analysis skills, e.g., designing, conducting, and analyzing all kinds of user data.
Can objectively observe, interact with, and collect data from users, e.g. interviews, user testing, etc.
Able to distill research findings into actionable insights for product development
Comfortable with fast-paced work environment and responsibilities for multiple projects at any given time.
Excellent writing, communication, presentation, interpersonal, and analytical skills; the ability to communicate complex concepts clearly and persuasively across different audiences and varying levels of the organization.
Qualifications
2+ years’ experience as a researcher on an end-to-end product - creating research agendas and schedules, defining and tracking user experience goals and metrics, driving execution on projects, and managing the work of additional resources.
Hands-on experience with user testing, field research, survey design, online user research and experimentation tools, or usage data analysis.
Experience with a broad range of research methodologies (qualitative and quantitative techniques) and the right balance between the two.
The ability to work in front-end generative spaces as well as throughout product development that involves more iterative, rapid, and evaluative methods.
A BA/BS in a research related field with significant academic or industry experience are a huge plus!. A MA/MS or PhD in psychology, human factors, HCI, behavioral science or related field preferred.


Leadership skills to influence across and up the organization to bring customer empathy and understanding to the table.
Strong oral and written communication skills; experience presenting to executive-level audiences; proven track record of bringing clarity to messy data stories.
A true advocate for the design of inclusive and excellent user experiences for customers
Demonstrated ability to visualize and present rich research data simply and clearly.
A track record of moving beyond data by translating customer needs, behavior, and insights into user requirements, and work with engineers, program managers, and designers to develop specs that achieve an intuitive and usable experience for customers.
Strong aptitude for learning new technologies and demonstrated agility and flexibility in decision making and the way you work. You demonstrate an openness and growth mindset in all that you do
Comfortable working in ambiguous product areas, informing new opportunity spaces and high value customer experiences


Experience with Atlassian Suite

The Customer Communications Marketing Manager for Beckman Coulter is responsible to building the commercial communication strategy by bringing together a cross-functional, cross-portfolio team of colleagues and external vendors. Leading both strategic and tactical marketing programs, which are essential to meet our short- and long-term objectives of maximizing market access and sales performance, aligned with Beckman Coulter Diagnostic’s business.
You will be part of our dynamic North America Marketing team. If you thrive in a fast paced dynamic environment and want to work to promote our value proposition to the future of diagnostics healthcare – read on!


Create a comprehensive marketing communications plan to support Beckman Coulter’s commercial objectives that lead to competitive wins and increased market share.
Lead Challenger style communication throughout our commercial campaigns and messaging
Oversight of regional and national tradeshow strategy and execution in partnership with Marketing Directors, Sales and Global Marketing team.
In partnership with Leadership, plan and execute annual national sales and service meetings.
Create marketing programs and customer facing tools targeting C-Suite, key stakeholders: including committee members, executives, Clinical IT, procurement, medical directors
Identify forward thinking market trends and anticipate customer needs to shape the future of clinical laboratory. Leverage primary and secondary market research methodologies to identify market opportunities for growth and take action by creating solutions that meet customer needs today and in the future.
Manage and improve marketing assets to improve internal and external alignment and performance (SOW, Resource Management, Collateral Management, Newsletters, etc.) and manage the evidence-based materials (white papers, presentations, articles, events, webinars, tradeshows) which positions Beckman Coulter as the leader within market space.
Manage the marketing budget, relationships with agencies and consultants and a small team.


Bachelor’s Degree required with a minimum 9+ years of experience in related field (i.e. sales, national accounts, national accounts marketing, and sales training) OR Master’s Degree with 7+ years of experience. MBA/Master’s degree is preferred.
Demonstrated knowledge of US diagnostic / IVD industry and how such products are marketed and sold into US healthcare systems, GPOs, and in the distribution channel preferred.
Demonstrated ability to be a high-level contributor and lead multiple and complex projects, processes or functions and ability to influence and create change in an environment where the structure may evolve rapidly.
Ability to work in a large, matrixed organization with working knowledge of the principal areas and roles of Marketing, Sales, Service, Finance, Contracting and Business Development.
High energy, self-starter with a bias for action and sense of urgency; a ‘roll up their sleeves’ type individual who is able to get marketing and sales organization excited about corporate accounts strategy and messaging.
Demonstrated project management, problem solving and analytical skills with an ability to perform exceptionally well in a fast-paced and performance-oriented environment.
Strong interpersonal skills and communications style to develop confidence not only among associates and the Executive Team, as well as current and potential customers.
Willingness to travel 20% to 30% of the time.

The Senior Vulnerability Management Analyst for Beckman Coulter Diagnostics is responsible for managing projects and initiatives focused on reducing cyber security risk associated with system vulnerabilities across the enterprise.

This position is part of the Global Information Security team within IT located in Brea and will be fully remote. At Beckman Coulter, our vision is to relentlessly reimagine healthcare, one diagnosis at a time.

You will be a part of the Global Information Security team and report to the Senior Manager of Global Information Security responsible for managing projects and initiatives. If you thrive in an amazing cyber role and want to work to build a world-class cyber security organization organization—read on.


Lead cross-functional teams in vulnerability management projects and initiatives to design sustainable remediation procedures and address vulnerable systems

Partner with Danaher Vulnerability Management Team to define and measure progress while embedding vulnerability management across business system lifecycle management processes

Serve as subject matter expert for IT and business teams, providing analysis to help them understand remediation steps, impact, and prioritization

Maintain enterprise vulnerability scanning infrastructure, ensuring daily operation of scans and reporting are occurring as required

Prepare reports and presentations communicating risks and status to a diverse audience of technical staff and both IT and business leadership


Bachelor’s degree in related field with 5+ years of experience in Vulnerability Management, Cyber Security, or related IT work OR Master’s Degree with 3+ years of experience OR Doctoral degree in field with 0+ years experience.

Demonstrated success leading Vulnerability Management programs or remediation efforts

Proficiency with enterprise vulnerability management platforms such as Rapid7 Nexpose, Tenable Nessus, or Qualys

Skilled at analyzing IT/VM data sets using tools such as Excel or Power BI and presenting in a meaningful, digestible format for leadership teams


CISSP, GIAC/SANS, or similar certifications

Expertise with attack surface management platforms such as Cycognito, Xpanse, or RiskIQ

Good project management skills including effective schedule, resource, and risk management

Title: Sr. Manager of Software Engineering

Scope AR is the pioneer of enterprise-class augmented reality solutions, delivering the industry’s only cross-platform AR tools for getting workers the knowledge they need, when they need it. The company is revolutionizing the way enterprises work and collaborate by offering AR tools that provide more effective and efficient knowledge-sharing to conduct complex remote tasks, employee training, product and equipment assembly, maintenance and repair, field and customer support, and more.

Working at Scope AR provides you the opportunity to have a real and major impact on the way products around the globe get created and how work gets done.

Medical industry experience

Title: Sr. Manager of Software Engineering
Job_Description:
Find what drives you on a team with a more than 70-year history of discovery, determination, and innovation. As a global leader in high-tech filtration, separation, and purification, Pall Corporation thrives on helping our customers protect people. Our products serve a wide range of markets, so if your interests lie along the spectrum of Life Sciences to Industrial, you’ll find a rewarding role here. For the exponentially curious, Pall is a place you can thrive and amplify your impact on the world.

Pall is proud to work alongside a community of nine fellow Danaher Life Sciences companies. Together, we’re pioneering the future of science and medicine, developing products that enable researchers in the fight to save lives.

What you’ll do!
The Accelerator Process Development group at Pall specializes in designing, optimizing, and transferring scalable processes from pre-clinical to validated cGMP ready manufacturing. The team is seeking a highly motivated Laboratory Operations Assistant to coordinate the day-to-day lab operations, ensuring that client projects are progressing, and systems are set-up and maintained according to quality standards and SOPs. This includes, but not limited to, ordering laboratory supplies, calibration of laboratory equipment, maintenance of inventory database, and supporting both scientists and project managers.

Consistently perform a gap analysis on current standard work SOPS and propose areas for improvement to Sr. Managers.
Responsible for ordering, receiving, storage and distribution of all reagents, supplies, consumables, equipment, parts, paper, forms, and any other inventory item(s) related to the operation of the laboratory.
Ensures that the laboratory staff are aware of goods ordered, received, stored and coordinates the distribution of supplies within the laboratory on a daily basis.
Maintains the inventory database daily and perform bi-annual physical inventory of all laboratory inventory and supplies.
Maintains an efficient system of inventory control to ensure proper levels of supplies in the laboratory available for use while allowing for no wastage of inventory, reagents or products due to shelf storage expiration. This includes conducting inventory usage analysis and re-setting current min/max and re-order points, ensuring it aligns with team’s needs and future customer projects.
Provide weekly inventory updates and maintaining KPI related dashboards
Consistently evaluate inventory cost and participate in vendor negotiations on contract renewals
Maintain, evaluate, and improve on 6S standards of lab and storage areas and lab efficiency to optimize current capacity.
When directed, works with the lab operations team to evaluate and maintain service contracts for equipment ((Bioreactors, Chromatography Skids, TFF, Mixers, etc)
When directed, the candidate will initiate, coordinate and follow-up on all instrument preventative maintenance and emergency services. This may occasionally require after-hours phone calls and contacts with vendors as necessary.
The candidate shall assist in maintaining all equipment repair and maintenance records ensuring that all equipment maintenance occurs according to schedule as required.
The candidate will coordinate the shipment/receiving of client inventory or biological material.
Work closely with the laboratory team, project managers, facility, EH&S, and procurement staff.

Who you are!
Bachelor’s Degree or High School diploma with equivalent experience.
A minimum of one year of hands-on laboratory experience in a BSL-2 environment or related lab experience.
Ability to work independently coordinating laboratory logistics.
Demonstrated analytical, organizational, troubleshooting, and development skills with strong attention to detail.
Competency in computer skills and familiarity with Microsoft Office programs (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.) required.
A versatile problem solver! You do not give up easily, willingness to work within constantly changing priorities and you love to find creative ways to solve exciting problems through strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Succinct communicator with strong social skills, excellent collaboration, written and presentation skills.
Ability to work in a team environment and interact with various internal and external partners.


Knowledge of fundamental laboratory techniques.
Demonstrated experience with writing standard operating procedures.
Industry experience and knowledge of supply chain/logistics is a plus.

Provide guidance to junior associates

The primary role of the Quality Assurance Manager is to provide leadership and support of daily quality operations including complaint handling, CAPA, document control, training, inspection and product release activities. This position ensures that the business, product and processes meet all Quality and Regulatory standards and requirements. The Quality Assurance Manager will also be responsible for supporting the implementation and maintenance of an electronic Enterprise Quality Management System .

Major Responsibilities
Hire, develop, engage and retain highly capable QA team ensuring that each associate is meeting performance requirements and that each critical position has an identified successor with a targeted and robust development plan.
Oversee complaint handling and resolution, CAPA, document control, training, inspection and product release activities.
Increase associate engagement year-over-year by analyzing survey data, going to GEMBA with associates and developing and implementing robust and effective engagement plans.
Ensure that cross-functional teams and projects are staffed with qualified and skilled QA -associates who are ready users of Daily Management and who are strong and credible representatives of their discipline. When resource constraints exist, notify stakeholders and recommend countermeasures to ensure business needs are met.
Participate in Daily Management meetings and communicate to Leadership team effectively and timely on issues, risks and needs.
Plan, prioritize and coordinate workflow and cross-site/function interactions to ensure on time delivery of product and projects and compliance with quality systems /standards.
Ensure site audit readiness at all times through monitoring and learning from past audits, training and preparation of staff and mitigation of risks.

Required Education, Experience, Skills
Bachelor's degree or equivalent advanced degree in engineering, science, medical, or technical field and 5+ years' experience with increasing responsibility in medical device/IVD
Experience working within a medical device quality system in compliance with US FDA, ISO 13485 and EU MDR/IVDR regulations
Experience, within the last 5 years, in implementing a full eQMS software solution at site level with global interconnections
Experience leading teams of professionals in setting and achieving corporate and business objectives.
Proven experience in developing and implementing mining tools to monitor product complaint trends including defined control and/or action limits to detect emerging field issues
Track record of collaborating with technical groups to identify product improvement opportunities
Proven experience in providing strategic direction and leadership for CAPA Process resulting in successfully supporting the effective implementation, maintenance and improvement of the CAPA process including global solutions with business partners and across sites
Recent experience with quality impact of China regulation updates and proven experience of manufacturing requirements to meet China standards (strongly preferred)

Minimal

Job_Description:
