As a global leader in high-tech filtration, separation, and purification, Pall Corporation thrives on helping our customers protect people. Our products serve a wide range of markets, so if your interests lie along the spectrum of Life Sciences to Industrial, you’ll find a rewarding role here. For the exponentially curious, Pall is a place you can thrive and amplify your impact on the world.

Pall is proud to work alongside a community of nine fellow Danaher Life Sciences companies. Together, we’re pioneering the future of science and medicine, developing products that enable researchers in the fight to save lives.

Pall Corporation is seeking a extraordinary teammate to fill the position of an IT Infrastructure Analyst to work onsite at our location in New Port Richey Florida . This is an exciting opportunity to join a growing global organization, where you are the key to solving challenging user inquiries and infrastructure project initiatives. Being a hero to our users and partners starts with you!

The ideal candidate is experienced in placing the user first, is highly focused on working with a collaborative infrastructure support team and is eager to own and solve user problems. We are looking for a team member with high integrity, a creative problem solver who can work with all team members to solve infrastructure escalations quickly and have fun doing it! We are a dynamic, fast-paced team environment that flourishes when solving problems.

Your time will be spent responding to complex incidents, identifying, and resolving problems and escalating where appropriate. In addition, you will manage smaller projects and team resources. You will also be responsible for new infrastructure project planning and implementation as well as existing project cancelation, modification, or improvement.
Essential job functions

Provide remote and hands on user support for desktops, laptops and local manufacturing equipment

Perform maintenance and troubleshooting of all relevant hardware and software.

Provide technical guidance to users and management for desktop support services.

Support local manufacturing systems.

Configuration, installation & deployment of all PC’s and PC related peripherals.

Participate in projects, implementations and rollouts as directed by the Manager/Supervisor.

Implementation and support of network operating systems and services.

Develop a working knowledge of department specific applications.

Stay on top of technical aspects of PC-LAN computing environment.

Provide Manager/Supervisor with equipment projections and assist with purchasing.

See opportunities and recommend solutions for improving service, efficiency, and effectiveness.

Contribute to meeting the departmental key performance indicators.

Work safely and align with company’s health safety and environmental policies and procedures
Minimum qualifications

Three or more years current experience in desktop support including network applications / operating systems / hardware.

Applicable degree program or IT industry certification including ITIL ( Information Technology Infrastructure Library) is preferred

Demonstrated strength in PC / Hardware and associated peripherals, network hardware and management tools, network operating systems and applications, Microsoft O/S, Server and Desktop, user documentation and diagnostic tools.

O365, Active Directory , Enterprise level support for Microsoft environments.

Ability to work onsite full time in New Port Richey Florida facility

US Citizen or permanent resident with ability to travel with valid driver’s license; ability to work off core business hours as required

This position requires access to export-controlled commodities, technical data, technology, software, and services. U.S. citizenship, U.S. legal permanent resident status, protected person status, or U.S. Government export authorization is required. Any offer of employment is contingent upon Pall obtaining the necessary employment visa and export authorization, including, if required, an export license from the applicable U.S. government agency.

Title: Sr. Manager of Software Engineering
Job_Description:
Aldevron is an industry pioneer with a core competency in manufacturing for gene and cell therapy. We supply high-quality plasmid DNA, mRNA and proteins to our clients, who are breaking new ground on the world’s most important and challenging solutions to benefit us all. We're looking for innovative, forward-thinking individuals who share our goals of advancing science and making an impact on the world.
Aldevron is proud to work alongside a community of nine fellow Danaher Life Sciences companies. Together, we are pioneering the future of science and medicine, developing products that enable researchers in the fight to save lives.

About the role
This Senior Manager of Quality Operations and Release position is responsible for performing all duties related to the Product Release, Incoming Quality Assurance, Operational Quality Assurance, and Quality Engineering. This individual will manage, coach, mentor, and train the Quality Assurance groups responsible for the direct oversight of biological manufacturing operations, the inspection and release of all raw materials and components required for production, and the final process and documentation review necessary for the release of any material. This individual will also help drive continuous process improvement and work to maintain quality compliance programs that ensure that the manufacturing and production processes meet the highest quality, company, regulatory, and statutory standards that protect patient safety and product quality.

Primary Responsibilities
Provide daily leadership and management for the teams that report into this position to drive excellence in quality related functions.
Work directly with clients to negotiate and execute Client Quality Agreements
Drive the development and implementation of new processes and procedures that will enhance efficiency and compliance
Proactively identify potential quality risk areas and then recommend and support the implementation of appropriate corrective and preventive actions.
Training, mentoring, and coaching the staff within the department
Communicate regulatory compliance requirements and the company’s Quality standards to the entire Quality team, Site Managers, and the Site Leadership Team
Ensure that all company, client, regulatory, and statutory requirements are met before full product release
Optimize all processes related to incoming inspection, shop floor auditing, and batch record review
Interact and partner with our operational counterparts to build strong relationships, to enhance and improve our Quality culture, and reduce the number of non-conforming events encountered during manufacturing.
Write, review, and revise standard operating procedures as needed.
Works productively with cross functional teams within the organization in order to proactively resolve issues.
Participates in any issues that require management escalations
Provide support for internal projects in order to ensure that everything is appropriately documented.
Maintains effective and collaborative internal customer relationships
Maintains strong communication networks with peers
Additional responsibilities as assigned

Required Qualifications


Two to five years of experience in a Quality preferably in a Quality Assurance capacity
Experience working in a regulated or GMP compliant environment
Current or past Quality certifications a plus (e.g. ISO 9001, ASQ, etc.)
Any experience in cell and therapy or biological manufacturing is a plus
Bachelor of Science, required; life science related field, preferred or equivalent experience
Experience in process understanding as it pertains to cGMP manufacturing and QA release
Comprehensive understanding of cGMP manufacturing expectations
Ability to works independently or as a team player when cross-functional involvement is involved
Critical thinker with strong decision-making skills
Exposure to regulatory agency inspections or other types of audits (e.g., FDA, notified bodies, ISO, etc.).
Leadership or team management experience

Identify and solve complex technical and operational problems related to Logistics & Distribution and Manufacturing in environment with highly integration shipping conveyors, robotic pick cell, and picking systems such as Pick & Put.

Develop detailed and comprehensive test plans, unit test systems and coordinate testing with the business users for the unit tests, System Integration Tests (SIT) and User Acceptance Tests (UAT).

Drive standardization of Business Process and System flow documents, functional specifications, and system design specifications along with Oracle configuration documentation while recognizing the broader impact across modules, regions, and functions.

Research current technologies to drive transformation in our Supply Chain, utilizing digital technologies like Oracle ECC, RPA, AI, and Predictive Analytics.

Value Stream Mapping, Standard Work, 5S, Kanban & Practical Problem Solving.

Implementation experience in Logistics systems like Oracle WMS, Mobile Applications (MSCA), INV, OTM/GTM, Shipping, Parcel Execution systems

Strong knowledge of Logistics and Distribution processes and shipping operations in a large warehouse with integrated software and hardware systems.

Technical skills, including writing SQL queries, using TOAD/SQL Developer

As the Global Product Manager (GPM), you are the specialist on your portfolio to develop and implement product line marketing strategies in order to maximize sales and profitability for Mammotome. The GPM works upstream and downstream in handling products cradle to grave including product performance, product launches and strategies to differentiate Mammotome in the marketplace. This person will partner closely with cross-functional teams to create a comprehensive and integrated product and procedure strategy.

This position is part of the Global Product Management Team located in Cincinnati Ohio and will be a hybrid position. At Mammotome, our passion is driving innovative technologies that create efficiencies, while never forgetting that at the heart of every breast cancer journey is a patient.


Product Management & Strategy
Develop and drive achievement of annual sales goals and procedure growth.
Collaboration with global partners on development and implementation of marketing strategy (positioning, place, price and promotion).
Lead products throughout their lifecycle ensuring continuing commercial success of new products and End-of-Life for older products.
Drive marketing activities and development of sales tools to improve product revenues.
Support the commercial team with product training, evidence and sales tools.
Work with team members in Strategic Marketing, Selling Unit (geo focused) Marketing, MarCom, Sales, Service, Clinical, R&D, Engineering, Operations, Supply Chain, Finance, Legal, etc. with strategies to maximize revenue, profitability and procedure adoption.
Partner with Supply Chain & Operations to plan and communicate production and inventory needs based on annual product sales forecasts and monthly updates.
Provide appropriate product information, including technical date and product availability information, CAPA.
Develop and maintain knowledge of the market, direct and emerging competitors, and healthcare policy changes impacting relevant product and procedures.
Ensures Future Growth
Represent the “Voice of Customer” (VOC) as the commercial lead for new product development projects for the product line– partnering with commercial team to define customer requirements, product concept definition and overall value proposition
Understand customer needs and use cases leveraging Problem 2 Portfolio (P2P) process, collecting VOC through qualitative and quantitative methodologies.
Actively spend time with customers, internal and field visits, to ensure alignment of plans to meet customer and market needs and to ensure strong customer insights.
Leadership
Coordinate across teams to achieve objectives and timelines with visual action plans, daily management principles and kaizen events.
Participate in PPG discussions/presentations to align market needs with strategic resources, development runways and rationalized product roadmap.
Actively shares and collaborates with cross functional teams to ensure best practice sharing, efficiency and effectiveness of marketing resources.
Other duties as assigned.


Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Marketing or related field equivalent required.
MBA preferred but not required.
Minimum 2 years’ experience in product management (or similar customer facing role with technical product).
Minimum of 4 years’ B2B experience within a Marketing, Business Development, Engineering, Sales or Clinical role required.
Minimum of 4 years of industry experience in healthcare, medical device or pharmaceuticals preferred.
20% travel with a mix of domestic and international locations.

Maintain enterprise vulnerability scanning infrastructure, ensuring daily operation of scans and reporting are occurring as required

Prepare reports and presentations communicating risks and status to a diverse audience of technical staff and both IT and business leadership

Proficiency with enterprise vulnerability management platforms such as Rapid7 Nexpose, Tenable Nessus, or Qualys

Skilled at analyzing IT/VM data sets using tools such as Excel or Power BI and presenting in a meaningful, digestible format for leadership teams


CISSP, GIAC/SANS, or similar certifications

Good project management skills including effective schedule, resource, and risk management

Title: IT Operations Helpdesk Analyst (Sturtevant, WI)
Job_Description:
At first glance, you’ll see Danaher’s scale. Our 80,000 associates work across the globe at more than 20 unique operating companies within four platforms—life sciences, diagnostics, water quality, and product identification. Look again and you’ll see the opportunity to build a meaningful career, be creative, and take risks with the support you need to be successful. You’ll find associates who are as certain about their impact as they are about where they’re headed next. You’ll find the Danaher Business System, which makes everything possible. You’ll also see a company that investors trust—our culture of continuous improvement has helped us outperform the S&P 500 by more than 5,000% over the past 25 years.

And no matter where you look at Danaher, at the heart of what we do, you’ll witness our shared purpose—helping realize life’s potential—in action. Whether we’re enabling our customers to provide clean water, supporting a life-saving vaccine development, advancing a new instrument for cancer diagnosis, or ensuring product safety, our work helps improve millions of lives.

We hope you’ll see yourself here, too. What you find at Danaher—and within yourself— might just change the world.

Are you a highly motivated and talented Senior Cyber Risk Quantification Analyst (CRQ) who would love to join the growing security organization at Danaher Corporation? Lead information security risk initiatives across 20+ globally diverse science and technology operating companies! By identifying and managing technology risk through quantitative and analytical practices, you will play a pivotal role in protecting Danaher’s sensitive data and other high value assets throughout the organization.

At Danaher we believe in designing a better, more sustainable workforce. We recognize the benefits of flexible, remote working arrangements for eligible roles and are committed to providing enriching careers, no matter the work arrangement. This position is eligible for a remote work arrangement in which you can work remotely from your home. Additional information about this remote work arrangement will be provided by your interview team. Explore the flexibility and challenge that working for Danaher can provide.

Primary Responsibilities

Lead risk management activities across Danaher’s operating companies, including implementation of a risk management framework and supporting cyber risk quantification functions based on Factor Analysis of Information Risk (FAIR)

Utilize information security risk expertise to develop loss event scenarios across operating companies, business units, projects, and products

Interpret internal or external cyber security risk analyses in business terms and recommend best practices

Continually monitor risk treatment activities to help ensure timely completion and risk reduction

Monitor and identify opportunities to improve the effectiveness of risk management processes

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent level of education and expertise

4+ years of experience in information security risk management, governance, or compliance related roles

Proven experience with cyber risk quantification methodologies and tools, such as Factor Analysis of Information Risk (FAIR) and RiskLens, or similar risk management experience

Understanding of security standards and frameworks such as ISO 27001/2, NIST 800-53, CIS Top 20 and similar

Excellent ability to communicate complex subjects effectively, especially at the executive level

Preferred Qualifications

Relevant certifications such as Factor Analysis of Information Risk (FAIR), Certified in Risk and Information Systems Control (CRISC), Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA), Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) or similar

Experience using RiskLens and ServiceNow Integrated Risk Management platforms

Title: Staff Systems Quality Engineer (Hybrid)
Job_Description:
IDT is the leading manufacturer of custom oligonucleotides and proprietary technologies for genomics applications. Our work is complex and cutting-edge, and our team members are curious, creative thinkers who understand that good data drives smart decisions. At IDT, we realize that although science may be uniform, people are unique. We promote a culture where engaged people are motivated and have opportunities to achieve their full potential, as part of one global team.

IDT is proud to work alongside a community of nine fellow Danaher Life Sciences companies. Together, we’re pioneering the future of science and medicine, developing products that enable researchers in the fight to save lives.

Job Title: Sr. Quality Engineer, QA Design Assurance

Location: REMOTE

Job Specific Duties/Essential Functions
Participate in cross-functional teams as the Quality Engineering representative supporting all phases of product development, including software as a medical device, through design controls, risk management, usability, systems engineering, architecture, design verification and design validation.
Work closely with Regulatory Affairs on deliverables for global regulatory submissions, including FDA pre-submissions, 510k and IVDR CE certifications.
Facilitate and participate in product risk management process supporting documentation compliant with ISO 14971 such as hazard analysis, FMEAs, risk assessments, etc.
Work independently and with project team members to develop and improve product and processes to reduce variability and increase robustness throughout the development cycle for multiple projects
Assist technical teams in the assessment of design changes; including assessment, planning, verification and validation of the change and documentation as required.
Audit, identify and support implementation of Design process improvements.
Assist in preparation of global regulatory submissions, documentation, technical files, etc.
Ensure compliance with applicable regulatory agency requirements, published standards, company policies/procedures, local procedures/work instructions, and project specific plans.
Act as resource for colleagues in explaining design control and risk management concepts and requirements; may include advising both technical teams and other QA Design Assurance team members on the best approaches to problems.
Demonstrates behavior consistent with the Integrated DNA Technologies Core Values.
Performs other duties as assigned.

Education, Licensure, Certification, Registration (Required vs. Preferred)
Bachelor’s degree in science, medical, or technical field required.

Professional Experience (Required vs. Preferred)
Minimum of 5 years of experience supporting design controls related to development of regulated medical devices with integrated software required; experience with software as a medical device preferred.
Strong working knowledge of ISO 13485, 21 CFR 820 and ISO 14971

Other Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Highly proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, Power Point and Adobe Acrobat
Demonstrated understanding of technical/scientific principles that relate to multiple, diverse, and or complex product lines or manufacturing processes
Must be detail oriented with well-developed organizational and analytical skills
Experiences in experimental design and assay development process is highly preferred
Experiences in software design and development process is preferred
Strong oral and written communication and presentation skills
Ability to identify, analyze and mitigate risk


Shift Differentials (Extra Compensation for less traditional shifts)
Generous Paid Time Off Accruals
16 Hours PAID Volunteer Time Off
10 Paid Holidays
Up to eight (8) weeks of 100% paid parental leave to eligible U.S. associates
401(k) with Company Match
Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance Options

Integrated DNA Technologies (IDT) conducts drug screens and background checks on applicants who accept employment offers.

Title: Staff Systems Quality Engineer (Hybrid)
Job_Description:
Qualitative UX Researcher

This position is located at our Loveland, Colorado location. It is a hybrid position where you can work part-time at the Company location identified above and part-time remotely from your home.

About Hach:
Our work at Hach ensures water quality for people around the world. Our customer partnerships, passionate experts, and reliable, easy-to-use solutions make water analysis better—faster, simpler, greener, and more informative. As a member of our team, you’ll get to make an immediate, measurable impact on a global scale, within industries from aviation to manufacturing to mining. You’ll also be part of an environment that fosters career growth and professional development, with kindness at its core. And you’ll be part of our mission, which drives us to develop water quality solutions that protect the health and safety of all living things.
Overview

Are you curious, empathetic, and interested in understanding how and why people use new devices and technologies? Are you good at talking to customers and helping get to the bottom of why they like or hate a product? Do you care and think critically about how human interaction matters in product design?

Hach values the user experience, and the UX Team is focused on building highly efficient, high-value experiences. We’re iterative in our research, our leadership takes time to help grow your UX career, and we attend regular training to increase our collective UX knowledge.

If this inspires you, then you should consider becoming our newest team member.
Responsibilities

We need an agile Qualitative User Experience Researcher who will move quickly to provide insight which inspires and helps us deliver amazing end-to-end products and experiences.

Our culture moves and iterates fast! Your creativity, dexterity, and ability to be an amazing partner across all disciplines of design, engineering, data science, market research, planning, and other project teams across Hach will enable your success.


Knows the strengths and weaknesses of different user research methods, and when to apply them
Exceptional behavioral data-collection and analysis skills, e.g., designing, conducting, and analyzing all kinds of user data.
Can objectively observe, interact with, and collect data from users, e.g. interviews, user testing, etc.
Able to distill research findings into actionable insights for product development
Comfortable with fast-paced work environment and responsibilities for multiple projects at any given time.
Excellent writing, communication, presentation, interpersonal, and analytical skills; the ability to communicate complex concepts clearly and persuasively across different audiences and varying levels of the organization.
Qualifications
2+ years’ experience as a researcher on an end-to-end product - creating research agendas and schedules, defining and tracking user experience goals and metrics, driving execution on projects, and managing the work of additional resources.
Hands-on experience with user testing, field research, survey design, online user research and experimentation tools, or usage data analysis.
Experience with a broad range of research methodologies (qualitative and quantitative techniques) and the right balance between the two.
The ability to work in front-end generative spaces as well as throughout product development that involves more iterative, rapid, and evaluative methods.
A BA/BS in a research related field with significant academic or industry experience are a huge plus!. A MA/MS or PhD in psychology, human factors, HCI, behavioral science or related field preferred.


Leadership skills to influence across and up the organization to bring customer empathy and understanding to the table.
Strong oral and written communication skills; experience presenting to executive-level audiences; proven track record of bringing clarity to messy data stories.
A true advocate for the design of inclusive and excellent user experiences for customers
Demonstrated ability to visualize and present rich research data simply and clearly.
A track record of moving beyond data by translating customer needs, behavior, and insights into user requirements, and work with engineers, program managers, and designers to develop specs that achieve an intuitive and usable experience for customers.
Strong aptitude for learning new technologies and demonstrated agility and flexibility in decision making and the way you work. You demonstrate an openness and growth mindset in all that you do
Comfortable working in ambiguous product areas, informing new opportunity spaces and high value customer experiences


Experience with Atlassian Suite


The salary range for this role is 95K - 115K. This is the range that we in good faith believe is the range of possible compensation for this role at the time of this posting. We may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range and this range is only applicable for jobs to be performed in Colorado. This range may be modified in the future.
This job is also eligible for bonus/incentive pay.
We offer comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off, medical/dental/vision insurance and 401(k) to eligible employees.
You can apply for this role through the Careers Page at https://jobs.danaher.com/global/en/ (or through the Workday “Find Jobs” function if you are a current employee)

Title: Staff Systems Quality Engineer (Hybrid)
Job_Description:
What We Value

We believe that real breakthroughs come from teams that think big and respect each other’s differences – different ideas, different perspectives, and different experiences. We encourage all voices to be heard, both internally as we collaborate and externally as we listen to our customers’ most pressing needs. And we would love to have you on this journey with us!

The Director of User Experience will be responsible for setting up Videojet’s first User Experience organization. As the industry continues to evolve, Videojet wants to continue to offer our customers a best-in-class user experience, inclusive of both user interface and user aspects of product design. To do this, we will augment our existing engineering and product organizations with dedicated, trained, and experienced user experience professionals. The Director will be primarily responsible for executing this vision by acting as the chief customer advocate for the design of our products. In the first year, this will include designing processes and systems for the UX organization that ensures successful cross-functional collaboration, designing the right organizational structure and then bringing on top talent to fill the new team. What defines success in the role?

This role is a unique opportunity to be the leading figure and driving force for the creation of a new user experience program for hardware and software at Videojet, including both new and established products. Fundamentally, success in this role is developing a consistently best-in-class user experience across all our customer segments that drives meaningful sustainable differentiation for Videojet that fuels our accelerated growth.


Be the User Experience thought leader for Videojet with an evangelist mindset that brings customer user experience to the forefront of all Videojet product innovation
Be skilled at understanding customer workflows, and then designing product workflows that adapt to the customer, rather than the other way around
Develop Videojet’s User Experience playbook, leveraging industry and Danaher best practices while owning continuous improvement of this playbook; apply these processes in a way that keeps the team nimble and successful in a culture that values moving fast and iterating quickly
Assess technologies, innovations and competitive products to identify new ways to promote UX design into our products and solutions
Work collaboratively with project core team members throughout the development process including engineers, product managers, project managers, technical support, and many more to ensure technical specifications meet customer needs
Lead continuous customer validation throughout the technology and product development process to ensure that the product being developed will deliver a compelling value proposition to the customer
Tell the customers’ stories and strategic implications to the Senior Leadership Team to drive Videojet product and corporate strategy and resourcing decisions The candidate will visibly embody the following traits:

Interpersonal and interviewing skills to establish rapport and connect with customers
Multicultural awareness allowing them to work well with customers and associates throughout the world across multiple time zones
Works effectively in matrixed organizations, showing the right balance between conviction of key ideas and sufficient flexibility to adapt to change
Able to influence without direct authority; strong negotiation, collaboration and influence management skills
Ability to communicate, demonstrate and prioritize the value of UX design decisions to key project stakeholders
Ability to explain and get buy-in on abstract design concepts and rationale, both verbally and visually Requirements:

Degree in related field, such as Human Factors Engineering, Information Architecture, Interactive Design, Cognitive Science, or equivalent.
Work experience - 10+ years as a key user experience designer, with some of that experience as a people manager, and some being with industrial products
Experience working on multiple product platforms and multiple simultaneous projects, ensuring teams can stay focused on creating an amazing experience for customers
Strong skills in rapid prototyping and iterative design process
Expert knowledge in interface design standards and best practices
Mastery of UX design processes and methodologies including building tools such as personas, usage scenarios, user flows, sitemaps, wireframes and style guides
Mastery of prototype/mockup methods and tools
Level of travel required. Moderate (As high as 25-40%) across the globe; including regular visits to Videojet Headquarters in Illinois, as well as visits to customers and R&D design centers Our Offer

We grow talent; we give you the opportunity to develop your career based on your strengths. Videojet is a career destination for engaged, passionate and hardworking people who are driven to seek innovation, growth and opportunity.

A career with Videojet will push you and challenge you, providing growth opportunities and the prospects to advance your career. If you are a driven high achiever, you will work with committed, like-minded people, giving you the support to reach your full potential. At Danaher, your potential is amplified. Our culture of continuous improvement defines who we are, drives our success, and translates to a career without limits for our team of 65,000 intellectually curious associates.

Title: Staff Systems Quality Engineer (Hybrid)
Job_Description:
Leica Biosystems’ mission of “Advancing Cancer Diagnostics, Improving Lives” is at the heart of our corporate culture. We’re a global leader in cancer diagnostics with the most comprehensive portfolio from biopsy to diagnosis. Our easy-to-use and consistently reliable offerings help improve workflow efficiency and diagnostic confidence. Our associates know that every moment matters when it comes to cancer diagnostics. When you come to work, you’re helping develop solutions that enable accurate diagnoses to turn anxiety into answers. Join our diverse, global team of talented people, and be inspired to grow every day.

Leica Biosystems is proud to work alongside a community of six fellow Diagnostics Companies at Danaher. Together, we’re working at the pace of change to improve patient lives with diagnostic tools that address the world’s biggest health challenges.

The Service Coordinator for Leica Biosystems is responsible for effectively scheduling customer work order requests. This position provides outstanding customer communication and administrative support via phone and e-mail, including the coordination of new product installations in partnership with internal teams and external logistics partners, and via entering spare parts orders timely and accurately. Additionally, this role helps drive time and materials revenue through handling the flow of customer purchase orders, including Purchase Order processing and follow up.

This position is part of Customer Support – Multifunction located in Deer Park, IL and will be a hybrid position. At Leica Biosystems, our vision is to advance cancer diagnostics and improve lives.

You will be a part of the Non-Technical Customer Support team and report to the Supervisor, Service Coordination. If you thrive in a remarkable multifunctional, support role and want to work to build a world-class customer support organization—read on.


Provide administrative support for Field Service Engineers and Regional Field Service Managers via phone and email.

Coordinate complex scheduling using Salesforce.com for incoming repairs (emergency and non-emergency) and Preventative Maintenance with the Field Service team and customers by monitoring incoming phone and email traffic.

Bundle and dispatch incoming work orders to Field Service Engineers to maximize time and efficiencies as well as contacting customers for bundle opportunities of repair and preventative maintenance work orders.


Associates Degree with a minimum 1 year of customer service experience OR equivalent work experience (minimum of 3 years customer service).

Minimum 1 year of experience in a high-volume call center environment.

Proficient in computer skills (Excel, Word, Outlook, PowerPoint).



Bachelor’s Degree preferred.

At Leica Biosystems we believe in designing a better, more sustainable workforce. We recognize the benefits of flexible, hybrid working arrangements for eligible roles and are committed to providing enriching careers, no matter the work arrangement. This position is eligible for a hybrid work arrangement in which you can work part-time at the Company location identified above and part-time remotely from your home. Additional information about this hybrid work arrangement will be provided by your interview team. Explore the flexibility and challenge that working for Leica Biosystems can provide.

Title: Staff Systems Quality Engineer (Hybrid)
Job_Description:
Be part of something altogether life-changing!
Working at Cytiva in the Life Sciences industry means being at the forefront of providing new solutions to transform human health. Our incredible customers undertake life-saving activities ranging from fundamental biological research to developing innovative vaccines, new medicines, and cell and gene therapies.

At Cytiva you will be able to continuously improve yourself and us – working on challenges that truly matter with people that care for each other, our customers, and their patients. With associates across 40 countries, Cytiva is a place where every day is a learning opportunity – so you can grow your career and expand your skills in the long term. Your health and wellbeing are important to us and together we will not compromise on safety in the workplace or the environment.

Cytiva is proud to work alongside a community of nine fellow Danaher Life Sciences companies. Together, we are pioneering the future of science and medicine, developing products that enable researchers in the fight to save lives.

What you'll do
Support the execution the QMS implementation action plan defined by the QARA Project leader.
Accountable for developing and maintaining the Site QMS training matrix , be the Subject Matter Expert (SME) in the eLearning system, Cytiva Learning (Cornerstone).
Accountable for QMS trainings assignments as well as support site Quality induction activities.
Accountable for QMS document management, including but not limited to; leading the site document review board, authoring of local QMS work instructions, liaising with the Global QMS team on Global documentation updates and acting as the site administrator for the Cytiva electronic documentation management system (eDMS), Veeva Quality Docs.
Be the local system administrator for the Cytiva eQMS; deviations, investigations, CAPAs, Changes (Change Controls) and internal audits. As system administrator, represent the site in global superuser forums ensuring site needs are identified, system updates are implemented and communicated. Lead system specific training and approve system access for associates.
Responsible for on-site Quality Assurance support to the technology transfer project for all quality related topics.
You will be part of our ongoing security of supply initiative to build a new chromatography media manufacturing site, the product transfer from our manufacturing site in Uppsala Sweden and to build up the Quality Management System for the site.

Who you are
Minimum, Bachelor's degree from an accredited University or College, preferably in a Science or Engineering discipline
A minimum 5 years working experience in Quality Assurance/Quality Engineering within Life Science, Medical Device or Biopharma manufacturing environments
Comprehensive understanding of ISO 9001 & ISO 13485 requirements Understanding of GMP requirements, desired
Experienced in working cross – functionally, both locally and globally
Experience of working with implementing Quality Management Systems, and working with documents and training desired
Strong analytical- and problem-solving skills
Strong communication skills (written and oral).
Strong interpersonal skills, including escalation management
Confident when working independently and as part of a team
Strong PC literacy required; MSOffice skills (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Travel to Uppsala will be required.

Title: Staff Systems Quality Engineer (Hybrid)
Job_Description:
Wondering what’s within Beckman Coulter Diagnostics? Take a closer look.

At first glance, you’ll see that for more than 80 years we’ve been dedicated to advancing and optimizing the laboratory to move science and healthcare forward. Join a team where you can be heard, be supported, and always be yourself. We’re building a culture that celebrates backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives of all our associates. Look again and you’ll see we are invested in you, providing the opportunity to build a meaningful career, be creative, and try new things with the support you need to be successful.

Beckman Coulter Diagnostics is proud to work alongside a community of six fellow Diagnostics Companies at Danaher. Together, we’re working at the pace of change to improve patient lives with diagnostic tools that address the world’s biggest health challenges.

The Software Engineer I for Beckman Coulter Diagnostics is responsible for designing, developing, troubleshooting, and debugging software programs for laboratory medical devices and new product development. We are seeking Software Engineers with hands-on C# programming skills.

This position is part of Hematology in Miami, FL, and will be on-site . At Beckman Coulter, our vision is to relentlessly reimagine healthcare, one diagnosis at a time.

You will be a part of the R&D Software Development team and report to the Sr. Director of Software Engineering responsible for designing, developing, troubleshooting, and debugging medical device software for laboratory systems. If you thrive in a collaborative, autonomist, highly technical role and want to work to build a world-class R&D software Engineering organization—read on.


Prototype, design, implement, unit test, and maintain Windows / Linux-based software applications
Participate in cross-functional project teams to develop medical device software
Work with multi-discipline teams on new product introduction projects while adhering to software development and source control processes
Document software, write technical specifications for interfaces and testing
Ensuring full compliance with relevant work practices, as required by authorities for medical device product development


Bachelor’s degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science with 0+ years of experience
Experience designing and developing C# based solutions and experience with any user interface development
Hands-on experience with MS tools and technologies such as Visual Studio, unit testing frameworks, Azure DevOps
Experience in Unit Testing, OOA/OOD development methodologies, and design principles
Experience in Agile development processes and philosophies
Prefer experience as an Intern


Experience in medical device design & development is a plus
Understanding of software development processes for a regulated environment (ISO9000/FDA) is a plus
Ability to work well with people and be both highly motivated and motivating

Title: Staff Systems Quality Engineer (Hybrid)
Job_Description:
JOB SUMMARY:
Operations Engineering Working Supervisor’s role supporting, sustaining, and improving Manufacturing and Quality Operations for Consumables and Instruments produced at the San Jose Site, including the Imaging, Plate Readers and Flipr Penta platforms. Manage Product Transfer activities during New Product Introduction (NPI); represent Manufacturing as NPI Core Team Member. Provide Technical Leadership within Operations, including managing projects associated with Engineering and Process Changes that drive Quality Improvements, Process Improvements, Value Analysis and Value Engineering (VAVE), and Design Changes that require cross-functional resource involvement.

Supervise Manufacturing Support Activities; hands on involvement as required
Supervise, recruit, hire and evaluate Manufacturing Engineers to ensure creation of preventive and corrective maintenance routines for the different manufacturing equipment; implementing and improving automated equipment for manufacturing; analyzing process cycle time, waste, and customer demand to determine if process requires automation; designing tailored automated equipment to maximize productivity; performing six sigma analysis to determine machine capability and performance.
Supervise Manufacturing Engineers to support Operations in driving performance to Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) related to Safety, Quality, Delivery, and Productivity. Be an active participant in Daily Management activities within Operations; assist with, participate in, and contribute to triage and troubleshooting activities on the manufacturing floor to improve productivity and First Pass Yield, and reduce defective parts per unit built.
Supervise New Product Transfer Engineering activities; hands on involvement as required.
Function as the Voice of Operations in NPI Projects, including Product Transfer into Manufacturing and Quality Operations. Participate in all Design and Process FMEA exercises during Design, Development, and Product Transfer.
Supervise Process Validation and Sustaining Engineering Activities within Operations; hands on involvement as required.
Author and execute validation protocols for the implementation of new products and processes, documenting manufacturing activities and procedures.
Assist Supply Chain personnel in finding alternative suppliers and alternative parts.
Supervise Internal and External Quality Improvement Work in Operations; hands on involvement as required.
Perform failure analysis, root cause investigation, and implement corrective actions and countermeasures related to customer complaints. Reduce Defective Parts Per Million (DPPM) across all products.
Improve First Pass Yield and Defects per unit in Manufacturing
Supervise Value Analysis, Value Engineering (VAVE) Activities within Operations; hands on involvement as required.
Supervise Process Capability Improvement Activities in Operations; hands on involvement as required.
Supervise Manufacturing Engineering participation in Continuous Improvement (Danaher Business System); hands on involvement as required.
Compliance and Regulatory; hands on involvement as required.

Skills and Attributes

Excellent verbal and written communication skills, coupled with effective presentation skills
Ability to work independently, prioritizing tasks according to objectives and company strategy, successfully delivering business results related to Operations Engineering priorities
Ability to manage Operations Engineering projects, including those that include cross-functional resources
Supervision and Technical Leadership that exemplifies proactiveness and demonstrates an agility with multi-tasking a nd ability to effectively interact with staff and management alike (transversally collaborative) across functional groups and levels.
Ability to lead independently, prioritizing tasks according to objectives and company strategy, successfully delivering business results related to the supervision of Operations Engineering activities
Ability to lead and motivate a team and the workforce, ensuring optimum employee engagement

The right candidate for this role will embody both the Molecular Devices and Danaher culture. Below are key attributes this candidate will possess.
Analytical . This leader seeks out facts and evaluates relationships and dependencies.
Results-driven . Demonstrating initiative and personal accountability to meet work demands according to highest standards, while being able to prioritize and balance competing needs, will be key to success.
Both a competitive and team player . This individual speaks to results yet gives credit to the team.
Humble and self-aware . Helping drive a culture of respect across all associates, functions and levels while championing D&I and focusing on results is a must. This candidate understands their personal areas of development and actively works on weaknesses.
Clear communicator . Strong experience in developing effective internal communications and a clear, succinct style is desired.

Title: Staff Systems Quality Engineer (Hybrid)
Job_Description:
As a global leader in mass spectrometry, SCIEX delivers solutions for precision detection and quantification of molecules to help protect and advance the wellness and safety of all. Because of our 50 years of groundbreaking innovation, our customers can quickly respond to environmental hazards, better understand biomarkers relevant to disease, improve patient care in the clinic, bring relevant drugs to market faster, and keep food healthier and safer. At SCIEX, you’ll find a rewarding role that amplifies your impact on the world and helps you realize life’s potential.

SCIEX is proud to work alongside a community of nine fellow Danaher Life Sciences companies. Together, we’re pioneering the future of science and medicine, developing products that enable researchers in the fight to save lives.

Do you want to help advance scientific discovery, improving quality of life around the world? We do, too.

Carlsbad / USA

Senior Director, Manufacturing


The Sr. Manager, Technical Operations & Engineering manages a team of scientists, engineers and technicians that support Sciex manufacturing operations, and is responsible for manufacturing line support (both manufacturing engineering and chemistry formulation), continuous process improvements, equipment life cycle management, automation, and sustaining engineering. This role supports Key Performance Indicator (KPI) metrics such as safety, internal quality, value engineering savings, productivity improvements, and on time delivery, leveraging Danaher Business System (DBS) tools and lean manufacturing/continuous improvement principles. In this role, the Sr Manager, Technical Operations & Engineering works closely with Manufacturing Production, R&D, Quality Control/ Quality Assurance (QC/QA), Procurement, and the Finance/Accounting teams to establish and execute the priorities for the Carlsbad Manufacturing (CBD MFG) team.

Essential Duties, Critical Success Factors, Responsibilities, Authorities and Required Interactions:


Carries out managerial responsibilities for staff, including but not limited to development, performance evaluations, engagement, hiring and terminations.
Leads in a global environment - Demonstrates an appropriate level of eye for business, including an understanding of how your own role contributes to Sciex meeting its strategic goals.
Work cross functionally with R&D, Manufacturing, Supply Chain and Quality to develop processes for new products and improve processes for existing products.
Aligns business priorities and deploy adequate resources toward completion of parallel multiple continuous improvement & compliance related project initiatives.
Listens and responds to customer needs - Understands customer expectations and end-user needs to sustain our products.
Cultivates and enables breakthrough thinking to drive growth - Generates new ideas and solutions by making connections between customer needs and technologies or processes to meet these needs.


Manages implementations of technology solutions that improve business processes, increase productivity, and eliminate waste.
Leads both manufacturing engineering and technical operations to consistently deliver on commitments and drive results.
Responsible for new lab set-up, equipment validation (IQ/OQ/PQ), test method validation and process validation of reagent consumables
Leads the team in root cause investigations of quality related issues.
Construct and execute controlled experiments (including DOE's) to optimize processes, address yield and quality issues and drive implementation of solutions in a production environment to meet production goals
Work with subject matter experts to build out the future applications roadmap that supports the objectives.
Drive the use of DBS principles and tools in implementing solutions.
Effectively manage sustainment projects using other resources as needed.
Drive the process improvement projects to impact product quality, cost and performance by utilizing value analysis/ value Engineering (VAVE) methodologies.
Develop, maintain, and enforce technical standards, policies, and SOPs within your team.
Experience with design/process characterization methods and analysis, analytical test method characterization and validation, statistical process control.
Experience with risk management methods (FMEA), problem resolution methods (8D, Fish-Bone, etc), non-conformance and deviation management.


B.S. Required. (M.S. or Ph.D. preferred) Preferably in Chemistry, Bio-Chemistry, Molecular Biology, Chemical or Bio-Medical Engineering.
Prefer 8 or more years of industry experience in product/process development and manufacturing
Prefer 2 or more years of experience as a functional manager
Work experience in the life sciences, biotech/biopharma or clinical diagnostics industries is desirable
Demonstrated ability to successfully lead, coach and mentor direct reports required
Experience working in an ISO13485 or FDA certified environment is desirable
Experience in high mix-low volume production in a high-tech consumables industry is desirable

Title: Staff Systems Quality Engineer (Hybrid)
Job_Description:
Wondering what’s within Beckman Coulter Diagnostics? Take a closer look.

At first glance, you’ll see that for more than 80 years we’ve been dedicated to advancing and optimizing the laboratory to move science and healthcare forward. Join a team where you can be heard, be supported, and always be yourself. We’re building a culture that celebrates backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives of all our associates. Look again and you’ll see we are invested in you, providing the opportunity to build a meaningful career, be creative, and try new things with the support you need to be successful.

Beckman Coulter Diagnostics is proud to work alongside a community of six fellow Diagnostics Companies at Danaher. Together, we’re working at the pace of change to improve patient lives with diagnostic tools that address the world’s biggest health challenges.

The Staff Systems Integration Engineer will work as part of new product development for next generation Microbiology diagnostic instruments with a focus on executing characterization, verification and validation tasks. This position is based in Sacramento, CA and will be hybrid (mix of remote and on-site) work depending upon business needs. This is an exciting and challenging opportunity to be a part of a rapidly growing industry working on the cutting edge of medical diagnostic technologies in a research and development environment. You’ll have the opportunity to work directly with scientists and engineers to ensure we have the right solutions to meet the needs of a constantly evolving healthcare environment. If you thrive in a high-functioning matrixed environment and want to work to build a world-class R&D organization—read on.


Hands-on design and execution of complex test methods (including design and implementation of test fixtures) to assess hardware, software, and system performance per Design Input Requirements, in compliance with Quality and Regulatory requirements.
Work independently in a cross-disciplinary environment to plan and execute experiments, defining and using specialized test equipment, and perform experimental data analysis.
Analyze complex data via statistical methods and provide written and oral reports and updates to senior and executive management.
Write and execute systems verification protocols
Work with cross-functional team to quickly investigate and identify countermeasures for new product issues on new product development and legacy products
Conducts root cause investigations and Failure analyses to solve reliability and performance issues on legacy products
Analyze data to assess system performance
Drive continuous improvement projects
Plan projects, step action plans and manage/prioritize multiple tasks


Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, or a related technical discipline with 9+ years of experience as a hands-on systems or systems-integration engineer OR Master’s degree with 7+ years of experience of systems experience.
Experience developing complex instrumentation systems which incorporate LAN/Cloud-based computing, optical, mechanical, environmental, algorithm, firmware components with inter-system measures and measurement systems.
Experience with and ability to detail work per ISO9000/FDA regulation.
Excellent collaboration and communication skills to enable c oordinating and aligning system-level integration efforts between workstreams, throughout characterization and qualification; Includes aspects of:
System modeling, apportionment, and measurement system analysis of essential performance requirements between sub-systems.
System risk management and alignment of risk mitigations across the subsystems and requirements.
System reliability modeling and monitoring; Proposes Continuous improvement of the high-impact issues.
Human Factors and Usability to minimize system workflow errors, effort, and operator strain.
Statistics experience, including proficiency in Design of Experiments and the use of Excel or other tools such as JMP, Origin, Matlab, R, Python, Mathematica, or Minitab, etc.) for data analysis and interpretation.

In our line of work, life isn’t a given - it’s the ultimate goal. The Quality Assurance Associate is responsible for performing receiving inspection, final quality assurance inspection, and computer system transactions duties.
This position is part of Radiometer America located in Carlsbad, CA and will be an on-site position. At Radiometer, our vision is to improve global healthcare with reliable, fast, and easy patient diagnoses.
You will be a part of the Quality Assurance team and report to the Quality Assurance Manager. If you thrive in a fast-paced role and want to work to build a world-class Manufacturing organization—read on.


Function as a representative of the company’s Quality Assurance Program, and demonstrate behavior, judgment, discretion, and performance consistent with the quality mission and goals. Backup for QC Inspectors and DocControl as needed.
Perform Receiving Inspection activities according to SOPs and other approved Work instructions.
Perform final QA releases according to SOPs and other approved work instructions.
Investigates/analyzes problems identified and recommends appropriate follow-up to value stream supervisors and QA Engineers.
Prioritize and communicate together with the VSM teams and Shipping on the daily QA releases.
Perform training for Receiving Inspection and other QC areas.
Utilize DBS tools in performance of daily activities.


High School Diploma or equivalent.
1+ years of experience in a quality assurance work with a medical device (FDA/GMP) manufacturer.
Knowledge of inspection test measurement techniques, and tools applicable to regulations and standards. Knowledge of Quality assurance or control methods; principles and practices including sampling techniques.


Understanding of the relationship of QA to other functional areas such as purchasing, materials handling, and manufacturing.

Title: Staff Systems Quality Engineer (Hybrid)
Job_Description:
Customer Service Engineer
Videojet Technologies
Location: Remote with Regional Travel
Please note that this posting is open for talent pipelining purposes and to be considered for future opportunities.
Videojet Technologies (a Danaher Company) is a world-leader in the product identification market, providing in-line printing, coding, and marking products, application specific fluids, and product life cycle services. Our goal is to partner with our customers in the consumer packaged goods, pharmaceutical, and industrial goods industries to improve their productivity, to protect and grow their brands, and to stay ahead of industry trends and regulations. With our customer application experts and technology leadership in continuous ink jet (CIJ), thermal ink jet (TIJ), laser marking, thermal transfer overprinting (TTO), case coding and labeling, and wide array printing, Videojet has more than 325,000 printers installed worldwide.
We empower creativity and unconventional thinking to help us uncover breakthrough solutions and accelerate the pace of innovation. We believe with conviction that diversity helps us uncover more powerful customer insights and ultimately creates a competitive advantage in the markets we serve. And we would love to have you on this journey with us! Apply today.
The Customer Service Engineer is a unique opportunity to be the front line of Videojet's customer interaction through daily service and support. Through advanced technical and commercial training, you will enhance all aspects of our organization. In this entrepreneurial role, you operate from home and commute to some of the world's largest manufacturing companies. At these sites, you will support sales growth by discussing service agreements, new products, while delivering the highest quality of customer satisfaction in our industry. Our highly advanced industrial equipment will be installed, repaired, and maintained by you at our customer sites. This cross-functional position provides you with new and exciting opportunities to advance based on your performance.
We offer a base salary, service incentive bonus, full benefits including medical, dental, and 401k match from your first day of employment , car, smartphone and a great opportunity to grow!


Create and grow multiple aspects of our business through supporting regional and company goals.
Improve customer satisfaction by delivering the highest customer service in our industry.
Identifying, owning, and tracking any issues with an account, according to call escalation procedure, to reach resolution.
Receive and utilize highly advanced technical training at customer accounts on a daily basis
Manage a customer account in its entirety. Determine how Videojet can increase value throughout their business by offering other services. What do you need?
Technical Agility- Mechanical, Electrical, Electronics, Pneumatics, Hydraulics, Computer Hardware and Software; having the desire to work with best-in-class technology and learn new skills.
Strong Interpersonal and Communication skills. Being able to communicate effectively with all levels within an organization, from front line operators to senior management, and remaining professional at all times. This position requires both written and verbal communication skills.
Sense of Urgency - Having the drive and motivation to take action and prioritize daily tasks; working strategically to ensure we are getting to every customer.
Adaptability-being able to think quickly and respond positively to change. Your Education and/or Background Experience will include:
Technical Degree preferred and/or relevant military training; other backgrounds welcome to apply with relevant work history.
Be able to lift up to 50lbs. and stand, lift, stretch, bend, and squat throughout the day.
Must be comfortable with day travel- home most evenings but occasional overnight travel
You will be part of a dynamic team in which there is a high focus on delivering results and continuous improvement, but also where having fun and teamwork is very important.
It's a fast-paced environment, a consultative role, where you will get to partner with people to achieve their strategic business goals.
You will work in a leading global company, with a Manager who cares about you, your strengths and will help you to develop the best possible version of yourself.
You must be eligible to work in the United States without sponsorship required.

Job_Description:
Beckman Coulter Life Sciences’ mission is to empower those seeking answers to life’s most important scientific and healthcare questions. With a legacy spanning 80+ years, we have long been a trusted partner to our customers, who are working to transform science and healthcare with the next groundbreaking discovery. Beckman Coulter Life Sciences is proud to work alongside a community of nine fellow Danaher Life Sciences companies. Together, we’re pioneering the future of science and medicine, developing products that enable researchers in the fight to save lives.

International and domestic travel possible up to 25%.


Ability to influence decision making with or without authority, facilitate groups with diverse perspectives, bring teams to agreement. Works across the organization to set priorities and shift resources according to business demands.
Extensive knowledge in mechanical or electrical engineering. Drives technical excellence, especially the execution of defined product support initiatives.
Interpersonal skills that build positive relationships and influence others, both within the direct team and across functions. Ability to interact with all levels of the business (senior leaders to working teams), exceptionally good listening skills, able to present complex information with clarity and simplicity.
Able to identify problems; apply structured and disciplined methodology to identify root cause using data. Innovative and effective solution development, risk mitigation and execution.
Collaborate effectively with others in the spirit of common objectives.


Drive product support improvements, deploying creative and effective support strategies to deliver best-in-class customer service
Provide troubleshooting support to field service associates during on-site visits to promote customer up-time
Lead Technical and Product Line escalations of product related technical system issues
Develop expert level knowledge of existing systems from hardware perspective and acquire applications knowledge to aid in problem diagnosis.
Recommendations to development projects as a customer and service advocate
Recommendations to design and test methods for verification of all service procedures
Ensuring all safety, quality and regulatory requirements are in compliance with standards and agencies such as: ISO, GMP and FDA
Collaborate with all partners to utilize DBS for ongoing process improvement. Key Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree with 9+ years related work experience OR Master’s degree with 7+ years related work experience OR Doctoral degree with 4+ years related work experience. Degree in Systems Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering or similar engineering field preferred.
Experience working in product support environment preferred
Excellent troubleshooting and problem-solving skills
Exceptional communication (verbal and written)
Strong analytical skills
Proven track record in and commitment to continuous process improvement

Title: Staff Systems Quality Engineer (Hybrid)
Job_Description:
Wondering what’s within Beckman Coulter Diagnostics? Take a closer look.

At first glance, you’ll see that for more than 80 years we’ve been dedicated to advancing and optimizing the laboratory to move science and healthcare forward. Join a team where you can be heard, be supported, and always be yourself. We’re building a culture that celebrates backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives of all our associates. Beckman Coulter Diagnostics is proud to work alongside a community of six fellow Diagnostics Companies at Danaher. Together, we’re working at the pace of change to improve patient lives with diagnostic tools that address the world’s biggest health challenges.

The Biological Scientist/Engineer II for Beckman Coulter Diagnostics is responsible for testing and validating design changes that will improve quality and direct material savings of Immunoassay and Urine Analysis instruments used in the Diagnostics market.

This position is part of the Sustaining Engineering group and will be onsite in Chaska, MN. Beckman Coulter’s vision is to advance healthcare for every person with diagnostic testing solutions.

You will be a part of the Sustaining Engineering team and report to the Senior Manager responsible for Value Engineering, Product Reliability and End-of-Life component management for legacy hardware products. If you thrive in a fast-paced and result-orientated role and want to work to build world-class design change processes, project funnels, and deliver high-quality results, read on.


Work with cross-functional team and individually drive technical deliverables.
Work on validation testing of health care products
Develop continuous improvement skills utilizing the Danaher Business System.
Support test manufacturing scientist responsible for testing and validating through our development process.
Analyze the technical risks associated with design changes and use analysis, prototyping, and feasibility testing to ensure functional requirements are met.


Bachelor’s degree in Science or Engineering field with 2+ years’ experience Or Master’s degree in field with 0-2 years’ experience.
Ability to write and execute technical protocol, complete data analysis, and present results to your team.
Knowledge of testing and validation principles.
Familiarity with running assays and operating diagnostics instruments.


Preferred degree in biological studies.
Testing of new designs and design change validation process related to medical devices.
Use of problem-solving techniques such as 5 whys and fish-bone diagrams.

Title: Staff Systems Quality Engineer (Hybrid)
Job_Description:
Be part of something altogether life-changing!
Working at Cytiva in the Life Sciences industry means being at the forefront of providing new solutions to transform human health. Our incredible customers undertake life-saving activities ranging from fundamental biological research to developing innovative vaccines, new medicines, and cell and gene therapies.

At Cytiva you will be able to continuously improve yourself and us – working on challenges that truly matter with people that care for each other, our customers, and their patients. With associates across 40 countries, Cytiva is a place where every day is a learning opportunity – so you can grow your career and expand your skills in the long term. Your health and wellbeing are important to us and together we will not compromise on safety in the workplace or the environment.

Cytiva is proud to work alongside a community of nine fellow Danaher Life Sciences companies. Together, we’re pioneering the future of science and medicine, developing products that enable researchers in the fight to save lives.

What you’ll do
The Supplier Quality Lead Engineer will collaborate with Engineering, Project Management, Field Service, Quality Assurance and Sourcing teams on all activities required to effectively manage supplier quality requirements and supplier development for both indirect and direct materials and services.
Primary areas of focus will be supplier qualification, continuous improvement, and supplier change request resolution.
Improve supplier quality performance for assigned suppliers via Quality Plan implementation.
Assure Corrective and Preventive Action plans are developed and executed at assigned suppliers in compliance with the CAPA process.
Assure supplier compliance to Cytiva QMS and regulatory requirements through the supplier monitoring process.
Interface with suppliers and internal stakeholders to drive quality improvements that minimize the cost of quality and implement supplier/engineering changes, New Product Introductions, and transfers.
Lead engagement with suppliers on key projects, initiatives, and collaboration events.

Who you are
Demonstrated knowledge of Quality Management System tools and continuous improvement methodologies.
At a minimum, exposure to compliance audits and ISO standards. Lead Auditor experience a plus.
Familiarity with supplier technical development or supplier quality development.
Effective problem solving, root-cause / CAPA analytical skills to influence others to drive improvement (cross-functionally and globally).
Ability to develop, communicate and implement a strategy to ensure compliance to Cytiva, regulatory and industry requirements.
strong background in interpretation of drawings / specifications, and manufacturing process planning / evaluation.
Knowledge of sterilization, calibration, and testing services.
Exposure to the development and deployment of digital solutions in Supplier Quality.
Degree in an engineering, technical discipline, or equivalent non-technical degree with experience in manufacturing, engineering, or quality assurance.
Professional quality engineer or auditor certification, or lean/six sigma experience a plus.
Desire and ability to travel up to 30%.
Proactive, self-driven, results seeking, with enthusiastic intensity.
Environment to be flexible in working a hybrid model remotely and in the office as required by Manager.

When you join us, you’ll also be joining Danaher’s global organization, where 80,000 people wake up every day determined to help our customers win. As an associate, you’ll try new things, work hard, and advance your skills with guidance from dedicated leaders, all with the support of powerful Danaher Business System tools and the stability of a tested organization.

Title: Staff Systems Quality Engineer (Hybrid)
Job_Description:
The Sr. Systems Engineer, Sourcing Engineering is responsible for reducing direct material cost, improving instrument functionality and quality through part optimizations, design changes, and supplier change projects. They will lead projects by acting as the main point of contact for project status and execution by pulling together drawing, specification packages and managing test/validation plans. Moreover, they will analyze and recommend future projects that will result in improved instrument cost, performance and quality. Additionally, they will be responsible for attaining resources and alignment amongst a cross-functional team. The candidate will work effectively with a cross-functional/global staff and supply base. This position provides an opportunity to develop new processes across a highly technical organization.

Key Responsibilities:
Reduce direct material spend to meet the department goal.
Enlist resources to drive projects to align skills required (e.g., Electrical/Mechanical/Optical/Software, etc.).
Generate and update test plans to prove out production changes before cut in.
Update designs, drawings, engineering data and engineering releases as needed.
Build straightforward cost summaries to justify efforts.
Drive process changes within engineering spec’s and use cases to improve effectiveness of future Value Added/Value Engineering (VAVE) and supplier change processes.
Update designs in engineering database e.g. CAD, ECAD, Firmware etc.
Ensure year-over-year improvement in instrument quality
Work directly and communicate regularly with domestic and international suppliers in a global setting
Continuously improvement both for effectiveness and efficiency


BS in Mechanical or Electrical Engineering (or similar).
7+ of engineering, systems or VAVE design experience desired.
Experience in lean manufacturing/continuous improvement methods desirable.
Experience in project management is desired.
Awareness of optics, electrical circuit boards, plastics, sheet metal and complex mechanical assemblies

Skills and Attributes
Results oriented – has track record for delivering results, takes ownership and is accountable
Stretch oriented – embraces and thrives on challenge. Sets high expectations for self and the organization.
Continuous improvement oriented – has familiarity with lean principles and how to apply them for sustainable results in a product development and manufacturing setting.
Possesses a high sense-of-urgency, traction counts and has a strong attention to detail.
Problem-Solving – able to perform complex problem-solving using a structured approach.
Business/Technical Acumen – ability to quickly learn a wide portfolio of product, technical complexities and suppliers. Both technically-minded and business-minded.
Leadership – creates followership with cross-functional peers, while setting a high expectation.
Able to balance and execute a VAVE strategy, while at the same time making an immediate impact.
Effectively deploys resources to focus on the critical few.
Excellent communication skills internally and with suppliers.

Title: Staff Systems Quality Engineer (Hybrid)
Job_Description:
Be part of something altogether life-changing!
Working at Cytiva in the Life Sciences industry means being at the forefront of providing new solutions to transform human health. Our incredible customers undertake life-saving activities ranging from fundamental biological research to developing innovative vaccines, new medicines, and cell and gene therapies.

At Cytiva you will be able to continuously improve yourself and us – working on challenges that truly matter with people that care for each other, our customers, and their patients. With associates across 40 countries, Cytiva is a place where every day is a learning opportunity – so you can grow your career and expand your skills in the long term. What you’ll do
Project execution, as part of a diverse bioengineering team, for process and technology development programs within the Nucleic Acid Therapeutics field.
Responsible for definition of tasks, experimental planning and execution, data analysis, documentation, standard operating procedures (SOP) preparation, reporting and preparation of technical recommendations.
Collaborate with multiple sites and Danaher businesses aligned with the Nucleic Acid Therapeutics technical goals.
Demonstrate continuous integrity, credibility and positivity, and motivate others to do the same.
Continuously grow and adapt in a fast-moving field to keep yourself and the organization at the forefront of the Nucleic Acid Therapeutics field.

Industry experience in process development and/or engineering is preferred. Expertise required in one or more of the following areas: bioprocess development, in vitro transcription, oligonucleotide delivery, lipid nanoparticle technologies, and/or downstream purification of nucleic acids.
Experience with characterization and analytics specific to nucleic acids is a valuable asset.
Personnel supervisory / team leadership experience and project management experience is a plus.
Independent, detailed-oriented, self-starter with excellent analytical skills with the ability to multi-task and succeed in a team environment.
Strong written and verbal English communications skills with solid knowledge of MS Office and comfort with learning new software applications especially those for DoE and statistical analysis.
