Title: VP Materials/Membrane Research
Job_Description:
Find what drives you on a team with a more than 70-year history of discovery, determination, and innovation. As a global leader in high-tech filtration, separation, and purification, Pall Corporation thrives on helping our customers protect people. Our products serve a wide range of markets, so if your interests lie along the spectrum of Life Sciences to Industrial, you’ll find a rewarding role here. For the exponentially curious, Pall is a place you can thrive and amplify your impact on the world.
Pall is proud to work alongside a community of nine fellow Danaher Life Sciences companies. Together, we’re pioneering the future of science and medicine, developing products that enable researchers in the fight to save lives.
Position Summary:
Pall Industrial is seeking a highly motivated R&D leader for the position of Vice President of Membrane Research reporting directly to the Chief Technology Officer. The VP of Materials/Membrane Research will lead global teams engaged with research in materials to develop membranes and media that enables next generation filtration, separation, and purification applications for Pall Industrial business units – Aerospace, Microelectronics, Fluid Technologies and Asset Protection and Food & Beverage - with combined annual revenues >$1.5B.

Title: Senior Software Engineer
Job_Description:
At Cepheid, we are passionate about improving health care through fast, accurate diagnostic testing. Our mission drives us, every moment of every day, as we develop scalable, groundbreaking solutions to solve the world’s most complex health challenges. Our associates are involved in every stage of molecular diagnostics, from ideation to development and delivery of testing advancements that improve patient outcomes across a range of settings. As a member of our team, you can make an immediate, measurable impact on a global scale, within an environment that fosters career growth and development.
Cepheid is proud to work alongside a community of six fellow Danaher Diagnostics companies. Together, we’re working at the pace of change on diagnostic tools that address the world’s biggest health challenges, driven by knowing that behind every test there is a patient waiting.
Learn about the Danaher Business System which makes everything possible. Support of the DBS mindset and continuous improvement is integral to this role.

Title: Senior Software Engineer
Job_Description:
Customer Service Engineer
Videojet Technologies
Location: Remote with Regional Travel
Please note that this posting is open for talent pipelining purposes and to be considered for future opportunities.
Videojet Technologies (a Danaher Company) is a world-leader in the product identification market, providing in-line printing, coding, and marking products, application specific fluids, and product life cycle services. Our goal is to partner with our customers in the consumer packaged goods, pharmaceutical, and industrial goods industries to improve their productivity, to protect and grow their brands, and to stay ahead of industry trends and regulations. With our customer application experts and technology leadership in continuous ink jet (CIJ), thermal ink jet (TIJ), laser marking, thermal transfer overprinting (TTO), case coding and labeling, and wide array printing, Videojet has more than 325,000 printers installed worldwide.
We empower creativity and unconventional thinking to help us uncover breakthrough solutions and accelerate the pace of innovation. We believe with conviction that diversity helps us uncover more powerful customer insights and ultimately creates a competitive advantage in the markets we serve. And we would love to have you on this journey with us! Apply today.
The Customer Service Engineer is a unique opportunity to be the front line of Videojet's customer interaction through daily service and support. Through advanced technical and commercial training, you will enhance all aspects of our organization. In this entrepreneurial role, you operate from home and commute to some of the world's largest manufacturing companies. At these sites, you will support sales growth by discussing service agreements, new products, while delivering the highest quality of customer satisfaction in our industry. Our highly advanced industrial equipment will be installed, repaired, and maintained by you at our customer sites. This cross-functional position provides you with new and exciting opportunities to advance based on your performance.
We offer a base salary, service incentive bonus, full benefits including medical, dental, and 401k match from your first day of employment , car, smartphone and a great opportunity to grow!


Create and grow multiple aspects of our business through supporting regional and company goals.
Improve customer satisfaction by delivering the highest customer service in our industry.
Identifying, owning, and tracking any issues with an account, according to call escalation procedure, to reach resolution.
Receive and utilize highly advanced technical training at customer accounts on a daily basis
Manage a customer account in its entirety. Determine how Videojet can increase value throughout their business by offering other services. What do you need?
Technical Agility- Mechanical, Electrical, Electronics, Pneumatics, Hydraulics, Computer Hardware and Software; having the desire to work with best-in-class technology and learn new skills.
Strong Interpersonal and Communication skills. Being able to communicate effectively with all levels within an organization, from front line operators to senior management, and remaining professional at all times. This position requires both written and verbal communication skills.
Sense of Urgency - Having the drive and motivation to take action and prioritize daily tasks; working strategically to ensure we are getting to every customer.
Adaptability-being able to think quickly and respond positively to change. Your Education and/or Background Experience will include:
Technical Degree preferred and/or relevant military training; other backgrounds welcome to apply with relevant work history.
Be able to lift up to 50lbs. and stand, lift, stretch, bend, and squat throughout the day.
Must be comfortable with day travel- home most evenings but occasional overnight travel
You will be part of a dynamic team in which there is a high focus on delivering results and continuous improvement, but also where having fun and teamwork is very important.
It's a fast-paced environment, a consultative role, where you will get to partner with people to achieve their strategic business goals.
You will work in a leading global company, with a Manager who cares about you, your strengths and will help you to develop the best possible version of yourself.
You must be eligible to work in the United States without sponsorship required.

At Danaher, your potential is amplified. Our culture of continuous improvement defines who we are, drives our success, and translates to a career without limits for our team of 65,000 intellectually curious associates. Listen to our voices: https://jobs.danaher.com/global/en/our-difference
Danaher Corporation and all Danaher Companies are equal opportunity employers that evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, age, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other characteristics protected by law. The "EEO is the Law" poster is available here.

When you join us, you’ll also be joining Danaher’s global organization, where 80,000 people wake up every day determined to help our customers win. As an associate, you’ll try new things, work hard, and advance your skills with guidance from dedicated leaders, all with the support of powerful Danaher Business System tools and the stability of a tested organization.

Title: Senior Software Engineer
Job_Description:
Beckman Coulter Life Sciences’ mission is to empower those seeking answers to life’s most important scientific and healthcare questions. With a legacy spanning 80+ years, we have long been a trusted partner to our customers, who are working to transform science and healthcare with the next groundbreaking discovery. As part of our team of more than 2,900 associates across 130 countries, you’ll help drive our vision of accelerating answers—and our commitment to excellence.
Beckman Coulter Life Sciences is proud to work alongside a community of nine fellow Danaher Life Sciences companies. Together, we’re pioneering the future of science and medicine, developing products that enable researchers in the fight to save lives.

The Staff Quality Assurance Engineer will represent quality assurance on development core teams, current business project teams or product improvement projects for Beckman Coulter Life Science. Products supported include laboratory automation, centrifugation, genomics, flow cytometry, particle counting and particle characterization systems. Candidates will apply understanding of quality systems, design controls, industry standards and lifecycle processes to product hardware and software including embedded, product and cloud environments.



LI-LM1.

Title: Senior Software Engineer
Job_Description:
Wondering what’s within Beckman Coulter Diagnostics? Take a closer look.

At first glance, you’ll see that for more than 80 years we’ve been dedicated to advancing and optimizing the laboratory to move science and healthcare forward. Join a team where you can be heard, be supported, and always be yourself. We’re building a culture that celebrates backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives of all our associates. Look again and you’ll see we are invested in you, providing the opportunity to build a meaningful career, be creative, and try new things with the support you need to be successful.

Beckman Coulter Diagnostics is proud to work alongside a community of six fellow Diagnostics Companies at Danaher. Together, we’re working at the pace of change to improve patient lives with diagnostic tools that address the world’s biggest health challenges.

The Senior An alyst Technical Customer Support for Beckman Coulter Diagnostics is responsible for collaborating with Global Service, leading product support for Diagnostics systems by providing escalation management, developing, and executing support strategies, and training field specialists and instructors in support of new product launches.

This position is part of Global Service located in Brea, CA and will be Hybrid (Brea, CA local) or Remote (US based). At Beckman Coulter, our vision is to relentlessly reimagine healthcare, one diagnosis at a time.

You will be a part of the Global Technical Support team and report to the Sr Manager, Global Technical Support responsible for leading a team of 7+ support engineers. If you thrive in a multifunctional, customer-supporting role and want to work to build a world-class medical device organization—read on!


Expert level knowledge of clinical informatics, Diagnostic Middleware systems from hardware and software perspective and acquire applications knowledge to aid in problem diagnosis
Expert knowledge of support tools and data analysis including software, RMS, OBIEE and others
Support product development by leading efforts to acquire technical information regarding product performance, competitive features and clinical/research requirements, to ensure Technical Support deliverables are met
Leads others to solve complex problems and can drive resolution by performing in depth analysis of service data to identify root causes to systemic issues and develop interim mitigations and potential corrective actions
Develop creative and effective support strategies, providing feedback to and drafting product documentation such as, service manuals and procedures
Build software and hardware installation procedures for use by internal and external engineers. Responsible for developing and conducting technical training for product lines
Build and execute test procedures and generate test summary reports. Collaborate with all key partners to utilize Danaher Business Systems (DBS) for ongoing process improvement


Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Science, Medical Technology, Clinical Laboratory Science or related technical field with 5+ years of relevant experience in a medical device or related industry OR Master's degree in same fields with 3+ years of relevant experience OR Doctoral degree in same fields with 0+ years of experience
Networking, Cloud Computing, and Amazon Web Service certification, or experience and ability to obtain certification within a year in the role
Demonstrated troubleshooting and problem-solving skills
Strong computer skills and experience with relevant software programs (Oracle Business Intelligence Module Skill)
Ability to travel internationally and domestically approximately 20-30% of the time


Outstanding written and verbal communication skills with the ability to communicate information to multi-functional audiences and management.
Fluent English skills in speaking and writing
Customer Focus - Learns customer business needs and acts to meet those needs. Communicates regularly with customers to learn about their business challenges and requirements.
Focused Urgency - Displays initiative and a willingness to "get it done". Focuses energy on meeting key targets to achieve quality results. Builds action plans to achieve goals.

At Beckman Coulter Diagnostics we believe in designing a better, more sustainable workforce. We recognize the benefits of flexible, hybrid working arrangements for eligible roles and are committed to providing enriching careers, no matter the work arrangement. This position is eligible for a hybrid work arrangement in which you can work part-time at the Company location identified above and part-time remotely from your home. Additional information about this hybrid work arrangement will be provided by your interview team. Explore the flexibility and challenge that working for Beckman Coulter Diagnostics can provide.

The salary range for this role is $80,000 - $110,000. This is the range that we in good faith believe is the range of possible compensation for this role at the time of this posting. We may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range. This range is only applicable for jobs to be performed in Colorado. This range may be modified in the future.

This job is also eligible for bonus/incentive pay.

We offer comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off, medical/dental/vision insurance and 401(k) to eligible employees.

Title: Senior Software Engineer
Job_Description:
This position is located onsite at the company location in Bellevue, WA.

About Sea-Bird Scientific

A wholly owned subsidiary of Danaher Corporation (NYSE: DHR), Sea-Bird Scientific ( www.seabird.com ) is headquartered in Bellevue, Washington. Sea-Bird Scientific is the world’s largest developer and manufacturer of products for the measurement of salinity, temperature, pressure, dissolved oxygen, fluorescence, nutrients and related oceanographic parameters in marine waters. We offer products to support best-in-class oceanography and climate science. We offer an entrepreneurial environment that is team-centered, customer-driven, quality-focused, and growth-oriented.

Working at Sea-Bird Scientific gives you access to a robust career development process and challenging stretch opportunities. Sea-Bird Scientific is proud to be one of Danaher's Water Quality companies . Through strong customer partnerships, the water platform advances the quality and delivery of water. Want to help us in this mission?


This is an exciting opportunity to make a significant impact in improving and sustaining our oceanographic instruments that are vital to improving our understanding of the oceans and our climate! You will optimize the design, manufacturability, and testing processes for Sea-Bird Scientific’s products. These complex products are designed to be deployed in the ocean for a variety of uses and withstand harsh environments while maintaining accuracy in data collection to support oceanographic research and the scientific community.

We are looking for a smart, innovative, and high-energy mechanical engineer who is driven to continuously improve our ability to deliver market leading technology with a focus on quality, reliability, and performance.


Improve DFM in all points of production
Develop innovative solutions to existing design constraints through redesign efforts to capture VAVE/Scrap savings
Collect appropriate data to define, identify, analyze, and improve manufacturing throughput and product quality.
Support Manufacturing in optimizing the design of fixture/tools for the ease of manufacturing and cost optimization
Supports Engineering team to sustain existing products per program and resource needs.
Performs troubleshooting, diagnoses and resolves problems to component, module level, or system level.
Develop test plans and conduct in-house and field testing that cover the expected customer use environment and operation conditions.
Analyze and develop system and sub-system requirements and relationships with component specifications
Interact with machine shops and vendors throughout the design cycle for optimizing the design from manufacturability and cost stand points
Generation of Engineering Change Orders (change to the existing designs or introducing new designs plus V&V and release).
Generation of Verification and Validation test protocols (Software, Hardware and System) and the execution of the test cases.

Qualifications
Degree in Mechanical, Manufacturing, or Systems Engineering - (BS + 2 yrs exp, MS + 1 yrs exp).
1+ years’ experience in mechanical engineering or related manufacturing engineering field
Hands on experience with either Mechanical or Electrical testing
SolidWorks experience, modeling and GD&T (other computer-added design software tools)
Understanding of fabrication methods and design constraints
Proficient with Microsoft Office applications (mainly Word, Excel)


Electrical-mechanical, process improvement, machining, or DFM background
Some software/programming experience is a plus (C, C++, python, Matlab)

When you join us, you’ll also be joining Danaher’s global organization, where 80,000 people wake up every day determined to help our customers win. As an associate, you’ll try new things, work hard, and advance your skills with guidance from dedicated leaders, all with the support of powerful Danaher Business System tools and the stability of a tested organization.

Title: Senior Software Engineer
Job_Description:
Find what drives you on a team with a more than 70-year history of discovery, determination, and innovation. As a global leader in high-tech filtration, separation, and purification, Pall Corporation thrives on helping our customers protect people. Our products serve a wide range of markets, so if your interests lie along the spectrum of Life Sciences to Industrial, you’ll find a rewarding role here. For the exponentially curious, Pall is a place you can thrive and amplify your impact on the world. Pall is proud to work alongside a community of nine fellow Danaher Life Sciences companies. Together, we’re pioneering the future of science and medicine, developing products that enable researchers in the fight to save lives. What you’ll do
The Maintenance/Facilities Manager supervises the Facilities, Maintenance, and Metrology (external) resources to result in stable and 100% availability of Facility/Utility infrastructure services and Production Equipment to support Production/Operations activities
Monitor utility (electricity, water, sewer, natural gas, telecom) services, raw usage, rate, normalized for production usage to identify patterns and areas to target for improvement initiatives
Analyze rate, usage patterns, and overall cost including negotiation with business representatives of utilities to provide the most advantageous rate structure
Continuous improvement initiatives to reduce usage and normalized cost of utilities
Specific services to maintain environmental clean production and laboratory areas
Non hazardous waste removal of multiple waste streams and recycled waste removal stream
Assisting with Management of departmental budget including; Projection of utility usage/cost based on input from Planning/Operations, Projection of utility rate and cost structure changes, Projection of overtime required to complete Facilities and equipment maintenance and instrumentation calibration services to allow for Production time needs
Support of other departments (R&D, Quality, etc.) within the Pall Hauppauge facility
Design and support of production equipment and facility infrastructure, maintenance and troubleshooting of facility and production equipment and systems, process quality improvements
Manages plant process control systems including computer hardware and software
Establishes and monitors Key Performance Indicators (downtime, process yield/scrap, and Cpk) and continuously improves performance
Coordinate departmental resources with other departments to support capital and expense upgrades to production equipment
Monitor, analyze, and improve facility infrastructure using internal and external engineering resources in order to reduce operating expenses, facilitate growth, and minimize downtime
Active participation in and approval of equipment turnover (IQ) from R&D, Advanced Engineering, Product or Process Engineering Who you are
Bachelors Degree preferred
Certified Facilities Manager (CFM) or equivalent (preferred)
Certified Energy Manager (CEM) or equivalent (preferred)
Professional Engineer (PE) license (optional)
7 or more years of progressive experience in the following functional areas: Machinery maintenance, Manufacturing Engineering, Process and/or Quality Engineering
Knowledge of Automation Systems and concepts including process instrumentation, programmable logic controller (PLC), logic and Human Machine Interface (HMI) applications
Ability to justify, design, procure, install and qualify production equipment. This includes scope definition, justification, budgeting, project planning, implementation, qualification, and turn over
Knowledge of good manufacturing practices (GMP’s) and procedures, ISO9000 and other regulatory requirements and how they impact manufacturing.
Proficiency in the use of the latest versions of the following software packages or equivalent: Microsoft Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint, and Project (required), MP2 or equivalent Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS) (preferred), Minitab and/or Quality Analyst (preferred, AutoCAD, any version (optional), Wonderware Human Machine Interface (HMI) or equivalent (optional)
Demonstrated ability to prioritize multiple projects and employees in order to achieve goals and objectives. This includes the ability to determine key requirements of a task, developing specific milestones, resource allocation, use of six sigma methodologies, and follow up to ensure completion.

Title: Senior Software Engineer
Job_Description:
This is a Junior Firmware Engineer position located at our Loveland, Colorado location. It is a hybrid position where you can work part-time at the Company location identified above and part-time remotely from your home.

About Hach:
Our work at Hach ensures water quality for people around the world. Our customer partnerships, passionate experts, and reliable, easy-to-use solutions make water analysis better—faster, simpler, greener, and more informative. As a member of our team, you’ll get to make an immediate, measurable impact on a global scale, within industries from aviation to manufacturing to mining. You’ll also be part of an environment that fosters career growth and professional development, with kindness at its core. And you’ll be part of our mission, which drives us to develop water quality solutions that protect the health and safety of all living things.

About the Role:
Do you want to be part of a fun-filled, high-energy team that bridges the gap between hardware and software to provide high value solutions to water quality customers?

Join us at Hach as we continue to revolutionize the water quality industry.


Love controlling machinery & electronics through embedded software/firmware
Love bringing electronics to Life
Love robotics
Are a professional or hobbyist/tinkerer with firmware/software skills associated with solution/system development
Have an endless curiosity on how things work

We work in a collaborative environment to drive growth and innovation within the firmware team. Our firmware engineers are highly innovative professionals focused on bringing our water quality products to life.


End-to-End Design and Development of embedded solutions
Collaboration in an Agile firmware development team using scrum processes
Drive firmware quality by using early defect discovery and removal
Analyze acceptance criteria and provide estimates of effort.
Troubleshooting and issue resolution of embedded firmware / embedded software solutions in a sustaining engineering environment


Large 3 building campus which includes a new building designed from the ground up for Research and Development
Work environment like a college senior design project on steroids – nearly everything is in house, and we work in close-knit collaborative teams comprised of nearly all engineering disciplines
Hach bucks the trend of most companies by keeping many things in house (10m EMC chamber, HALT chamber, PCA/SMT line, injection molding, fabrication, production/manufacturing, etc.)
Focused on water quality industry which continues to grow in importance worldwide
Diverse and Inclusive culture

Qualifications
Minimum of Bachelor’s degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related field
2 years of C++ user-space development experience
Experience developing single microprocessor/microcontroller instruments using Linux, RTOS, or bare metal.
Strong OO design principles using C++ to design highly reliable products.
Experience in Agile project management, continuous integration, and unit testing.
Proven proficiency of translating business requirements into data models.


The salary range for this role is 90k - 120k. This is the range that we in good faith believe is the range of possible compensation for this role at the time of this posting. We may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range and this range is only applicable for jobs to be performed in Colorado. This range may be modified in the future.

This job is also eligible for bonus/incentive pay.
We offer comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off, medical/dental/vision insurance and 401(k) to eligible employees.

Title: Senior Software Engineer
Job_Description:
Beckman Coulter Life Sciences’ mission is to empower those seeking answers to life’s most important scientific and healthcare questions. With a legacy spanning 80+ years, we have long been a trusted partner to our customers, who are working to transform science and healthcare with the next groundbreaking discovery. As part of our team of more than 2,900 associates across 130 countries, you’ll help drive our vision of accelerating answers—and our commitment to excellence.
Beckman Coulter Life Sciences is proud to work alongside a community of nine fellow Danaher Life Sciences companies. Together, we’re pioneering the future of science and medicine, developing products that enable researchers in the fight to save lives.

Do you enjoy delivering superb products and instruments to customers? Would you love to lead a growing market? Come join our dynamic manufacturing team! Summary:
We are seeking a Staff Manufacturing System Engineer to join our team in support of growing demand for our acoustic liquid handling products. The Staff Manufacturing Systems Engineer will support both sustaining of released products and introduction of new designs and products into manufacturing.


Hands-on product and process design, development, and verification tasks related to hardware, software, and microplate consumable interoperability, with the goal of achieving overall product and process performance requirements for our liquid handling platform in manufacturing.
Collaborate cross-functionally with development, supply chain and production teams to deliver product and process solutions and improvements that achieve company objectives


B.S./M.S. in Systems Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, or similar engineering field.
7+ years proven experience in a manufacturing engineering environment including process engineering, design engineering and management of design transfer of complex systems into manufacturing. Preferred Attributes:
Experience with design, documentation, and assembly of complex instrumentation which incorporate optical, mechanical, electrical, software, and liquid handling components.
Ability to communicate and manage design transfer activities including design intent, risks, risk mitigations and impact through FMEAs and other lean manufacturing tools.
Comfortable operating sophisticated computer and instrumentation equipment/hardware.
Demonstrated basic laboratory skills, including reagent handling techniques is a plus
Proficient with SolidWorks, PDMworks and design documentation is a plus
Proficiency with AutoCAD, ECAD tools, Python, C#, SQL, and LabVIEW programming is a plus.
Understanding of statistical process control, GR&R and other 6-sigma and lean manufacturing tools including JMP statistical software is a plus.
Lean Manufacturing experience is a plus.

Title: Senior Software Engineer
Job_Description:
Do you want to help advance scientific discovery, improving quality of life around the world? We do, too.
Molecular Devices has the opportunity to be the innovation partner that empowers scientists to fast-track research breakthroughs, leading to earlier diagnoses and safer drug treatments. We’re a dynamic, female-led life science solutions provider of high-performance bioanalytical measurement systems, software, and consumables. With Molecular Devices, you’ll grow your career with best-in-class teams in a culture of collaboration engagement, diversity, and inclusion.

Molecular Devices is proud to work alongside a community of nine fellow Danaher Life Sciences companies. Together, we’re pioneering the future of science and medicine, developing products that enable researchers in the fight to save lives.

JOB SUMMARY:
We have a unique opportunity for someone passionate about life sciences and role for an Automation Solutions Engineer to join our Automation & Workflow Solutions team.

This role involves building, installing and supporting Molecular Devices robotic integrations for laboratories around the world. The ideal candidate is an independent, fast learner who is self-motivated, wants to advance through the Company. A passion for problem solving, software and robotics and comfortable speaking to customers and stakeholders both technically and professionally is required.

This is a fully remote role with travel to the Midwest and San Jose areas.

This is an exciting opportunity to grow and scale Molecular Devices’ integration services. You will deploy your mechanical and software skill set to directly impact the quality and design of our automated lab systems. As the technical lead for installation and post-install service and support, you will be responsible for configuring robotic platforms to meet and exceed customer specifications. You will also have the opportunity to grow our service and support footprint by documenting, training and supporting Molecular Devices technical support and field service teams.


Execute automation projects to agreed customer requirements
Review Statements of Work
Provide design input for both software and hardware on integrated platforms
Manage the design, build and deployment of automation platforms
Program and script custom software modules
Ensure safety and accurate performance of our systems
Complete Site and Factory Acceptance Tests
Travel to customer sites to deploy automated laboratory solutions as required


Degree in a technical discipline (Electrical, Computer/Software, Mechanical, Biomedical) or relevant work experience
+5 years laboratory automation experience
Current Driver’s License and Passport are required.
Basic mechanical and electrical repair skills. Mechanical design and Solid Works experience a plus. Understanding how to write tools and scripts. C# experience a plus
Familiarity with networking (TCP/IP), databases, XML, serial communication and general understanding of network topologies such as VPNs, firewalls, and routers
This is an Evergreen long term Posting

Title: Senior Software Engineer
Job_Description:
About Esko
Esko is a worldwide market leader with software and hardware products for packaging buyers, designers and manufacturers for the packaging, label and commercial print industries. Our hardware solutions include AVT print inspection vision solutions and Flexo laser platemaking systems. With headquarters in Belgium, Esko employs around 1,800 people worldwide. Our global sales and support organization covers Europe, the Americas, Asia-Pacific and Japan. Esko operates as a subsidiary of Danaher Corporation, one of the best performing Fortune 500 companies. See also https://www.esko.com/
This Job is an Unique Opportunity:
We are looking for a colleague to join our team as a field service technician. You will be helping our customers with all their hardware and software related service needs. You interact daily onsite or via phone and email with customers and other Esko staff. This job requires extensive travel throughout the US and some in Canada.

Job_Description:
Do you want to help advance scientific discovery, improving quality of life around the world? We do, too.
Molecular Devices has the opportunity to be the innovation partner that empowers scientists to fast-track research breakthroughs, leading to earlier diagnoses and safer drug treatments.

We’re a dynamic, female-led life science solutions provider of high-performance bioanalytical measurement systems, software, and consumables. With Molecular Devices, you’ll grow your career with best-in-class teams in a culture of collaboration engagement, diversity, and inclusion.

Molecular Devices is proud to work alongside a community of nine fellow Danaher Life Sciences companies. Together, we’re pioneering the future of science and medicine, developing products that enable researchers in the fight to save lives. Job Description

Do you love technical problem solving? The Technical Support Applications Scientist will utilize their expertise performing technical problem solving on scientific instrument hardware, software, as well as cell-based applications. You must exhibit a passion for customer support on the array of industry leading Molecular Devices microplate readers.

The role is responsible for daily interactions with our external and internal customers, primarily by phone, e-mail, WebEx and Web chat. The job duties will involve updating and maintaining the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) database with a summary of the incident and actions taken. The expectation is that the Technical Support Application Scientist is fully integrated into a dynamic environment supporting existing and newly released products, working with a cross-functional team including Product Support Engineers, Field Applications Scientists, Sales Representatives, Marketing, Product Development, and Operations.


Provide daily scientific, technical, and applications support on an array of Molecular Devices microplate readers

Participate in trainings on both new and existing supported products

Perform technical problem solving on hardware, software, and cell-based assays, working with available company resources and escalating issues as needed

Communicate with our customers using phone, email, WebEx and Web chat

Update and maintain the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) database (SalesForce/ServiceMax) with relevant case information

Create and maintain Knowledge Base articles and Technical Notes

Perform revenue generating activities including sales lead generation

Participate in continuous improvement activities using Danaher Business System tools

Work with cross-functional teams to ensure supportability of new product releases


MS/Ph.D in Biochemistry, Cell Biology, Molecular Biology, Bioengineering or related field with 4+ years of laboratory experience

Thorough knowledge of cell-based assay techniques

Experience in analyzing complex data, troubleshooting hardware and software issues and be an independent problem solver

Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Track record for delivering results and takes ownership of actions

Embraces challenge with a passion for continuous improvement

Proficient at promoting products and services

Customer Service oriented, with a high sense of urgency


Customer support and/or teaching experience are a plus

Familiarity with modern methods of drug discovery, computer networking, and lab automation is a plus

Hands-on experience with Molecular Devices’ SpectraMax microplate readers (e.g. M Series, i3x, and iDx), associated reagents, and SoftMax Pro data acquisition and analysis software is highly desirable

Job_Description:
Do you want to help advance scientific discovery, improving quality of life around the world? We do, too.
Molecular Devices has the opportunity to be the innovation partner that empowers scientists to fast-track research breakthroughs, leading to earlier diagnoses and safer drug treatments. We’re a dynamic, female-led life science solutions provider of high-performance bioanalytical measurement systems, software, and consumables. With Molecular Devices, you’ll grow your career with best-in-class teams in a culture of collaboration engagement, diversity, and inclusion.

Molecular Devices is proud to work alongside a community of nine fellow Danaher Life Sciences companies. Together, we’re pioneering the future of science and medicine, developing products that enable researchers in the fight to save lives.

JOB SUMMARY:
We have a unique opportunity for someone passionate about life sciences and role for an Automation Solutions Engineer to join our Automation & Workflow Solutions team.

This role involves building, installing and supporting Molecular Devices robotic integrations for laboratories around the world. The ideal candidate is an independent, fast learner who is self-motivated, wants to advance through the Company. A passion for problem solving, software and robotics and comfortable speaking to customers and stakeholders both technically and professionally is required.

This is a fully remote role with travel to the Midwest and San Jose areas.

This is an exciting opportunity to grow and scale Molecular Devices’ integration services. You will deploy your mechanical and software skill set to directly impact the quality and design of our automated lab systems. As the technical lead for installation and post-install service and support, you will be responsible for configuring robotic platforms to meet and exceed customer specifications. You will also have the opportunity to grow our service and support footprint by documenting, training and supporting Molecular Devices technical support and field service teams.


Execute automation projects to agreed customer requirements
Review Statements of Work
Provide design input for both software and hardware on integrated platforms
Manage the design, build and deployment of automation platforms
Program and script custom software modules
Ensure safety and accurate performance of our systems
Complete Site and Factory Acceptance Tests
Travel to customer sites to deploy automated laboratory solutions as required


Degree in a technical discipline (Electrical, Computer/Software, Mechanical, Biomedical) or relevant work experience
+5 years laboratory automation experience
Current Driver’s License and Passport are required.
Basic mechanical and electrical repair skills. Mechanical design and Solid Works experience a plus. Understanding how to write tools and scripts. C# experience a plus
Familiarity with networking (TCP/IP), databases, XML, serial communication and general understanding of network topologies such as VPNs, firewalls, and routers
This is an Evergreen long term Posting

Job_Description:
Wondering what’s within Beckman Coulter? Take a closer look.

Join a team where you can be heard, be supported, and always be yourself. At Beckman Coulter, a Danaher company, we’re building a culture that celebrates backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives of all our associates. We hope you’ll see yourself here, too. What you find at Beckman Coulter—and within yourself— might just change the world!

The position of Lead HFE / UX Engineer reports to the Senior Manager R&D, Clinical Informatics BU with the primary responsibility to support development and deployment of DxONE Portfolio :

An automated, end-to-end software application that increases operational efficiency by automatically recording†, tracking and optimizing your laboratory’s consumables.
Amplifies productivity and future-proofs a lab by incorporating the industry’s first cloud-based middleware solution.
Efficiently manages laboratory performance and productivity by establishing a centralized point of control connecting up to 18 instruments or automation systems across the network.
Identifies patterns and reduces inefficiencies with a cloud-based software solution that provides actionable insights and lab data analytics to streamline operations.


Collaborate with cross functional teams, coach, facilitate the use of UX best practices, tools, frameworks
Develop high-level and detailed wireframes, storyboards, and mockups as part of the DxONE HFE team.
Be part of design process as part of key development projects and perform workflow analysis and risk analysis activities such as task and use error analysis. Ensure traceability to design mitigations and requirements for risk areas
Plan and execute usability studies (Formative and Summative), analyze data, document results, and present recommendations to product teams.
Work closely with R&D teams across geographies to ensure accurate implementation, compliance of designs
Utilize UX best practices to create user centric solutions and workflow design
Influence adoption of ideas and solutions with key cross functional stakeholders across geographies
Identify and address usability issues while participating in Voice-Of-Customer studies
Use proven HFE methodologies and tools, recommend changes to improve the overall usability, user interfaces, and ensure a safe and reliable user experience.
Travel - domestic & international (less than 25%).


Bachelors/Master’s Degree in Human Factors, Human Computer Interaction, User Experience Design or other related fields
8+ years relevant experience in user experience design roles
Proficiency with Adobe Creative Cloud or other web design tools
Experience and expertise in the software design process, interaction design, user research, and usability
Proficiency with Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio), and Wireframe design and statistical analysis tools.
Ability to apply user-centered design and usability engineering principles to product research, development, and design.

Leadership Experience
Proactive communication
Ability to work with multi-functional and remote teams
Experience with Agile Scrum based Software Development.
Ability to conduct Style Guide compliance reviews and provide reports.


12+ years relevant experience in user/HFE experience design roles
Experience in healthcare domain
Advanced degree in Human Factors engineering or equivalent.
Exposure to Human Factors techniques and methodologies and application towards the design and development of medical device related software in compliance with FDA and other regulatory standards and guidelines. (e.g., FDA human Factors guidance, IEC 62366, AAMI HE75).
Experience developing medical devices and working with customers.
Well versed in the “human element” and able to empathize with a wide variety of users.
Self-starter with a sense of urgency to resolve issues and complete tasks.

Title: Automation Solutions Engineer-USA Remote
Job_Description:
About Esko
Esko is a worldwide market leader with software and hardware products for packaging buyers, designers and manufacturers for the packaging, label and commercial print industries. Our hardware solutions include AVT print inspection vision solutions and Flexo laser platemaking systems. With headquarters in Belgium, Esko employs around 1,800 people worldwide. Our global sales and support organization covers Europe, the Americas, Asia-Pacific and Japan. Esko operates as a subsidiary of Danaher Corporation, one of the best performing Fortune 500 companies. See also https://www.esko.com/
This Job is an Unique Opportunity:
We are looking for a colleague to join our team as a field service technician. You will be helping our customers with all their hardware and software related service needs. You interact daily onsite or via phone and email with customers and other Esko staff. This job requires extensive travel throughout the US and some in Canada.

Title: Automation Solutions Engineer-USA Remote
Job_Description:
At first glance, you’ll see Danaher’s scale. Our 80,000 associates work across the globe at more than 20 unique operating companies within four platforms—life sciences, diagnostics, water quality, and product identification. Look again and you’ll see the opportunity to build a meaningful career, be creative, and take risks with the support you need to be successful. You’ll find associates who are as certain about their impact as they are about where they’re headed next. You’ll find the Danaher Business System, which makes everything possible. You’ll also see a company that investors trust—our culture of continuous improvement has helped us outperform the S&P 500 by more than 5,000% over the past 25 years.

And no matter where you look at Danaher, at the heart of what we do, you’ll witness our shared purpose—helping realize life’s potential—in action. Whether we’re enabling our customers to provide clean water, supporting a life-saving vaccine development, advancing a new instrument for cancer diagnosis, or ensuring product safety, our work helps improve millions of lives.

We hope you’ll see yourself here, too. What you find at Danaher—and within yourself— might just change the world.

Are you interested in an exciting opportunity to enhance enterprise threat identification and response capabilities using a leading technology solution, Splunk’s Enterprise Security (ES) SIEM? Would you love to translate your knowledge of cyber threats into detection logic that uses diverse data sources from across Danaher’s large global footprint? Work to further Danaher’s adoption and use of the ES feature set!

At Danaher we believe in designing a better, more sustainable workforce. We recognize the benefits of flexible, remote working arrangements for eligible roles and are committed to providing enriching careers, no matter the work arrangement. This position is eligible for a remote work arrangement in which you can work remotely from your home. Additional information about this remote work arrangement will be provided by your interview team. Explore the flexibility and challenge that working for Danaher can provide.

Responsibilities

Develop, maintain and enhance threat detection logic in Splunk ES

Evaluate new Splunk ES product features and their fitness for use in the environment. Execute and provide oversight of the Splunk ES currency plan and updates for related threat detection components.

Identify and lead continuous Splunk ES architectural, configuration, usage and other improvements

Define, implement and enhance threat detection related engineering standards and practices

Qualifications

5+ years of experience with Splunk search language (SPL), developing custom searches using macros, lookups and related features. Experienced with developing advanced correlation rules utilizing Splunk tstats and data models.

Experienced with applying search logic to common log formats and security identifiers from Windows, Linux and network security devices

Experienced with creating and maintaining Splunk data models and knowledge objects

Experienced creating regex for pattern matching

Preferred Qualifications

College or university degree or equivalent in computer science or similar discipline

Splunk Enterprise Certified Admin certification

Splunk Enterprise Security Admin certification

Prior experience working in a Security Operations Center or for a Managed Security Services Provider (MSSP)

Familiarity working with threat intelligence products for enrichment of detection and response alerts

Familiarity with Palo Alto Cortex XSOAR or similar enterprise SOAR solutions

Title: Staff Systems Integration Engineer
Job_Description:
Wondering what’s within Beckman Coulter Diagnostics? Take a closer look.

At first glance, you’ll see that for more than 80 years we’ve been dedicated to advancing and optimizing the laboratory to move science and healthcare forward. Join a team where you can be heard, be supported, and always be yourself. We’re building a culture that celebrates backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives of all our associates. Look again and you’ll see we are invested in you, providing the opportunity to build a meaningful career, be creative, and try new things with the support you need to be successful.

Beckman Coulter Diagnostics is proud to work alongside a community of six fellow Diagnostics Companies at Danaher. Together, we’re working at the pace of change to improve patient lives with diagnostic tools that address the world’s biggest health challenges.

The Staff Systems Integration Engineer will work as part of new product development for next generation Microbiology diagnostic instruments with a focus on executing characterization, verification and validation tasks. This position is based in Sacramento, CA and will be hybrid (mix of remote and on-site) work depending upon business needs. This is an exciting and challenging opportunity to be a part of a rapidly growing industry working on the cutting edge of medical diagnostic technologies in a research and development environment. You’ll have the opportunity to work directly with scientists and engineers to ensure we have the right solutions to meet the needs of a constantly evolving healthcare environment. If you thrive in a high-functioning matrixed environment and want to work to build a world-class R&D organization—read on.


Hands-on design and execution of complex test methods (including design and implementation of test fixtures) to assess hardware, software, and system performance per Design Input Requirements, in compliance with Quality and Regulatory requirements.
Work independently in a cross-disciplinary environment to plan and execute experiments, defining and using specialized test equipment, and perform experimental data analysis.
Analyze complex data via statistical methods and provide written and oral reports and updates to senior and executive management.
Write and execute systems verification protocols
Work with cross-functional team to quickly investigate and identify countermeasures for new product issues on new product development and legacy products
Conducts root cause investigations and Failure analyses to solve reliability and performance issues on legacy products
Analyze data to assess system performance
Drive continuous improvement projects
Plan projects, step action plans and manage/prioritize multiple tasks


Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, or a related technical discipline with 9+ years of experience as a hands-on systems or systems-integration engineer OR Master’s degree with 7+ years of experience of systems experience.
Experience developing complex instrumentation systems which incorporate LAN/Cloud-based computing, optical, mechanical, environmental, algorithm, firmware components with inter-system measures and measurement systems.
Experience with and ability to detail work per ISO9000/FDA regulation.
Excellent collaboration and communication skills to enable c oordinating and aligning system-level integration efforts between workstreams, throughout characterization and qualification; Includes aspects of:
System modeling, apportionment, and measurement system analysis of essential performance requirements between sub-systems.
System risk management and alignment of risk mitigations across the subsystems and requirements.
System reliability modeling and monitoring; Proposes Continuous improvement of the high-impact issues.
Human Factors and Usability to minimize system workflow errors, effort, and operator strain.
Statistics experience, including proficiency in Design of Experiments and the use of Excel or other tools such as JMP, Origin, Matlab, R, Python, Mathematica, or Minitab, etc.) for data analysis and interpretation.

Title: Staff Systems Integration Engineer
Job_Description:
Wondering what’s within the Diagnostics Platform and Danaher?
Take a closer look.

The family of Diagnostics companies at Danaher work with conviction that every moment matters and realize that behind every test is a patient, waiting for an answer that could change their life. Our 23,000 team members, across 6 operating companies globally, proudly push the boundaries of what’s possible in safeguarding patient health and improving diagnostic confidence. We develop tools and technologies that set the standard for innovation and impact wherever health care happens—from a family physician’s office to leading trauma hospitals and laboratories. Our teams collaborate in an inclusive environment as we connect our people, processes, and expertise, focused on the world’s biggest health challenges such as cardiac disease, infectious disease, and cancer. At the Diagnostics platform at Danaher, you’ll thrive and quickly see the impact of your contribution.

Join us in working at the pace of change to improve patient lives!

The S enior Software Engineer will play a vital role in supporting the Sr. Manager, Data & Analytics, to develop the tools & capabilities of the Danaher Diagnostics Data Platform (D3P). This position is part of the Clinical Insights Team at Danaher Diagnostics and will be fully remote.


Collaborate with stakeholders to understand data requirements for Data Engineering , Analytics, and Data Science projects.

Assemble large, complex data sets from disparate sources, writing code, scripts, and queries, as appropriate to efficiently extract, QC, clean, harmonize and visualize Big D ata sets.

Develop software tools for data engineering tasks following industry standard practices such as agile, test-driven development, and CI/CD and deliver them to internal customers .

Identify, design, and implement continuous process improvements such as automating manual processes and optimizing data delivery.

Document data processes, write data management recommended procedures, and create training materials relating to data management best practices.


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science OR equivalent experience

9 years of experience

Expertise in Python with strong knowledge of Python best practices, particularly as they apply to the area of data & analytics, and experience using standard data science tool s (e .g., Pandas , numpy , Jupyter ).

Advanced SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.

Experience with distributed systems and IP-based networking

Experience with modern software engineering practices that include code reviews and pull requests, test-driven development, and CI/CD.


Experience in p erforming data engineering tasks on RWD/RWE projects involving Electronic Medical Records (EMR) data .

Experience in developing software solutions on public cloud infrastructures, particularly Amazon AWS and Microsoft Azure .

Knowledge of security and privacy requirements and certifications, including HIPAA, GDPR, ISO9001, ISO27001 .

Experience with a variety of standard Python data visualization methods .

Knowledge of cluster computing and large-scale data analytics platforms such as Apache Spark , Dask , and Ray .

At first glance, you’ll see that for more than 80 years we’ve been dedicated to advancing and optimizing the laboratory to move science and healthcare forward. The Senior An alyst Technical Customer Support for Beckman Coulter Diagnostics is responsible for collaborating with Global Service, leading product support for Diagnostics systems by providing escalation management, developing, and executing support strategies, and training field specialists and instructors in support of new product launches.

This position is part of Global Service located in Brea, CA and will be Hybrid (Brea, CA local) or Remote (US based). At Beckman Coulter, our vision is to relentlessly reimagine healthcare, one diagnosis at a time.

You will be a part of the Global Technical Support team and report to the Sr Manager, Global Technical Support responsible for leading a team of 7+ support engineers. If you thrive in a multifunctional, customer-supporting role and want to work to build a world-class medical device organization—read on!


Expert level knowledge of clinical informatics, Diagnostic Middleware systems from hardware and software perspective and acquire applications knowledge to aid in problem diagnosis
Expert knowledge of support tools and data analysis including software, RMS, OBIEE and others
Support product development by leading efforts to acquire technical information regarding product performance, competitive features and clinical/research requirements, to ensure Technical Support deliverables are met
Leads others to solve complex problems and can drive resolution by performing in depth analysis of service data to identify root causes to systemic issues and develop interim mitigations and potential corrective actions
Develop creative and effective support strategies, providing feedback to and drafting product documentation such as, service manuals and procedures

Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Science, Medical Technology, Clinical Laboratory Science or related technical field with 5+ years of relevant experience in a medical device or related industry OR Master's degree in same fields with 3+ years of relevant experience OR Doctoral degree in same fields with 0+ years of experience
Networking, Cloud Computing, and Amazon Web Service certification, or experience and ability to obtain certification within a year in the role
Demonstrated troubleshooting and problem-solving skills
Strong computer skills and experience with relevant software programs (Oracle Business Intelligence Module Skill)
Ability to travel internationally and domestically approximately 20-30% of the time


Outstanding written and verbal communication skills with the ability to communicate information to multi-functional audiences and management.
Fluent English skills in speaking and writing
Customer Focus - Learns customer business needs and acts to meet those needs. Communicates regularly with customers to learn about their business challenges and requirements.
Focused Urgency - Displays initiative and a willingness to "get it done". Focuses energy on meeting key targets to achieve quality results. Builds action plans to achieve goals.

Title: Staff Systems Integration Engineer
Job_Description:
Leica Microsystems has helped shape the future for over 170 years, by developing groundbreaking optical and digital solutions. As a global leader, we’re driven by continuous improvement to excite our customers and to create the best work environment for our people. Customer focus, innovation, and teamwork are at the core of our culture and the foundation of our success.

Want to be part of a company whose products are part of cutting-edge research around the world? Join Leica Microsystems in our commitment for brilliant solutions and insight.

AIVIA SALES SPECIALIST - WEST
Aivia Software, a world leader in machine learning, computer vision, 3D image visualization and analysis is seeking an entrepreneurial individual to help support the rapidly growing Aivia business.

The Sales and Applications Specialist (West coast USA territory) will focus on introducing Aivia to potential customers and provide top level customer support with all aspects related to image visualization, analysis and presentation. Aivia’s unique blend of powerful solutions include deep learning powered image segmentation / classification / painting / prediction / restoration, automated 3D neuronal analysis, 3D object detection and tracking, real-time machine learning aided image segmentation, cloud computing, advanced machine learning phenotype discovery and classification, in addition to twelve 2D and 2D+time image analysis applications for life sciences.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES
This exciting position is ideal for an individual that excels at business development, serving the customer, sales, public speaking, life sciences, microscopy and image analysis. The ideal candidate will be based in San Diego or the San Francisco Bay area.
This is a telecommute / remote job. The selected candidate can be in any major metro area in California. 5-10 days of travel expected per month.

Develop strategies designed to increase sales of Leica products in assigned territory. Recommend product, pricing, advertising and sales promotion strategies

Identifies selling opportunities across product lines, including lead generation

Identify customer gaps and equate to sales opportunity

Leads team selling efforts in all identified accounts

Conduct analysis and performance evaluation of all sales in assigned region by use of the Sales Force.Com tool. The evaluation includes sales call activities, follow up on sales leads, attendance at trade shows, contacts with local governments, associations, and academic institutions, and traveling with other product specialists to improve their field sales skills and product knowledge

Generates and acts on the feedback on customer preferences, suggestions, product performance and other information to enhance the sale of Leica Confocal products.

Works with customers or other experts to generate appropriate field data and application notes or publications which highlight product benefits and helps differentiate Leica products

Works in a team environment with Account Managers and Confocal Sales specialists to qualify AIVIA leads and drive Leica solutions through the sales process.

Performs demonstrations on AIVIA offerings.

Manage competitors moves and manage intuition of dynamics

Closing the deal – has primary responsibility to move a successful demonstration to an order

Applies solid commercial knowledge (price, topline growth, discounts, P&L impact)

Ensures that customers are satisfied! Also, must be capable of working effectively with Sales Managers, PLT members, Customer Service Technicians and Representatives, Engineers, Accounting, Manufacturing, and Dealers to do whatever is necessary to satisfy customers' needs.

YOUR EXPERIENCE

BA, BS, MS or PhD degree in physics or chemistry or a related scientific field

2 years related microscopy experience in a laboratory

2 years image analysis experience


Sales experience in selling products of a technical nature is desirable

Knowledge of the microscopy and image analysis market is also highly desirable

Excellent oral and written communication skills with customers and management

Strong technical, electrochemical, optical and mechanical aptitude

Knowledge of python coding is a plus.

WHAT WE OFFER

Competitive Salary as well as relocation packages

Continuous training, support and focus on your personal development

Workplace Flexibility

Summer Hours

Title: Manager, Assay Development
Job_Description:
Leica Biosystems’ mission of “Advancing Cancer Diagnostics, Improving Lives” is at the heart of our corporate culture. We’re a global leader in cancer diagnostics with the most comprehensive portfolio from biopsy to diagnosis. Our easy-to-use and consistently reliable offerings help improve workflow efficiency and diagnostic confidence.
Our associates know that every moment matters when it comes to cancer diagnostics. When you come to work, you’re helping develop solutions that enable accurate diagnoses to turn anxiety into answers. Join our diverse, global team of talented people, and be inspired to grow every day.

Leica Biosystems is proud to work alongside a community of six fellow Diagnostics Companies at Danaher. Together, we’re working at the pace of change to improve patient lives with diagnostic tools that address the world’s biggest health challenges.

The Staff Clinical Research Scientist works closely with the Global Clinical leadership team to develop and execute comprehensive evidence plans to support global growth initiatives. The role requires leading global evidence initiatives to support new product development, pre and post-market studies, and internal evidence development processes across multiple functions.


Evidence strategy – synthesis of Voice of Customer requirements into recommended evidence investments. Comprehensive evidence plan for all priority products and markets to meet customer needs and drive market awareness/adoption.

Study design – protocol writing, enrollment strategy, collaboration on statistical analysis plan/data management plan, monitoring plan writing

Study conduct – supports the clinical operations team with the conduct of clinical studies

Study reporting – data analysis & presentation to internal and external stakeholders, contribution to clinical reports and peer-reviewed publications

Providing direction and task oversight to others on the clinical team for one or more programs

Leads the investigator initiates study and medical/clinical information request processes

Provides oversight and approval for select marketing claims and materials

The role involves collaborations with internal project stakeholders (Product Development, Clinical Affairs, R&D, Quality, Regulatory, Health Economics and Reimbursement, Medical Affairs, etc.) and external partners (such as co-development collaborators and CROs).

Your areas of knowledge and expertise that matter most for this role:

Bachelor of Science (B.S.) or Master of Science (M.S.) or Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.). and a minimum of the following years of industry or relevant experience according to degree:

Bachelor's Degree with 10+ years; Or,

Master's degree with 7+ years; Or,

Doctoral degree with 5+ years.

Demonstrated experience in creating global evidence plans to support new product development, developing clinical strategy, study design/execution, and study monitoring for medical devices in a regulated environment.

Demonstrated experience in effectively negotiating with regulators (such as the U.S. Food and Drug Administration) and designing/executing clinical programs resulting in a successful global commercial release.

Demonstrated strong ability to work in a team environment, with the ability to relate to both highly educated and unskilled team members.

Demonstrated strong ability to handle and resolve conflicts and work under stressful conditions and in an environment of changing priorities.

Demonstrated ability or track record of successful results, building effective teams, and getting work done through others.

Up to 40% (in non-COVID times)

Title: Manager, Assay Development
Job_Description:
A wholly owned subsidiary of Danaher Corporation (NYSE: DHR), Sea-Bird Scientific ( www.seabird.com ) is headquartered in Bellevue, Washington. Sea-Bird Scientific is the world’s largest developer and manufacturer of products for the measurement of salinity, temperature, pressure, dissolved oxygen, fluorescence, nutrients and related oceanographic parameters in marine waters. We offer products to support best-in-class oceanography and climate science. We offer an entrepreneurial environment that is team-centered, customer-driven, quality-focused, and growth-oriented.

Working at Sea-Bird Scientific gives you access to a robust career development process and challenging stretch opportunities. Sea-Bird Scientific is proud to be one of Danaher's Water Quality companies . Through strong customer partnerships, the water platform advances the quality and delivery of water. Want to help us in this mission?

About the role
We are seeking to hire a Production Supervisor to join our team and work onsite , to provide leadership and direction in our instrument manufacturing.

Reporting to the Senior Operations Manager, this Supervisor will manage a team of 10 production, calibration, and testing/quality assurance associates. We have a value stream structure, so our team will rely on your to handle the product lines from beginning to end. This particular value stream is over BGC (biogeochemical) product lines that provide unprecedented sampling of our global oceans. If you thrive tackling competing priorities with a proactive attitude and great attention to detail, and want to make an impact on critical environmental efforts , apply today!

Day to day

Deliver target-based safety, quality, delivery, internal quality and production (SQDIP) metrics. This includes holding weekly production team meetings, and leading the team in meeting the goals and providing and presenting data and results.

Manage Value Chain experiments, communicating with all members of the organization and external customers

Provide personnel supervision and technical support to department associates. This includes setting work schedules and team performance including annual reviews, resolving issues, and making hiring and termination recommendations.

Top-grade talent as required to ensure a strong team

Approve time off requests

Coach, train, and counsel associates to improve performance

Provide, monitor and track training of department associates

Ensure all associates are knowledgeable of, and align with, all work policies and quality requirements

Work with internal department managers/leads to coordinate production schedules and communicate associate needs

Advanced, consistent evaluation of test results to ensure the highest quality for customers; perform analysis and reporting on all new production data

Lead troubleshooting efforts on instruments and equipment

Aid with advanced repairs on equipment

Are you qualified?

Mechanical Engineering, Oceanography, etc.), or equivalent experience. 2+ years professional experience as a functional department lead with direct reports preferred

Ability and experience in process improvement in a technical, complex environment

Experience and comfort in data analysis and reporting, ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions

What makes this opportunity exciting?

Full benefits that start on day ONE including medical, dental, vision, and 401(k) matching

We serve scientists around the globe to help tell us what’s happening beneath the surface of our oceans, helping define strategy for important initiatives regarding climate change, ecosystem health, and more!

Our team at Sea-bird is dedicated to internal growth and development. You can really build your career here!

Apply today and our Water Quality recruiter will be in touch with you if we see a potential match! We look forward to speaking with you.

When you join us, you’ll also be joining Danaher’s global organization, where 80,000 people wake up every day determined to help our customers win. As an associate, you’ll try new things, work hard, and advance your skills with guidance from dedicated leaders, all with the support of powerful Danaher Business System tools and the stability of a tested organization.

Title: Manager, Assay Development
Job_Description:
Find what drives you on a team with a more than 70-year history of discovery, determination, and innovation. As a global leader in high-tech filtration, separation, and purification, Pall Corporation thrives on helping our customers protect people. Our products serve a wide range of markets, so if your interests lie along the spectrum of Life Sciences to Industrial, you’ll find a rewarding role here. For the exponentially curious, Pall is a place you can thrive and amplify your impact on the world.
Pall is proud to work alongside a community of nine fellow Danaher Life Sciences companies. Together, we’re pioneering the future of science and medicine, developing products that enable researchers in the fight to save lives.
Position Summary:
Pall Industrial is seeking a highly motivated R&D leader for the position of Vice President of Membrane Research reporting directly to the Chief Technology Officer. The VP of Materials/Membrane Research will lead global teams engaged with research in materials to develop membranes and media that enables next generation filtration, separation, and purification applications for Pall Industrial business units – Aerospace, Microelectronics, Fluid Technologies and Asset Protection and Food & Beverage - with combined annual revenues >$1.5B.

Title: Manager, Assay Development
Job_Description:
Aldevron is an industry pioneer with a core competency in manufacturing for gene and cell therapy. We supply high-quality plasmid DNA, mRNA and proteins to our clients, who are breaking new ground on the world’s most important and challenging solutions to benefit us all. We're looking for innovative, forward-thinking individuals who share our goals of advancing science and making an impact on the world.

Aldevron is proud to work alongside a community of nine fellow Danaher Life Sciences companies. Together, we’re pioneering the future of science and medicine, developing products that enable researchers in the fight to save lives.

As part of the Quality team, the Data Analytics Scientist will be responsible for collecting, aggregating, analyzing, and reporting data and metrics that allow us to understand and measure the performance of each functional group within Aldevron. This individual will also help to develop and execute on different data strategy efforts that will allow us to set performance based KPIs and scorecards that will allow us to quantify and measure the effectiveness of our Quality Systems. This will include measuring and analyzing data sets from Quality Events / Deviations, Corrective and Preventative Actions (CAPAs), Change Controls, Batch Record Errors, and others to identify trends, remediate compliance gaps, and appropriately allocate resources to drive proactive countermeasures.

Responsibilities
Acts as central steward of all quality data, monitors risks through the holistic review of all data sets and aligning with cross functional operational and quality plans to drive comprehensive process enhancements.
Performs analytical reviews as defined in the scope of work and data acquisition plans and helps to identify root cause to systematically resolve complex process and systematic issues that are highlighted by the resulting analysis.
Perform metric collection and data analysis to support continuous process improvement
Provide strategic and risk-based leadership during Management Review activities ensuring compliance to procedures, specifications and Quality Agreements for products, processes, roles and responsibilities.
Develops and maintains project plans, specifications, and documentation related to Quality System metrics in line with SOP requirements
Participates in, and presents at internal, client, and regulatory (i.e., FDA and other Health Authority) sponsored meetings on behalf of the generated metrics, scorecards, or data science responsibilities.
Develop and implement KPIs to ensure compliance, effectiveness, timeliness, and escalations.



7+ years of experience in a data analytics capacity
Any experience in cell and therapy or biological manufacturing is a plus


Bachelor of Science, required; mathematics, statistics, engineering, life science, or related field, preferred or equivalent experience

Title: Manager, Assay Development
Job_Description:
Be part of something altogether life-changing!
Working at Cytiva in the Life Sciences industry means being at the forefront of providing new solutions to transform human health. Our incredible customers undertake life-saving activities ranging from fundamental biological research to developing innovative vaccines, new medicines, and cell and gene therapies.

At Cytiva you will be able to continuously improve yourself and us – working on challenges that truly matter with people that care for each other, our customers, and their patients. With associates across 40 countries, Cytiva is a place where every day is a learning opportunity – so you can grow your career and expand your skills in the long term. Your health and wellbeing are important to us and together we will not compromise on safety in the workplace or the environment.

Cytiva is proud to work alongside a community of nine fellow Danaher Life Sciences companies. Together, we’re pioneering the future of science and medicine, developing products that enable researchers in the fight to save lives.

What you’ll do
Project execution, as part of a diverse bioengineering team, for process and technology development programs within the Nucleic Acid Therapeutics field.
Responsible for definition of tasks, experimental planning and execution, data analysis, documentation, standard operating procedures (SOP) preparation, reporting and preparation of technical recommendations.
Collaborate with multiple sites and Danaher businesses aligned with the Nucleic Acid Therapeutics technical goals.
Demonstrate continuous integrity, credibility and positivity, and motivate others to do the same.
Continuously grow and adapt in a fast-moving field to keep yourself and the organization at the forefront of the Nucleic Acid Therapeutics field.

Who you are
Bachelors or Masters with 8-10 years’ experience, or PhD with 2-4 years’ experience in bioprocess engineering, chemical engineering, biotechnology, or a related field. Exceptional knowledge of mRNA, nucleic acids and associated biology/biochemistry principles strongly preferred.
Industry experience in process development and/or engineering is preferred. Expertise required in one or more of the following areas: bioprocess development, in vitro transcription, oligonucleotide delivery, lipid nanoparticle technologies, and/or downstream purification of nucleic acids.
Experience with characterization and analytics specific to nucleic acids is a valuable asset.
Personnel supervisory / team leadership experience and project management experience is a plus.
Independent, detailed-oriented, self-starter with excellent analytical skills with the ability to multi-task and succeed in a team environment.
Strong written and verbal English communications skills with solid knowledge of MS Office and comfort with learning new software applications especially those for DoE and statistical analysis.
