Title: Manager, Assay Development
Job_Description:
Wondering what’s within Beckman Coulter Diagnostics? Take a closer look.

At first glance, you’ll see that for more than 80 years we’ve been dedicated to advancing and optimizing the laboratory to move science and healthcare forward. Join a team where you can be heard, be supported, and always be yourself. We’re building a culture that celebrates backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives of all our associates. Look again and you’ll see we are invested in you, providing the opportunity to build a meaningful career, be creative, and try new things with the support you need to be successful.

Beckman Coulter Diagnostics is proud to work alongside a community of six fellow Diagnostics Companies at Danaher. Together, we’re working at the pace of change to improve patient lives with diagnostic tools that address the world’s biggest health challenges.

The Staff Systems Integration Engineer will work as part of new product development for next generation Microbiology diagnostic instruments with a focus on executing characterization, verification and validation tasks. This position is based in Sacramento, CA and will be hybrid (mix of remote and on-site) work depending upon business needs. This is an exciting and challenging opportunity to be a part of a rapidly growing industry working on the cutting edge of medical diagnostic technologies in a research and development environment. You’ll have the opportunity to work directly with scientists and engineers to ensure we have the right solutions to meet the needs of a constantly evolving healthcare environment. If you thrive in a high-functioning matrixed environment and want to work to build a world-class R&D organization—read on.


Hands-on design and execution of complex test methods (including design and implementation of test fixtures) to assess hardware, software, and system performance per Design Input Requirements, in compliance with Quality and Regulatory requirements.
Work independently in a cross-disciplinary environment to plan and execute experiments, defining and using specialized test equipment, and perform experimental data analysis.
Analyze complex data via statistical methods and provide written and oral reports and updates to senior and executive management.
Write and execute systems verification protocols
Work with cross-functional team to quickly investigate and identify countermeasures for new product issues on new product development and legacy products
Conducts root cause investigations and Failure analyses to solve reliability and performance issues on legacy products
Analyze data to assess system performance
Drive continuous improvement projects
Plan projects, step action plans and manage/prioritize multiple tasks


Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, or a related technical discipline with 9+ years of experience as a hands-on systems or systems-integration engineer OR Master’s degree with 7+ years of experience of systems experience.
Experience developing complex instrumentation systems which incorporate LAN/Cloud-based computing, optical, mechanical, environmental, algorithm, firmware components with inter-system measures and measurement systems.
Experience with and ability to detail work per ISO9000/FDA regulation.
Excellent collaboration and communication skills to enable c oordinating and aligning system-level integration efforts between workstreams, throughout characterization and qualification; Includes aspects of:
System modeling, apportionment, and measurement system analysis of essential performance requirements between sub-systems.
System risk management and alignment of risk mitigations across the subsystems and requirements.
System reliability modeling and monitoring; Proposes Continuous improvement of the high-impact issues.
Human Factors and Usability to minimize system workflow errors, effort, and operator strain.
Statistics experience, including proficiency in Design of Experiments and the use of Excel or other tools such as JMP, Origin, Matlab, R, Python, Mathematica, or Minitab, etc.) for data analysis and interpretation.

At Beckman Coulter Diagnostics we believe in designing a better, more sustainable workforce. We recognize the benefits of flexible, hybrid working arrangements for eligible roles and are committed to providing enriching careers, no matter the work arrangement. This position is eligible for a hybrid work arrangement in which you can work part-time at the Company location identified above and part-time remotely from your home. Additional information about this hybrid work arrangement will be provided by your interview team. Explore the flexibility and challenge that working for Beckman Coulter Diagnostics can provide.

Title: Manager, Assay Development
Job_Description:
Leica Microsystems has helped shape the future of microscopy for over 170 years by developing groundbreaking optical and digital solutions. As a global leader, we’re driven by continuous improvement to excite our customers and to create the best work environment for our people. Customer focus, innovation, and teamwork are at the core of our culture and the foundation of our success.

Want to be part of a company whose products are part of cutting-edge research around the world? Join Leica Microsystems in our commitment for brilliant solutions and insight.

ADVANCED WWORKFLOW SPECIALIST NANO-CRYO-EM

Come join a fantastic team! The Advanced Workflow Specialist Nano-Cryo-EM will provide technical pre- and post-sales support for all Electron Microscopy Sample Preparation products. Pre- and post-sales support will be provided to Leica’s EM Sample Preparation Sales Specialists and Dealer Partners. The Field Applications Scientist will perform product trainings, demonstrations, and troubleshooting sessions with end customers and sales reps. Handles scheduling and logistics of customer trainings and confirms correct system functionality. Performs successful product demonstrations to drive advanced sample preparation system sales.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES

Sell the value of Leica’s EM Sample Preparation products by providing expert product and application support to customers

Conduct product trainings

Perform successful product demonstrations to drive sales results

Test and confirm demo system functionality

Provide technical troubleshooting for existing customers

Develop protocols to prepare customer samples

Participate and teach in customer workshops

Organize and run product seminars

Work with customers or other experts to generate data and application notes, which highlight product benefits and help differentiate Leica products

Assist in meeting sales goals for each of the Nanotechnology sales reps in their assigned territory and provide positive motivation and support to help sales reps meet their goals.

Must be based near a major U.S. airport; East coast preferred, but flexible.

50-80%+ time spent in front of customers

50%+ overnight travel

YOUR EXPERIENCE

B.S. in a science or engineering field is required, M.S. or PhD in science or engineering field is preferred

Experience in working with Electron Microscopy, Sample Preparation equipment – required

Experience with maintaining and troubleshooting advanced research equipment - desirable

Experience selling and supporting capital equipment and products of a technical nature - desirable

In-depth knowledge of the Electron Microscopy market – desirable

Experience in a customer-facing support role - desirable

Competitive Salary as well as relocation packages

Continuous training, support and focus on your personal development

Title: Manager, Assay Development
Job_Description:
Beckman Coulter Life Sciences’ mission is to empower those seeking answers to life’s most important scientific and healthcare questions. With a legacy spanning 80+ years, we have long been a trusted partner to our customers, who are working to transform science and healthcare with the next groundbreaking discovery. As part of our team of more than 2,900 associates across 130 countries, you’ll help drive our vision of accelerating answers—and our commitment to excellence.

Beckman Coulter Life Sciences is proud to work alongside a community of nine fellow Danaher Life Sciences companies. Together, we’re pioneering the future of science and medicine, developing products that enable researchers in the fight to save lives.

Beckman Coulter Life Sciences is looking for an energetic and personable individual with flow cytometry experience to join our North American Applications Support team.

In this role you will support BECLS Cell Health technology customers, promote sales, and drive market development using your application expertise to perform field demonstrations, conduct seminars, and deliver conference presentations. You will act as a technical lead in a collaborative effort with our sales team and channel partners, driving market development, and acting as the voice of the customer in feeding customer needs into our research and development program.

You are passionate about science and helping scientists around the world accelerate the development of life-saving medicines. We are looking for an enthusiastic, inspired, skilled individual to join our multi-disciplinary team.


Works directly with the commercial team, reporting to the commercial director, as a technical lead for BECLS Cell Health customers.
Assist customers in efficiently onboarding BECLS Cell Health technology.
Provide technical support for end users via remote or onsite troubleshooting.
Travel to key global customers and prospects to provide technical consultation, create new demand, assist with sales, increase customer utilization, expand customer networks and increase awareness.
Interact with distributors to plan and perform product demonstrations, training and presentations at distributor sites or remotely.
Interact with marketing as the main technical lead for marketing activities. Assist in the creation of marketing, scientific and product-relevant material for prospective and existing customers.
Feedback information from demonstrations to commercial and R&D for further product improvements.
Feedback to commercial & R&D on competitor activities.
Promote solutions through participation in technical conferences, trade shows, publications, seminars, and symposiums.
Keep up to date with the scientific community and track major technical/application trends to support improvements in product positioning, selling strategies, and product/workflow development.
Report field activities and trends back through written reports and regular meetings.
Present at internal company meetings and to partners as required.


BSc [MSc and PhD are advantageous] in Biotechnology/Analytical instrumentation or related discipline.
At least 3-year hands-on customer facing experience in sales or field applications.
Knowledge and/or experience in the development and manufacture of biological drug candidates.
Experience optimizing and troubleshooting plate readers measuring plate-based fluorescence intensity and fluorescence polarization from multi well plates is desirable.
Hands-on experience with cell based and protein analytical technologies & assay development (e.g. cell viability, protein titer, protein aggregaton etc.) is desirable.
Strong skill set in relationship building.
Willingness to travel to customers, distributors & conferences, 50-60% of the time, depending on the requirements. Other travel may be required on an ad hoc basis.
Strong excel, data analysis & analytical skills and statistics knowledge is essential.
Flexible, able to prioritize, multi-task, and work in a fast-paced & demanding environment.
Able to take ownership of a given assignment, proactively consulting other team members and other department representatives for information or guidance, as necessary.
Enthusiasm and interest in focused personal, team and company goals.


Organized, self-motivated, with keen attention to detail.
Excellent communicator with written and verbal communication skills.
Engaging and comfortable interacting with customers and co-workers.
Self-confident and able to remain calm under pressure.
Team player able to work autonomously in the field.
Flexible both in job role and problem solving.
High level of intensity, tenacity, and results-driven self-motivation.

Title: Manager, Assay Development
Job_Description:
Find what drives you on a team with a more than 70-year history of discovery, determination, and innovation. As a global leader in high-tech filtration, separation, and purification, Pall Corporation thrives on helping our customers protect people. Our products serve a wide range of markets, so if your interests lie along the spectrum of Life Sciences to Industrial, you’ll find a rewarding role here. For the exponentially curious, Pall is a place you can thrive and amplify your impact on the world.

Pall is proud to work alongside a community of nine fellow Danaher Life Sciences companies. Together, we’re pioneering the future of science and medicine, developing products that enable researchers in the fight to save lives.

Pall Corporation is seeking a creative and results-oriented chemist as a Principal Scientist with a passion for photolithography, polymer chemistry and membrane science to join our R&D team in Port Washington, NY! This is an excellent career opportunity to take an active role in discovering and developing next-generation porous filters tailored for semiconductor fabrication processes and contributing to our fast-growing microelectronics business segment.


Conducts Research and engages in New Product Development (NPD) of advanced filtration projects independent of direct supervision. Provides R&D leadership within the group and cross-functionally as needed to drive innovation. Supports NPD roadmap using application knowledge from Semiconductor OEMs. Role is a member of our growing R&D team at the Filter Development Center of Excellence for Microelectronics. Goal is to develop state-of-the-art filtration, purification and separation products and processes for innovative semiconductor markets in photolithography applications.

Engage in product and process development for filter products targeting semiconductor photolithography applications including: chemically amplified, EUV, and MOF resists.

Engage and collaborate with key leaders across our organization to establish and drive a path for defect control solutions for ground breaking lithography applications.

Strengthen and be a factor in Pall Microelectronics IP with innovation and findings to enable next generation chip manufacturing technologies.

Maintains collaborations with other research and academic entities that enable breakthrough innovation.

Utilizes sound fundamentals like Design of Experiments (DOE).

Communicates clearly to leadership, team members, and other key partners.

Works with global R&D and engineering teams by sharing resources and overcoming cultural and language barriers.

Requires 10% travel both nationally and internationally. Qualifications - Required

Chemistry focused BS in Science or Engineering (MS or PhD highly preferred) with at least 8 years of R&D or product development experience is required. Qualifications - Highly Preferred

Knowledge of progressive semiconductor wafer fabrication processes related to photolithography.

Demonstrated expertise in polymer chemistry with preference on post-functionalization experience. Expertise in photochemistry.

Good understanding of in-line yield and wafer inspection metrology.

Knowledge of Filter Design, Fluid dynamics, Chemical and Hydromechanics, advanced membrane technology and exposure to surface modification of inorganic or organic substrates.

Familiarity with a range of analytical techniques to analyze and quantify very small quantities of organic and inorganic chemical impurities related to on-wafer defects.

Experience with process optimization using DOE and process scale-up. Competencies:

ability to influence decision-making with or without authority, facilitate groups with different perspectives and bring teams to agreement. High tolerance for ambiguity.

Interpersonal skills that build positive relationships and influence others, both within the business and across organizations. Ability to interact with all levels of the business (senior leaders to working teams), strong listening skills, able to present complex or new insights with clarity and simplicity.

collaborate effectively in the spirit of common objectives.

Able to identify problems; apply structured and focused methodology to identify root cause using data. Innovative and effective solution development, risk mitigation and execution.

Title: Manager, Assay Development
Job_Description:
About Sea-Bird Scientific

A wholly owned subsidiary of Danaher Corporation (NYSE: DHR), Sea-Bird Scientific ( www.seabird.com ) is headquartered in Bellevue, Washington. Sea-Bird Scientific is the world’s largest developer and manufacturer of products for the measurement of salinity, temperature, pressure, dissolved oxygen, fluorescence, nutrients and related oceanographic parameters in marine waters. We offer products to support best-in-class oceanography and climate science. We offer an entrepreneurial environment that is team-centered, customer-driven, quality-focused, and growth-oriented.

Working at Sea-Bird Scientific gives you access to a robust career development process and challenging stretch opportunities. Sea-Bird Scientific is proud to be one of Danaher's Water Quality companies . Through strong customer partnerships, the water platform advances the quality and delivery of water. Want to help us in this mission?


Are you passionate about Electrical Engineering? Do you want to make an impact on our environment? We are seeking an Electrical Engineer to join our collaborative team to help troubleshoot, design and test devices.

Production Engineering provide support for several different devices that test the salt waters of the world, do ocean monitoring, and have light sensing devices that read the optical properties for the scientists that study the waters. You will have the opportunity to support the Production Lines and be a part of the design, test and maintenance of instrumentation and supporting fixturing!


Lead design and commission of test fixtures
Product maintenance and sustainment (firmware bug fixes, hardware improvements)
Data driven problem solving (coordination with R&D/Science)
Participates in risk assessment activities.
Has facility in electronic design including schematic drawing, circuit simulation, printed circuit board layout and firmware coding.
Participate in Kaizens and Problem Solving Process
Drawing creation, Fixturing, and general operation readiness
Coordinate with Materials and Compliance Teams to facilitate product POC conversion


BS in Electrical Engineering or relevant field
Experience testing electrical circuit boards
Experience programming, testing and debugging embedded systems such as MSP430.
Database interaction experience including SQL, preferred.


MS in Electrical Engineering degree
1-2 years related experience in lean manufacturing or engineering environment
Experience with source control practices. Subversion preferred.
Experience with communication protocols including RS-232, RS-485 and USB, preferred.

Title: Manager, Assay Development
Job_Description:
DNA Script
DNA Script is a leading company in manufacturing de novo synthetic nucleic acids using enzymatic DNA synthesis (EDS) technology. The company aims at accelerating innovation in life science and technology through the decentralization of rapid, on demand and high-quality DNA synthesis. DNA Script's approach leverages nature's billions of years of evolution in synthesizing DNA to set a new standard for customizing nucleic acid synthesis thus accelerating discovery in genetics, genomics, and synthetic biology. Discovery disciplines with profound impacts upon humanity such as biopharma, translational genetics and even molecular information storage all start with synthetic DNA. The company has recently initiated the commercialization of its first EDS powered platform, the SYNTAX system.
To date, DNA Script has raised over $315M of financing, with leading investors such as Coatue Management, Fidelity Management and Research, Catalio Capital Management, Casdin Capital, LSP, Bpifrance Large Ventures, Danaher, Illumina Ventures, Agilent, Merck Ventures, Sofinnova Partners, Kurma Partners, T Rowe Price, Baillie Gifford and Eurazeo.

Title: Manager, Assay Development
Job_Description:
Do you want to help advance scientific discovery, improving quality of life around the world? We do, too.
Molecular Devices has the opportunity to be the innovation partner that empowers scientists to fast-track research breakthroughs, leading to earlier diagnoses and safer drug treatments.

We’re a dynamic, female-led life science solutions provider of high-performance bioanalytical measurement systems, software, and consumables. With Molecular Devices, you’ll grow your career with best-in-class teams in a culture of collaboration engagement, diversity, and inclusion.

Molecular Devices is proud to work alongside a community of nine fellow Danaher Life Sciences companies. Together, we’re pioneering the future of science and medicine, developing products that enable researchers in the fight to save lives. Job Description

Do you love technical problem solving? The Technical Support Applications Scientist will utilize their expertise performing technical problem solving on scientific instrument hardware, software, as well as cell-based applications. You must exhibit a passion for customer support on the array of industry leading Molecular Devices microplate readers.

The role is responsible for daily interactions with our external and internal customers, primarily by phone, e-mail, WebEx and Web chat. The job duties will involve updating and maintaining the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) database with a summary of the incident and actions taken. The expectation is that the Technical Support Application Scientist is fully integrated into a dynamic environment supporting existing and newly released products, working with a cross-functional team including Product Support Engineers, Field Applications Scientists, Sales Representatives, Marketing, Product Development, and Operations.


Provide daily scientific, technical, and applications support on an array of Molecular Devices microplate readers

Participate in trainings on both new and existing supported products

Perform technical problem solving on hardware, software, and cell-based assays, working with available company resources and escalating issues as needed

Communicate with our customers using phone, email, WebEx and Web chat

Update and maintain the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) database (SalesForce/ServiceMax) with relevant case information

Create and maintain Knowledge Base articles and Technical Notes

Perform revenue generating activities including sales lead generation

Participate in continuous improvement activities using Danaher Business System tools

Work with cross-functional teams to ensure supportability of new product releases


MS/Ph.D in Biochemistry, Cell Biology, Molecular Biology, Bioengineering or related field with 4+ years of laboratory experience

Thorough knowledge of cell-based assay techniques

Experience in analyzing complex data, troubleshooting hardware and software issues and be an independent problem solver

Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Track record for delivering results and takes ownership of actions

Embraces challenge with a passion for continuous improvement

Proficient at promoting products and services

Customer Service oriented, with a high sense of urgency


Customer support and/or teaching experience are a plus

Familiarity with modern methods of drug discovery, computer networking, and lab automation is a plus

Hands-on experience with Molecular Devices’ SpectraMax microplate readers (e.g. M Series, i3x, and iDx), associated reagents, and SoftMax Pro data acquisition and analysis software is highly desirable

Title: Manager, Assay Development
Job_Description:
Wondering what’s within Beckman Coulter Diagnostics? Take a closer look.

At first glance, you’ll see that for more than 80 years we’ve been dedicated to advancing and optimizing the laboratory to move science and healthcare forward. Join a team where you can be heard, be supported, and always be yourself. We’re building a culture that celebrates backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives of all our associates. Look again and you’ll see we are invested in you, providing the opportunity to build a meaningful career, be creative, and try new things with the support you need to be successful.

Beckman Coulter Diagnostics is proud to work alongside a community of six fellow Diagnostics Companies at Danaher. Together, we’re working at the pace of change to improve patient lives with diagnostic tools that address the world’s biggest health challenges.

The Senior Development Scientist for Beckman Coulter Diagnostics is responsible for hands-on participation in the design and development of new processes and products on our Research & Development team.

This position is part of the Lumigen subsidiary located in Southfield, MI and will be On-site . At Beckman Coulter, our vision is to relentlessly reimagine healthcare, one diagnosis at a time.

You will be a part of the Lumigen Research & Development team and report to the Sr Manager, Development Science responsible for managing the R&D function at Lumigen. If you thrive in a highly technical, multi-functional role and want to work to build a world-class R&D organization—read on.


Work as part of a diverse team of dedicated individuals
Work with cross-functional teams on highly complex problems
Participate in the design and development of innovative new processes and products
Execute and document laboratory experiments
Analyze and report experimental results to a multifunctional, multisite project team


Bachelor of Science degree in Organic Chemistry or related Chemistry field with 5+ years of relevant experience OR Master of Science degree in same fields with 3+ years of relevant experience OR Doctoral degree in same fields with 0+ years of relevant experience
Experience with general organic chemistry research techniques
Experience using MS Office software
Demonstrated problem-solving and data analysis skills


Experience with scientific instrumentations and statistical software
Knowledge of bioanalytical techniques and applications
Ability to work in a team-oriented environment that embraces agility and flexibility

Title: Manager, Assay Development
Job_Description:
Position Summary
Quality Control (QC) Scientist I, Protein, supports production of recombinant proteins at Aldevron’s Madison, WI facility. This role is primarily responsible for performing release testing and ensuring that products meet or exceed all quality specifications. Additionally, the QC Scientist I supports testing for stability studies. Duties may also include assisting in validation activities, technology transfer and other quality related functions as assigned. Previous experience in a Quality Control laboratory is preferred but not necessary as you will learn and support and be supported by a small group of high-performing scientists.

Essential Functions
Work as a team member in support of projects in-development and manufacture that typically involve a multidisciplinary approach that includes scientists from different departments
Assists in the management and implementation of Quality, ISO 13485 programs (knowledge of QC laboratory test procedures, cGMP requirements, ICH guidelines a plus)
Fulfill duties on schedule, per Standard Operating Procedures, with limited supervision
Provide technical assistance, train and support staff as needed
Upon unexpected results, the QC Scientist I is able to identify variables that may be contributing to varied results
Proactively investigate, troubleshoot and improve existing processes to maintain or improve quality scientific results and implement new technologies
Accurately record experimental results in real-time; store/save and report data per Aldevron conventions
Use, maintain, and train others on analytical equipment routinely used to characterize recombinant proteins, including:
Reverse Phase HPLC
Analytical Size Exclusion Chromatography
SDS-PAGE and Western Blot
UV/Vis and Fluorescence Spectroscopy (cuvette and multi-well plate)
ELISA
Endotoxin Detection Assays
Assist in qualification of test methods, writing and review of documents, internal process reviews, and basic equipment maintenance
Adhere to all Company environmental health and safety procedures
Perform other duties as assigned
All employees are responsible for the general upkeep of work and shared spaces
Punctual and regular attendance is required of all employees

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions of the position.

Supervisory Responsibility
NA

Travel
NA

Qualifications

Education & Experience
B.S. or A.S. in biology, molecular biology, biochemistry, chemistry or related field with 2 years of relevant work experience
Previous experience in a Quality Control laboratory is preferred

Skills & Knowledge
Excellent laboratory skills
Effective communication skills
Strong attention to detail
Problem solving and critical thinking skills
Strong computer skills (both Microsoft and Apple systems) and familiarity with the Microsoft Office suite
Have passion for “hands on” work in a laboratory setting and for continuous learning and improvement
Be flexible and willing to work in a fast-paced environment that at times requires shifting priorities

Abilities
Ability to learn new methods and systems
Ability to manage multiple priorities
Ability to maintain accurate documentation
Ability to productively work on multiple projects simultaneously
Ability to speak and write fluently in English


NA

Working Conditions
This position works in a Research Grade lab setting and may come in contact with various solutions and chemicals, and will be responsible for activities related to biological processes such as bacterial growth. This position uses standard laboratory equipment such as pipettes, centrifuges, glass ware, shake flasks, fermenters, fume hoods, and computers.


While performing the duties of this position, the employee is regularly required to see, talk and hear. The employee frequently is required to stand, walk, bend, lift up to 50 pounds, and use arms, hands and fingers for various activities. This position may stand or remain sedentary for long periods of time. This position routinely works with large pieces of equipment.

Job_Description:
IDT is the leading manufacturer of custom oligonucleotides and proprietary technologies for genomics applications. Our work is complex and cutting-edge, and our team members are curious, creative thinkers who understand that good data drives smart decisions. At IDT, we realize that although science may be uniform, people are unique. We promote a culture where engaged people are motivated and have opportunities to achieve their full potential, as part of one global team.

IDT is proud to work alongside a community of nine fellow Danaher Life Sciences companies. Together, we’re pioneering the future of science and medicine, developing products that enable researchers in the fight to save lives.

Job Title: Staff Scientist
Location: Redwood City, CA


The Staff Scientist is responsible for developing and characterizing IDT’s NGS sample preparation technologies to support customers looking for customizable NGS solutions. The scientist will apply their scientific knowledge at the bench to drive decision-making experiments within cross-functional groups and bring new products to market.

This position is part of the NGS Product Development Team at the NGS R&D site located in Redwood City, California. The Staff Scientist will move R&D strategy to action in multiple projects, following the Danaher Core Behaviors to Deliver Results and Win as a Team.


Provide leadership to a team of research scientists in the lab through direct and indirect management
Work closely with other functional groups in a global environment
Build the technical foundations of future NGS products in IDT’s portfolio
Develop and launch NGS products that help customers further their research


BS, MS, or PhD in Biological Sciences, Chemistry, or Physics with 10+, 8+, or 5+ years of relevant experience in an industry setting.


Independently exploring NGS assay applications and new product development
Providing the broad knowledge base across various Illumina NGS library preparation methods and hybridization capture target enrichment


NGS data analysis
Product development in industry setting
NGS applications in oncology research and/or experience with non-Illumina sequencing platforms

Job Title: Applications Specialist

Location: C oralville, IA *Mobile/Remote (On-Site/Work from Home Hybrid)
Day (Monday - Friday 9:00am - 6:00pm)


The Applications Specialist provides professional customer service and technical support to IDT customers regarding product recommendations and end-use.


Communicates with and supports customers to provide pre- and post-sales technical support for a growing product offering.

Troubleshoots product use and applications by using customer provided data and information, as well as IDT sales and manufacturing databases.

Answers all customer inquiries received by phone, email and live chat.

Title: Manager, Assay Development

In our line of work, life isn’t a given - it’s the ultimate goal. This is our shared purpose at Radiometer and what unites all +4000 of us - no matter our roles or where in the world we’re located. Radiometer is proud to work alongside a community of six fellow Diagnostics Companies at Danaher. Together, we’re working at the pace of change to improve patient lives with diagnostic tools that address the world’s biggest health challenges.

Are you a Sensor Scientist who would love to coordinate and evaluate electrochemical sensor research and development activities to provide new and or improved blood gas sensor products to support the business goals and objectives? Join our Sensor Development team of highly skilled scientists!

Key participant of the interdisciplinary R&D team to develop novel sensor and membrane designs to support product development and innovation efforts

Provide accurate design of experiments, interpretation and presentation of experimental data by creating clear and concise summary reports

Drive Problem Solving Processes related to sensor design

Title: Manager, Assay Development
Job_Description:
Aldevron is an industry pioneer with a core competency in manufacturing for gene and cell therapy. We supply high-quality plasmid DNA, mRNA and proteins to our clients, who are breaking new ground on the world’s most important and challenging solutions to benefit us all. We're looking for innovative, forward-thinking individuals who share our goals of advancing science and making an impact on the world.

Aldevron is proud to work alongside a community of nine fellow Danaher Life Sciences companies. Together, we’re pioneering the future of science and medicine, developing products that enable researchers in the fight to save lives.

This R&D Sr. Scienitist role is part of the R&D department located in Fargo, ND working on-site. At Aldevron, we combine best-in-class products and service with the ideal operating environment to lay the groundwork for vital new discoveries worldwide.

Our work at Hach ensures water quality for people around the world. Our customer partnerships, passionate experts, and reliable, easy-to-use solutions make water analysis better—faster, simpler, greener, and more informative. You’ll also be part of an environment that fosters career growth and professional development, with kindness at its core. And you’ll be part of our mission, which drives us to develop water quality solutions that protect the health and safety of all living things.

About the Role:
Do you want to be part of a fun-filled, high-energy team that bridges the gap between hardware and software to provide high value solutions to water quality customers?

Join us at Hach as we continue to revolutionize the water quality industry.


Love controlling machinery & electronics through embedded software/firmware
Love bringing electronics to Life
Love robotics
Are a professional or hobbyist/tinkerer with firmware/software skills associated with solution/system development
Have an endless curiosity on how things work

We work in a collaborative environment to drive growth and innovation within the firmware team. Our firmware engineers are highly innovative professionals focused on bringing our water quality products to life.


End-to-End Design and Development of embedded solutions
Collaboration in an Agile firmware development team using scrum processes
Drive firmware quality by using early defect discovery and removal
Analyze acceptance criteria and provide estimates of effort.
Troubleshooting and issue resolution of embedded firmware / embedded software solutions in a sustaining engineering environment


Large 3 building campus which includes a new building designed from the ground up for Research and Development
Work environment like a college senior design project on steroids – nearly everything is in house, and we work in close-knit collaborative teams comprised of nearly all engineering disciplines
Hach bucks the trend of most companies by keeping many things in house (10m EMC chamber, HALT chamber, PCA/SMT line, injection molding, fabrication, production/manufacturing, etc.)
Focused on water quality industry which continues to grow in importance worldwide
Diverse and Inclusive culture

Qualifications
Minimum of Bachelor’s degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related field
2 years of C++ user-space development experience
Experience developing single microprocessor/microcontroller instruments using Linux, RTOS, or bare metal.
Strong OO design principles using C++ to design highly reliable products.
Experience in Agile project management, continuous integration, and unit testing.
Proven proficiency of translating business requirements into data models.

Title: Bioinformatics Analyst II
Job_Description:
Qualitative UX Researcher

This position is located at our Loveland, Colorado location. It is a hybrid position where you can work part-time at the Company location identified above and part-time remotely from your home.

About Hach:
Our work at Hach ensures water quality for people around the world. Our customer partnerships, passionate experts, and reliable, easy-to-use solutions make water analysis better—faster, simpler, greener, and more informative. As a member of our team, you’ll get to make an immediate, measurable impact on a global scale, within industries from aviation to manufacturing to mining. You’ll also be part of an environment that fosters career growth and professional development, with kindness at its core. And you’ll be part of our mission, which drives us to develop water quality solutions that protect the health and safety of all living things.
Overview

Are you curious, empathetic, and interested in understanding how and why people use new devices and technologies? Are you good at talking to customers and helping get to the bottom of why they like or hate a product? Do you care and think critically about how human interaction matters in product design?

Hach values the user experience, and the UX Team is focused on building highly efficient, high-value experiences. We’re iterative in our research, our leadership takes time to help grow your UX career, and we attend regular training to increase our collective UX knowledge.

If this inspires you, then you should consider becoming our newest team member.
Responsibilities

We need an agile Qualitative User Experience Researcher who will move quickly to provide insight which inspires and helps us deliver amazing end-to-end products and experiences.

Our culture moves and iterates fast! Your creativity, dexterity, and ability to be an amazing partner across all disciplines of design, engineering, data science, market research, planning, and other project teams across Hach will enable your success.


Knows the strengths and weaknesses of different user research methods, and when to apply them
Exceptional behavioral data-collection and analysis skills, e.g., designing, conducting, and analyzing all kinds of user data.
Can objectively observe, interact with, and collect data from users, e.g. interviews, user testing, etc.
Able to distill research findings into actionable insights for product development
Comfortable with fast-paced work environment and responsibilities for multiple projects at any given time.
Excellent writing, communication, presentation, interpersonal, and analytical skills; the ability to communicate complex concepts clearly and persuasively across different audiences and varying levels of the organization.
Qualifications
2+ years’ experience as a researcher on an end-to-end product - creating research agendas and schedules, defining and tracking user experience goals and metrics, driving execution on projects, and managing the work of additional resources.
Hands-on experience with user testing, field research, survey design, online user research and experimentation tools, or usage data analysis.
Experience with a broad range of research methodologies (qualitative and quantitative techniques) and the right balance between the two.
The ability to work in front-end generative spaces as well as throughout product development that involves more iterative, rapid, and evaluative methods.
A BA/BS in a research related field with significant academic or industry experience are a huge plus!. A MA/MS or PhD in psychology, human factors, HCI, behavioral science or related field preferred.


Leadership skills to influence across and up the organization to bring customer empathy and understanding to the table.
Strong oral and written communication skills; experience presenting to executive-level audiences; proven track record of bringing clarity to messy data stories.
A true advocate for the design of inclusive and excellent user experiences for customers
Demonstrated ability to visualize and present rich research data simply and clearly.
A track record of moving beyond data by translating customer needs, behavior, and insights into user requirements, and work with engineers, program managers, and designers to develop specs that achieve an intuitive and usable experience for customers.
Strong aptitude for learning new technologies and demonstrated agility and flexibility in decision making and the way you work. You demonstrate an openness and growth mindset in all that you do
Comfortable working in ambiguous product areas, informing new opportunity spaces and high value customer experiences


Experience with Atlassian Suite

Title: Bioinformatics Analyst II
Job_Description:
DNA Script
DNA Script is a leading company in manufacturing de novo synthetic nucleic acids using enzymatic DNA synthesis (EDS) technology. The company aims at accelerating innovation in life science and technology through the decentralization of rapid, on demand and high-quality DNA synthesis. DNA Script's approach leverages nature's billions of years of evolution in synthesizing DNA to set a new standard for customizing nucleic acid synthesis thus accelerating discovery in genetics, genomics, and synthetic biology. Discovery disciplines with profound impacts upon humanity such as biopharma, translational genetics and even molecular information storage all start with synthetic DNA. The company has recently initiated the commercialization of its first EDS powered platform, the SYNTAX system.
To date, DNA Script has raised over $315M of financing, with leading investors such as Coatue Management, Fidelity Management and Research, Catalio Capital Management, Casdin Capital, LSP, Bpifrance Large Ventures, Danaher, Illumina Ventures, Agilent, Merck Ventures, Sofinnova Partners, Kurma Partners, T Rowe Price, Baillie Gifford and Eurazeo.

Job_Description:

Join a team where you can be heard, be supported, and always be yourself. Use proven HFE methodologies and tools, recommend changes to improve the overall usability, user interfaces, and ensure a safe and reliable user experience.
Travel - domestic & international (less than 25%).


Bachelors/Master’s Degree in Human Factors, Human Computer Interaction, User Experience Design or other related fields
8+ years relevant experience in user experience design roles
Proficiency with Adobe Creative Cloud or other web design tools
Experience and expertise in the software design process, interaction design, user research, and usability
Proficiency with Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio), and Wireframe design and statistical analysis tools.

Leadership Experience
Proactive communication

Experience with Agile Scrum based Software Development.

12+ years relevant experience in user/HFE experience design roles

Title: Bioinformatics Analyst II
Job_Description:
This position is located onsite at the company location in Bellevue, WA.

About Sea-Bird Scientific

A wholly owned subsidiary of Danaher Corporation (NYSE: DHR), Sea-Bird Scientific ( www.seabird.com ) is headquartered in Bellevue, Washington. Sea-Bird Scientific is the world’s largest developer and manufacturer of products for the measurement of salinity, temperature, pressure, dissolved oxygen, fluorescence, nutrients and related oceanographic parameters in marine waters. We offer products to support best-in-class oceanography and climate science. We offer an entrepreneurial environment that is team-centered, customer-driven, quality-focused, and growth-oriented.

Working at Sea-Bird Scientific gives you access to a robust career development process and challenging stretch opportunities. Sea-Bird Scientific is proud to be one of Danaher's Water Quality companies . Through strong customer partnerships, the water platform advances the quality and delivery of water. Want to help us in this mission?


This is an exciting opportunity to make a significant impact in improving and sustaining our oceanographic instruments that are vital to improving our understanding of the oceans and our climate! You will optimize the design, manufacturability, and testing processes for Sea-Bird Scientific’s products. These complex products are designed to be deployed in the ocean for a variety of uses and withstand harsh environments while maintaining accuracy in data collection to support oceanographic research and the scientific community.

We are looking for a smart, innovative, and high-energy mechanical engineer who is driven to continuously improve our ability to deliver market leading technology with a focus on quality, reliability, and performance.


Improve DFM in all points of production
Develop innovative solutions to existing design constraints through redesign efforts to capture VAVE/Scrap savings
Collect appropriate data to define, identify, analyze, and improve manufacturing throughput and product quality.
Support Manufacturing in optimizing the design of fixture/tools for the ease of manufacturing and cost optimization
Supports Engineering team to sustain existing products per program and resource needs.
Performs troubleshooting, diagnoses and resolves problems to component, module level, or system level.
Develop test plans and conduct in-house and field testing that cover the expected customer use environment and operation conditions.
Analyze and develop system and sub-system requirements and relationships with component specifications
Interact with machine shops and vendors throughout the design cycle for optimizing the design from manufacturability and cost stand points
Generation of Engineering Change Orders (change to the existing designs or introducing new designs plus V&V and release).
Generation of Verification and Validation test protocols (Software, Hardware and System) and the execution of the test cases.

Qualifications
Degree in Mechanical, Manufacturing, or Systems Engineering - (BS + 2 yrs exp, MS + 1 yrs exp).
1+ years’ experience in mechanical engineering or related manufacturing engineering field
Hands on experience with either Mechanical or Electrical testing
SolidWorks experience, modeling and GD&T (other computer-added design software tools)
Understanding of fabrication methods and design constraints
Proficient with Microsoft Office applications (mainly Word, Excel)


Electrical-mechanical, process improvement, machining, or DFM background
Some software/programming experience is a plus (C, C++, python, Matlab)

Bachelor’s degree with 9+ years related work experience OR Master’s degree with 7+ years related work experience OR Doctoral degree with 4+ years related work experience. Degree in Systems Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering or similar engineering field preferred.

Excellent troubleshooting and problem-solving skills

Title: Bioinformatics Analyst II
Job_Description:
We are seeking an Electrical Engineer who is passionate about designing, motion systems and supporting all aspects of the Dover Motion SmartStage™ controls ecosystem. This individual will be responsible for the design and development of custom motion solutions for major customers in the US, Europe and Asia. The ideal candidates possess a solid aptitude or background in designing digital and analog electronic control systems. The candidate will be required to generate sound technical concepts, innovative and qualify new designs in a dynamic project development environment. Beyond the design, the candidate will be responsible for troubleshooting, measuring, tuning and analyzing system performance data. You will excel at this role if you love to be a key member of a fast-paced team. You will work in both Team and individual settings.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Gather and analyze requirements, generate specifications, design architectures, and outline system interfaces through direct customer and Dover Motion team communications to generate concept and cost models and assist with proposals

Define, architect, and lead the implementation of projects related to the precision motion systems, in addition to maintaining traceability matrices across requirements, design, and testing through the Project Development Process

Create and manage project documentation (Altium, AutoCAD or schematic tool). Including: electrical schematics, interconnect drawings, component selection, software development, Bill of Materials (BOM), processing engineering change requests and orders (ECR/ECO), installation and operating instructions

Lead engineering development activities through the established Project Development Process using best engineering practices such as DFMEA

Develop and document analytical models of system behavior and interactions, and define a clear path towards effective utilization of modeling and simulation techniques

Select and size motion control components (motors, drives, controls) for the design

Ensure compliance of the new systems with design controls and all regulatory requirements such as CE, UL, RoHS, REACH, etc.

Assemble and Test rapid prototype new concepts and machines to mitigate technical risks on new development concepts

Use multiple controller and drive products from internal and external suppliers such as Kollmorgen, Elmo, Galil and PMD to setup and run tests


Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical or Control Systems Engineering is required (Master’s Preferred)

0 to 5 years of experience in coordinating and managing the design phases of technical engineering projects in the design of motion engineering projects

Prior experience in using CAD software (AutoCAD, Altium) to generate various levels of electrical documentation


Theoretical and practical understanding of basic analog and digital servo control theory

Experience with Motion Controls, Drives, Encoders, Power Supplies

Ability to perform engineering mathematical analysis (MathCAD or MatLab)

Driver development

Fortive is a diversified industrial growth company comprised of global businesses that are recognized leaders in attractive markets. With more than $6 billion in annual revenues, Fortive’s well-known brands hold leading positions in field instrumentation, transportation, sensing, product realization, automation and specialty, and franchise distribution.
Fortive is headquartered in Everett, Washington and employs a team of more than 24,000 research and development, manufacturing, sales, distribution, service and administrative employees in more than 40 countries around the world. Title: Bioinformatics Analyst II
Job_Description:
Wondering what’s within the Diagnostics Platform and Danaher?
Take a closer look.

The family of Diagnostics companies at Danaher work with conviction that every moment matters and realize that behind every test is a patient, waiting for an answer that could change their life. Our 23,000 team members, across 6 operating companies globally, proudly push the boundaries of what’s possible in safeguarding patient health and improving diagnostic confidence. We develop tools and technologies that set the standard for innovation and impact wherever health care happens—from a family physician’s office to leading trauma hospitals and laboratories. Our teams collaborate in an inclusive environment as we connect our people, processes, and expertise, focused on the world’s biggest health challenges such as cardiac disease, infectious disease, and cancer. At the Diagnostics platform at Danaher, you’ll thrive and quickly see the impact of your contribution.

Join us in working at the pace of change to improve patient lives!

The S enior Software Engineer will play a vital role in supporting the Sr. Manager, Data & Analytics, to develop the tools & capabilities of the Danaher Diagnostics Data Platform (D3P). This position is part of the Clinical Insights Team at Danaher Diagnostics and will be fully remote.


Collaborate with stakeholders to understand data requirements for Data Engineering , Analytics, and Data Science projects.

Assemble large, complex data sets from disparate sources, writing code, scripts, and queries, as appropriate to efficiently extract, QC, clean, harmonize and visualize Big D ata sets.

Develop software tools for data engineering tasks following industry standard practices such as agile, test-driven development, and CI/CD and deliver them to internal customers .

Identify, design, and implement continuous process improvements such as automating manual processes and optimizing data delivery.

Document data processes, write data management recommended procedures, and create training materials relating to data management best practices.


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science OR equivalent experience

9 years of experience

Expertise in Python with strong knowledge of Python best practices, particularly as they apply to the area of data & analytics, and experience using standard data science tool s (e .g., Pandas , numpy , Jupyter ).

Advanced SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.

Experience with distributed systems and IP-based networking

Experience with modern software engineering practices that include code reviews and pull requests, test-driven development, and CI/CD.


Experience in p erforming data engineering tasks on RWD/RWE projects involving Electronic Medical Records (EMR) data .

Experience in developing software solutions on public cloud infrastructures, particularly Amazon AWS and Microsoft Azure .

Knowledge of security and privacy requirements and certifications, including HIPAA, GDPR, ISO9001, ISO27001 .

Experience with a variety of standard Python data visualization methods .

Knowledge of cluster computing and large-scale data analytics platforms such as Apache Spark , Dask , and Ray .

Title: Bioinformatics Analyst II
Job_Description:
Wondering what’s within Beckman Coulter Diagnostics? Take a closer look.

At first glance, you’ll see that for more than 80 years we’ve been dedicated to advancing and optimizing the laboratory to move science and healthcare forward. Join a team where you can be heard, be supported, and always be yourself. We’re building a culture that celebrates backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives of all our associates. Look again and you’ll see we are invested in you, providing the opportunity to build a meaningful career, be creative, and try new things with the support you need to be successful.

Beckman Coulter Diagnostics is proud to work alongside a community of six fellow Diagnostics Companies at Danaher. Together, we’re working at the pace of change to improve patient lives with diagnostic tools that address the world’s biggest health challenges.

The Senior An alyst Technical Customer Support for Beckman Coulter Diagnostics is responsible for collaborating with Global Service, leading product support for Diagnostics systems by providing escalation management, developing, and executing support strategies, and training field specialists and instructors in support of new product launches.

This position is part of Global Service located in Brea, CA and will be Hybrid (Brea, CA local) or Remote (US based). At Beckman Coulter, our vision is to relentlessly reimagine healthcare, one diagnosis at a time.

You will be a part of the Global Technical Support team and report to the Sr Manager, Global Technical Support responsible for leading a team of 7+ support engineers. If you thrive in a multifunctional, customer-supporting role and want to work to build a world-class medical device organization—read on!


Expert level knowledge of clinical informatics, Diagnostic Middleware systems from hardware and software perspective and acquire applications knowledge to aid in problem diagnosis
Expert knowledge of support tools and data analysis including software, RMS, OBIEE and others
Support product development by leading efforts to acquire technical information regarding product performance, competitive features and clinical/research requirements, to ensure Technical Support deliverables are met

This position is based in Sacramento, CA and will be hybrid (mix of remote and on-site) work depending upon business needs. This is an exciting and challenging opportunity to be a part of a rapidly growing industry working on the cutting edge of medical diagnostic technologies in a research and development environment. You’ll have the opportunity to work directly with scientists and engineers to ensure we have the right solutions to meet the needs of a constantly evolving healthcare environment. If you thrive in a high-functioning matrixed environment and want to work to build a world-class R&D organization—read on.


Hands-on design and execution of complex test methods (including design and implementation of test fixtures) to assess hardware, software, and system performance per Design Input Requirements, in compliance with Quality and Regulatory requirements.
Work independently in a cross-disciplinary environment to plan and execute experiments, defining and using specialized test equipment, and perform experimental data analysis.
Analyze complex data via statistical methods and provide written and oral reports and updates to senior and executive management.
Write and execute systems verification protocols
Work with cross-functional team to quickly investigate and identify countermeasures for new product issues on new product development and legacy products
Conducts root cause investigations and Failure analyses to solve reliability and performance issues on legacy products
Analyze data to assess system performance
Drive continuous improvement projects
Plan projects, step action plans and manage/prioritize multiple tasks


Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, or a related technical discipline with 9+ years of experience as a hands-on systems or systems-integration engineer OR Master’s degree with 7+ years of experience of systems experience.
Experience developing complex instrumentation systems which incorporate LAN/Cloud-based computing, optical, mechanical, environmental, algorithm, firmware components with inter-system measures and measurement systems.
Experience with and ability to detail work per ISO9000/FDA regulation.
Excellent collaboration and communication skills to enable c oordinating and aligning system-level integration efforts between workstreams, throughout characterization and qualification; Includes aspects of:
System modeling, apportionment, and measurement system analysis of essential performance requirements between sub-systems.
System risk management and alignment of risk mitigations across the subsystems and requirements.
System reliability modeling and monitoring; Proposes Continuous improvement of the high-impact issues.
Human Factors and Usability to minimize system workflow errors, effort, and operator strain.
Statistics experience, including proficiency in Design of Experiments and the use of Excel or other tools such as JMP, Origin, Matlab, R, Python, Mathematica, or Minitab, etc.) for data analysis and interpretation.

Title: Bioinformatics Analyst II
Job_Description:
Be part of something altogether life-changing!
Working at Cytiva in the Life Sciences industry means being at the forefront of providing new solutions to transform human health. Our incredible customers undertake life-saving activities ranging from fundamental biological research to developing innovative vaccines, new medicines, and cell and gene therapies.

At Cytiva you will be able to continuously improve yourself and us – working on challenges that truly matter with people that care for each other, our customers, and their patients. With associates across 40 countries, Cytiva is a place where every day is a learning opportunity – so you can grow your career and expand your skills in the long term. Your health and wellbeing are important to us and together we will not compromise on safety in the workplace or the environment.

Cytiva is proud to work alongside a community of nine fellow Danaher Life Sciences companies. Together, we’re pioneering the future of science and medicine, developing products that enable researchers in the fight to save lives.

What you’ll do
Project execution, as part of a diverse bioengineering team, for process and technology development programs within the Nucleic Acid Therapeutics field.
Responsible for definition of tasks, experimental planning and execution, data analysis, documentation, standard operating procedures (SOP) preparation, reporting and preparation of technical recommendations.
Collaborate with multiple sites and Danaher businesses aligned with the Nucleic Acid Therapeutics technical goals.
Demonstrate continuous integrity, credibility and positivity, and motivate others to do the same.
Continuously grow and adapt in a fast-moving field to keep yourself and the organization at the forefront of the Nucleic Acid Therapeutics field.

Who you are
Bachelors or Masters with 8-10 years’ experience, or PhD with 2-4 years’ experience in bioprocess engineering, chemical engineering, biotechnology, or a related field. Exceptional knowledge of mRNA, nucleic acids and associated biology/biochemistry principles strongly preferred.
Industry experience in process development and/or engineering is preferred. Expertise required in one or more of the following areas: bioprocess development, in vitro transcription, oligonucleotide delivery, lipid nanoparticle technologies, and/or downstream purification of nucleic acids.
Experience with characterization and analytics specific to nucleic acids is a valuable asset.
Personnel supervisory / team leadership experience and project management experience is a plus.
Independent, detailed-oriented, self-starter with excellent analytical skills with the ability to multi-task and succeed in a team environment.
Strong written and verbal English communications skills with solid knowledge of MS Office and comfort with learning new software applications especially those for DoE and statistical analysis.

The Manufacturing Engineer is a critical member of the process scale-up/technology transfer team which drives the seamless transfer of product and process knowledge between development and manufacturing operations, and within or between manufacturing sites to commercialize additive products. They will ensure that the variability of process and machine parameters are controlled and sufficient to be ready for the rigors of a commercial production environment. They will support additive manufacturing process optimization, facilitate machine qualification to Pall specifications, develop process documentation, resolve complex technical problems related to machine characterization, and propose projects to improve additive machines and processes to enable Pall Industrial deliver novel solutions to customers’ needs.

Essential Job Functions

Support the selection and installation of capital equipment needed for the scale-up of AM operations.

Serve as a technical resource in AM equipment hardware and software, and on-going changes.

Conduct data driven analysis to manufacturing issues with tools such as DMAIC, Root Cause analysis, SPC, FMEA, Measurement System Analysis, Capability Analysis, Fish-Bone diagrams, 5 Whys, etc.

Create and develop manufacturing and process control documents.

Design processes to ensure that the production parts supplied out of AM operations meet all internal and external customer quality specifications (e.g., ISO 9001:2015, AS9100, and Nadcap etc.)

Conduct periodic process audits, identify opportunities for continuous improvement, and drive implementation of the improvements

Lead process scale up initiatives and interface across various geographic locations

Education and Experience

Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering from an accredited college/university – preferably in Mechanical, Metallurgical, or Industrial Engineering plus 3+ years of experience in a manufacturing environment as a Quality Engineer or Manufacturing Engineer.

1+ year experience with additive manufacturing.

Working knowledge of post processing (e.g., powder removal, surface treatment, joining and finish machining) of 3D printed metal parts

Experience with CAD/CAM software packages, generating technical drawings; proficient in GD&T.

Experience with developing written shop processes, work instructions and/ or procedures.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience with structured problem-solving skills including demonstrated use of DMAIC, Root Cause analysis, SPC, FMEA, Fish-Bone diagrams, 5 Whys, etc.

Awareness of Lean/Six Sigma methodology and tools

Knowledge of additive part and machine qualification.

Job_Description:
About Sea-Bird Scientific

A wholly owned subsidiary of Danaher Corporation (NYSE: DHR), Sea-Bird Scientific ( www.seabird.com ) is headquartered in Bellevue, Washington. Sea-Bird Scientific is the world’s largest developer and manufacturer of products for the measurement of salinity, temperature, pressure, dissolved oxygen, fluorescence, nutrients and related oceanographic parameters in marine waters. We offer products to support best-in-class oceanography and climate science. We offer an entrepreneurial environment that is team-centered, customer-driven, quality-focused, and growth-oriented.

Working at Sea-Bird Scientific gives you access to a robust career development process and challenging stretch opportunities. Sea-Bird Scientific is proud to be one of Danaher's Water Quality companies . Through strong customer partnerships, the water platform advances the quality and delivery of water. Want to help us in this mission?


Are you passionate about Electrical Engineering? Do you want to make an impact on our environment? We are seeking an Electrical Engineer to join our collaborative team to help troubleshoot, design and test devices.

Production Engineering provide support for several different devices that test the salt waters of the world, do ocean monitoring, and have light sensing devices that read the optical properties for the scientists that study the waters. You will have the opportunity to support the Production Lines and be a part of the design, test and maintenance of instrumentation and supporting fixturing!


Lead design and commission of test fixtures
Product maintenance and sustainment (firmware bug fixes, hardware improvements)
Data driven problem solving (coordination with R&D/Science)
Participates in risk assessment activities.
Has facility in electronic design including schematic drawing, circuit simulation, printed circuit board layout and firmware coding.
Participate in Kaizens and Problem Solving Process
Drawing creation, Fixturing, and general operation readiness
Coordinate with Materials and Compliance Teams to facilitate product POC conversion


BS in Electrical Engineering or relevant field
Experience testing electrical circuit boards
Experience programming, testing and debugging embedded systems such as MSP430.
Database interaction experience including SQL, preferred.


MS in Electrical Engineering degree
1-2 years related experience in lean manufacturing or engineering environment
Experience with source control practices. Subversion preferred.
Experience with communication protocols including RS-232, RS-485 and USB, preferred.

Job_Description:

As a global leader in high-tech filtration, separation, and purification, Pall Corporation thrives on helping our customers protect people. Our products serve a wide range of markets, so if your interests lie along the spectrum of Life Sciences to Industrial, you’ll find a rewarding role here. For the exponentially curious, Pall is a place you can thrive and amplify your impact on the world.

Pall is proud to work alongside a community of nine fellow Danaher Life Sciences companies. Together, we’re pioneering the future of science and medicine, developing products that enable researchers in the fight to save lives.

Learn about the Danaher Business System which makes everything possible.

Are you a person who enjoys making positive, tangible changes that improve the overall quality of a product or process? Do you have a passion for interfacing with internal and external customers? Are you a data-driven individual? If so then maybe you would be a great fit for our Principle Quality Engineering position.

The Principle Quality Engineer is responsible for interfacing with internal and external customers when quality related topics arise. This individual will continuously assess quality capabilities for both product and processes. This position will play a key role in our Elements Value Stream. This position is part of the Quality Assurance department and will be located in New Port Richey, FL.


Drive internal PPM improvements using iDT&R (Internal Defect Tracking & Resolution)

Drive external PPM improvements using CDT&R (Customer Defect Tracking & Resolution)

Maintain and update value stream quality systems using standard APQP tools.

Lead Quality related Kaizen events for your respective value stream.

Collaborate with manufacturing to reduce scrap for your respective value stream.


Bachelors degree in a technical field. (Engineering or Technology)

5+ years quality engineering experience within a regulated manufacturing environment. (i.e. Aerospace or Automotive)

Experience with APQP core tools. (Experience in both development and maintenance)

Experience with SPC (Statistical Process Control) and DoE (Design of Experiments)



Experience using Six Sigma tools.

ASQ or Six Sigma certifications.

OTHER REQUIREMENTS

This position requires access to export-controlled commodities, technical data, technology, software, and services. U.S. citizenship, U.S. legal permanent resident status, protected person status, or U.S. Government export authorization is required. Any offer of employment is contingent upon Pall obtaining the necessary employment visa and export authorization, including, if required, an export license from the applicable U.S. government agency.

Title: Bioinformatics Analyst II
Job_Description:
Ormco, headquartered in Brea, CA, is a global leader and innovator of orthodontic products and solutions designed to enhance the lives of our customers and their patients. For nearly 60 years, Ormco has partnered with the global orthodontic community to help create over 20 million smiles in over 130 countries. Our distinguished products range from twin brackets (Symetri™ Clear, Titanium Orthos™ and Mini Diamond™) to pioneering the self-ligating appliances with the Damon™ System (including Damon™ Q2 and Damon™ Clear 2). Our latest Spark™ Clear Aligner System is designed to meet the needs of the orthodontist with the TruGEN™ material and 3D Approver software, making a more comfortable and aesthetically pleasing aligner experience for patients. From personalized service to professional education programs and marketing support, Ormco is committed to helping orthodontists achieve their clinical and practice management objectives. For more information about Ormco, visit www.ormco.com

Pall Corporation is seeking a extraordinary teammate to fill the position of an IT Infrastructure Analyst to work onsite at our location in New Port Richey Florida . This is an exciting opportunity to join a growing global organization, where you are the key to solving challenging user inquiries and infrastructure project initiatives. Being a hero to our users and partners starts with you!

The ideal candidate is experienced in placing the user first, is highly focused on working with a collaborative infrastructure support team and is eager to own and solve user problems. We are looking for a team member with high integrity, a creative problem solver who can work with all team members to solve infrastructure escalations quickly and have fun doing it! Your time will be spent responding to complex incidents, identifying, and resolving problems and escalating where appropriate. In addition, you will manage smaller projects and team resources. You will also be responsible for new infrastructure project planning and implementation as well as existing project cancelation, modification, or improvement.
Essential job functions

Provide remote and hands on user support for desktops, laptops and local manufacturing equipment

Perform maintenance and troubleshooting of all relevant hardware and software.

Provide technical guidance to users and management for desktop support services.

Support local manufacturing systems.

Configuration, installation & deployment of all PC’s and PC related peripherals.

Participate in projects, implementations and rollouts as directed by the Manager/Supervisor.

Implementation and support of network operating systems and services.

Develop a working knowledge of department specific applications.

Stay on top of technical aspects of PC-LAN computing environment.

Provide Manager/Supervisor with equipment projections and assist with purchasing.

See opportunities and recommend solutions for improving service, efficiency, and effectiveness.

Contribute to meeting the departmental key performance indicators.

Work safely and align with company’s health safety and environmental policies and procedures
Minimum qualifications

Three or more years current experience in desktop support including network applications / operating systems / hardware.

Applicable degree program or IT industry certification including ITIL ( Information Technology Infrastructure Library) is preferred

Demonstrated strength in PC / Hardware and associated peripherals, network hardware and management tools, network operating systems and applications, Microsoft O/S, Server and Desktop, user documentation and diagnostic tools.

O365, Active Directory , Enterprise level support for Microsoft environments.

Ability to work onsite full time in New Port Richey Florida facility

US Citizen or permanent resident with ability to travel with valid driver’s license; ability to work off core business hours as required

Serve as subject matter expert for IT and business teams, providing analysis to help them understand remediation steps, impact, and prioritization

Prepare reports and presentations communicating risks and status to a diverse audience of technical staff and both IT and business leadership


Bachelor’s degree in related field with 5+ years of experience in Vulnerability Management, Cyber Security, or related IT work OR Master’s Degree with 3+ years of experience OR Doctoral degree in field with 0+ years experience.

Proficiency with enterprise vulnerability management platforms such as Rapid7 Nexpose, Tenable Nessus, or Qualys

Skilled at analyzing IT/VM data sets using tools such as Excel or Power BI and presenting in a meaningful, digestible format for leadership teams


CISSP, GIAC/SANS, or similar certifications

Title: Bioinformatics Analyst II
Job_Description:
DNA Script
DNA Script is a leading company in manufacturing de novo synthetic nucleic acids using enzymatic DNA synthesis (EDS) technology. The company aims at accelerating innovation in life science and technology through the decentralization of rapid, on demand and high-quality DNA synthesis. DNA Script's approach leverages nature's billions of years of evolution in synthesizing DNA to set a new standard for customizing nucleic acid synthesis thus accelerating discovery in genetics, genomics, and synthetic biology. Discovery disciplines with profound impacts upon humanity such as biopharma, translational genetics and even molecular information storage all start with synthetic DNA. The company has recently initiated the commercialization of its first EDS powered platform, the SYNTAX system.
To date, DNA Script has raised over $315M of financing, with leading investors such as Coatue Management, Fidelity Management and Research, Catalio Capital Management, Casdin Capital, LSP, Bpifrance Large Ventures, Danaher, Illumina Ventures, Agilent, Merck Ventures, Sofinnova Partners, Kurma Partners, T Rowe Price, Baillie Gifford and Eurazeo.
