Are you a highly motivated and talented Senior Cyber Risk Quantification Analyst (CRQ) who would love to join the growing security organization at Danaher Corporation? Lead information security risk initiatives across 20+ globally diverse science and technology operating companies! By identifying and managing technology risk through quantitative and analytical practices, you will play a pivotal role in protecting Danaher’s sensitive data and other high value assets throughout the organization.

At Danaher we believe in designing a better, more sustainable workforce. We recognize the benefits of flexible, remote working arrangements for eligible roles and are committed to providing enriching careers, no matter the work arrangement. This position is eligible for a remote work arrangement in which you can work remotely from your home. Additional information about this remote work arrangement will be provided by your interview team. Explore the flexibility and challenge that working for Danaher can provide.

Primary Responsibilities

Lead risk management activities across Danaher’s operating companies, including implementation of a risk management framework and supporting cyber risk quantification functions based on Factor Analysis of Information Risk (FAIR)

Utilize information security risk expertise to develop loss event scenarios across operating companies, business units, projects, and products

Interpret internal or external cyber security risk analyses in business terms and recommend best practices

Continually monitor risk treatment activities to help ensure timely completion and risk reduction

Monitor and identify opportunities to improve the effectiveness of risk management processes

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent level of education and expertise

4+ years of experience in information security risk management, governance, or compliance related roles

Proven experience with cyber risk quantification methodologies and tools, such as Factor Analysis of Information Risk (FAIR) and RiskLens, or similar risk management experience

Understanding of security standards and frameworks such as ISO 27001/2, NIST 800-53, CIS Top 20 and similar

Excellent ability to communicate complex subjects effectively, especially at the executive level

Preferred Qualifications

Relevant certifications such as Factor Analysis of Information Risk (FAIR), Certified in Risk and Information Systems Control (CRISC), Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA), Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) or similar

Experience using RiskLens and ServiceNow Integrated Risk Management platforms

Title: Bioinformatics Analyst II
Job_Description:
You may not have heard of chromatography, the science of separation, but it’s likely affected your life. Phenomenex’s chromatography products advance the future of scientific analysis and investigation, ensuring the quality of essentials like your food, water, shampoo, and even cold medication. We strive to provide the best tools and resources possible to help researchers improve global health and well-being, including award-winning liquid chromatography, gas chromatography, and sample preparation products. Be part of our global success, centered on a commitment to developing novel analytical chemistry solutions, unique marketing, and exceptional customer service and support.
Phenomenex is proud to work alongside a community of nine fellow Danaher Life Sciences companies. Together, we’re pioneering the future of science and medicine, developing products that enable researchers in the fight to save lives.
The Global Brand Manager is an emboldened and experienced leader responsible for the global brand, vision and identity of Phenomenex, devising and implementing corporate brand strategy and campaigns internally and externally to convey brand sentiment and drive awareness. They will provide strategic leadership and conduct customer insight projects to identify market trends and brand perception, while also owning the external communications/public relations channel and agency utilization to drive greater brand awareness and progress perception. This position will work hand in hand with the Phenomenex marketing, sales, R&D, leadership, commercial and corporate communication teams.

Location
This is a remote role which can be located anywhere in the US.

Key Responsibilities
Single point of expertise and reference on brand positioning/messaging for Phenomenex. assuring consistent usage of corporate branding, guidelines, overall vision/mission and company values
Drive awareness, branding thought leadership and the story of Phenomenex through the creation and execution of strategic corporate initiatives that enhance Phenomenex’s brand perception and equity
Conduct and analyze customer insight and market research programs to identify brand position, perception and awareness
Partner with marketing teams and executive leadership to identify synergies and champion complementary initiatives.
Translate market developments and trends into agile brand updates, communications and strategies
Develop and implement external communications/PR campaigns by partnering with agencies and marketing teams to drive market awareness and growth
Help to translate highly scientific and complex information into compelling brand experiences
Continuously look for opportunities to improve existing processes to create larger impact and efficiencies or standardize look and feel across platforms and regions
Monitor and report on campaign metrics to maximize marketing effectiveness and drive ROI; utilize metrics to drive continuous improvement, tweaking program implementation to optimize impact.
Development and optimization of key corporate content pillars such as corporate videos and corporate presentation

Professional Experience and Education
Minimum 10+ years of brand building experience
Bachelor’s degree required; MBA preferred
The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 3 years of PR or Journalism experience, strong writing skills, a solid understanding of life sciences media and AP writing style
Proven ability to create and direct high-quality campaign and content creative—including copywriting and design elements—for traditional and digital channels
Global mindset and passion for growth
Familiarity with digital and social media trends, and measurement platforms is required with a strong intuition for business and an ability to clearly communicate complicated issues in simple terms

Required Capabilities
Ability to perform exceptionally in fast-paced, performance-oriented environment
Experience working in a global environment and in a matrix-managed organization
Experienced leader with ability to influence decisions across all levels of an organization
Strong time management and organizational skills; ability to multitask and manage competing priorities and changing business needs.
Strong interpersonal, communication, and negotiation skills.
Strong process orientation, problem solving and troubleshooting skills and a firm commitment to quality
Strong data analyst with ability to translate complex data trends into actionable insights

Do you want to work in Quality Control? Do you enjoy evaluating products?
We are currently seeking a Quality Control Analyst II who will be responsible for the testing of in-process and finished goods as well as maintaining key instrumentation to ensure test results are reliable and accurate. You will also compare data obtained from test results against specification limits and trending patterns to ensure material meets strict quality attributes.


Perform routine testing using a variety of testing methods, including HPLC, GC and MS instrumentation.

Update and maintain KPI tracking spreadsheets.

Initiate and complete CAPA and IR related activities as well as complete nonconformance reports for failing materials.

Compare data obtained during testing against historical data trends and identify irregular patterns in data.

Create, revise and update standard operating procedures (SOP).

Apply “5S” and lean principles in work area and assist in third party vendor qualification assessments.


Must be able to work on Saturdays and Sundays on a regular basis.

HS Diploma or equivalent (GED) required.

Experience in Microsoft office and Database Management.



Experience in HPLC, GC and/or MS instrumentation preferred.

Bachelor’s Degree in Analytical Chemistry, Biology or Life Sciences preferred.

At least 2 years of Experience in Chromatography.

Prior GMP, GLP or ISO9000 training highly desirable.

The Senior Analyst Regulatory Affairs for Beckman Coulter Diagnostics is an individual contributor and subject-matter-expert responsible for creating and executing regulatory strategies for pre-market and post-market activities. Primary responsibilities include evaluation, coordination, preparation and implementation of post-market regulatory activities and design change evaluations. Additionally, this position supports regulatory strategy for new product development activities and applicable submissions or registrations.

This position is in the Immunoassay Regulatory Affairs team and reports to the Manager of Regulatory Affairs in Chaska, MN. This role is responsible for managing regulatory initiatives, and working with third parties as appropriate. Build consensus while championing global regulatory initiatives for projects. Also provide pre-market regulatory initiatives for immunoassay devices, ensuring the development and implementation of these advanced and aggressive regulatory strategies provide a competitive edge to Beckman Coulter.

If you thrive in a fast-paced role and want to contribute to a world-class Regulatory Affairs organization—read on!


Author global pre-market submissions, including 510(k)s and PMA supplements to the U.S. FDA in alignment with pre-market and post-market strategies.
Create and manage IVDR Technical Files. Work with international colleagues on establishing design dossiers for their intended market for new product development and design changes.
Advise business teams to consider the impact of current or emerging regulatory issues, works with colleagues globally to facilitate and ensure company practices are consistent with the corporate regulatory risk posture.
Ensure sound post-market product regulatory strategies including minimizing the risk of negative post-market submissions needed for design changes, such as agency review delays.
Function as the team expert for promotional material review, experimental design review, data analysis and product labeling as they relate to product registration and commercialization of IVD medical devices.

The essential requirements of the job include
Bachelor's Degree with 5+ years of experience in Life Sciences or a Master's Degree with 3+ Years of experience in Life Sciences or Doctorate with 0+ years of experience in Life Sciences
Demonstrated experience working with both hardware and software as they relate to In Vitro Diagnostics
Subject matter expertise in registrations and commercialization of IVD medical devices


Demonstrated knowledge and understanding of regulations and guidelines governing in-vitro diagnostics.
RAC certificate
Strong FDA, Health Canada, and EU submission experience

Title: Bioinformatics Analyst II
Job_Description:
Aldevron is an industry pioneer with a core competency in manufacturing for gene and cell therapy. We supply high-quality plasmid DNA, mRNA and proteins to our clients, who are breaking new ground on the world’s most important and challenging solutions to benefit us all. We're looking for innovative, forward-thinking individuals who share our goals of advancing science and making an impact on the world.

Aldevron is proud to work alongside a community of nine fellow Danaher Life Sciences companies. Together, we’re pioneering the future of science and medicine, developing products that enable researchers in the fight to save lives.

Are you a motivated individual who likes to take responsibility for understanding supply and material demands? Do you enjoy enabling timely distribution through the power of organization? Then here’s your chance to join an organization that produces custom biologics of the highest quality, scaling manufacture to fit projects of any size and meeting precise client requirements!


We are currently hiring a Production Flow Specialist Supervisor. This position is part of the Supply Chain organization and is located onsite in Fargo, ND . At Aldevron, we combine best-in-class products and service with the ideal operating environment to lay the groundwork for vital new discoveries worldwide. The Production Flow Specialist will be responsible for keeping materials and paperwork needed to perform an operation in stock at the point of use in assigned production areas. This position will also be accountable for the general organization of material in their assigned area and monitor ERP data to highlight possible issues, material shortage, and impact to the production areas.


Perform replenishment of materials to the Manufacturing Suite as needed

Ensure all agreements concerning moving and the supply of materials are observed

Ensure that required parts are always available at the agreed place and time

Prepare, communicate and execute a plan to effectively provide material and any required paperwork needed to run the next job in queue for assigned work centers

Coordinate with Planners to ensure that the correct jobs are being prepared for each work center

Organize incoming and outgoing parts in your assigned area while maintaining organization and consistency throughout the department

Manage inventory levels and accuracy in the manufacturing system through the monitoring of physical inventory counts and inventory transactions that affect the assigned value stream/cell

Perform cycle counts and works with Inventory Analyst to have adjustments made to ensure inventory accuracy is maintained

Ensure Level 2 cleaning for certain incoming and outgoing parts prior to entering the sterile production environment

Assist in additional manufacturing tasks such as autoclave, filter testing, buffer dispensing etc.

Responsible for order reconciliation for warehouse delivered materials


High School Diploma required or equivalent GED

5 years previous experience in materials handling or similar role

Ability to walk or stand for long periods of time


Competent computer skills

High attention to detail skills

Creative problem-solving skills

Experience with Microsoft Dynamics/ERP systems preferred

Experience in a manufacturing setting required, preferably in a similar role working with material flow of production

Previous supervisory experience preferred

Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing

Ability to make recommendations and effectively participate in the implementation of plant policies and procedures


While performing the duties of this position, the employee is regularly required to see, talk and hear. The employee frequently is required to stand, walk, bend, lift up to 50 pounds, and use arms, hands and fingers for various activities. This position may stand or remain sedentary for long periods of time. This position routinely works with large pieces of equipment

Title: Bioinformatics Analyst II
Job_Description:
Leica Biosystems ’ mission of “Advancing Cancer Diagnostics, Improving Lives” is at the heart of our corporate culture. We’re a global leader in cancer diagnostics with the most comprehensive portfolio from biopsy to diagnosis. Our easy-to-use and consistently reliable offerings help improve workflow efficiency and diagnostic confidence.
Our associates know that every moment matters when it comes to cancer diagnostics. When you come to work, you’re helping develop solutions that enable accurate diagnoses to turn anxiety into answers. Join our diverse, global team of talented people, and be inspired to grow every day.

Leica Biosystems is proud to work alongside a community of six fellow Diagnostics Companies at Danaher . Together, we’re working at the pace of change to improve patient lives with diagnostic tools that address the world’s biggest health challenges.
The Site Controller is responsible for all aspects of the preparation of forecasting & management reporting for Leica Biosystems Vista. They will have responsibility for all financial records and associated internal control environments working closely with the shared service center in Cincinnati who perform the site’s transactional accounting.

Working closely with the Global Finance Director of Advance Staining and Pathology Imaging Instruments (who is based in Melbourne, Australia) and as a business partner to the Site Leader, Vista Operations, site stakeholders (including functional leads) & management teams, they will drive organizational and operational improvements to support financial growth and success.

Major Responsibilities

Direct ownership of preparation of forecasts and monthly financial reporting tools, with thoughtful analysis of trends.

Coordination and preparation of financial processes including Budget and standard within the frame of issued financial targets.

Continuously develop appropriate key performance indicators to drive growth, improve profitability, and enhance productivity.

Deliver high value-added financial insight to the relevant management teams to support operational and strategic decision making.

Manage the relationship with the shared service center in Cincinnati to ensure that accounting responsibilities are delivered.

Partner with and actively involve stakeholders throughout the business to ensure financial management responsibilities are understood and financial goals are exceeded.

Deploy targets and proactively work with stakeholders across the business to ensure risks are identified and properly counter measured.

Ensure high quality of and accountability for data within SAP, including accuracy and completeness of standard costs.

Develop, modify and execute department and corporate policies and procedures

Provide leadership, guidance and development for the Financial Analyst.

Acting as an integral member of the site management team providing leadership to the wider business relating to financial management and commercial decision making.

Required Skills/Experience

The ideal candidate will have a Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics or related field.

10 years of relevant experience with at least 5+ years working in Manufacturing or Operations Finance in total (or, at minimum, the most recent 3 years)

Demonstrated prowess at handling the technical financial elements of the role while at the same showing interest in and acumen with the business partnering elements of the position.

Prior experience as the senior Finance leader at an operational site

Prior success with managing relationships/influencing teams (both inside and outside of Finance)

Experience in manufacturing and knowledge of standard costing

Strong written and verbal presentation skills

International experience working within a matrix environment preferable

A CPA is a strong plus, but not required

Advanced skills with MS Office (particularly Excel), prior experience with a major, integrated ERP (SAP or Oracle), prior experience and comfort level with financial planning & consolidation software (Hyperion, BPC, Cognos, etc); experience with PowerBI or similar tools are a strong plus

Title: Bioinformatics Analyst II
Job_Description:
WONDERING WHAT’S WITHIN DANAHER? TAKE A CLOSER LOOK.

At first glance, you’ll see Danaher’s scale. With $22.3B revenue, our 69,000 associates work across the globe at more than 25 unique operating companies within four platforms — life sciences, diagnostics, water quality, and product identification.
Career development is important to us - you’ll find associates who are as certain about their impact as they are about where they’re headed next. You’ll find the Danaher Business System, which makes everything possible. You’ll also see a company that investors trust—our culture of continuous improvement has helped us outperform the S&P 500 by more than 5,000% over the past 25 years.

We hope you’ll see yourself here, too. What you find at Danaher — and within yourself — might just change the world.


X-RITE PANTONE is the leader in color science and technology offering end-to-end solutions for the selection, communication, formulation, and production of consistent and achievable color.


This role is responsible for cost accounting, financial reporting for the Global Operations team, and maintenance of the standard cost system at various locations throughout the X-Rite organization. Daily the Sr. Finance Analyst will work across accounting and finance disciplines to provide clarity on production costs, enable efficient daily management of KPIs and support finance and operations decision-making.

This is a HYBRID role with 2 days in the office and 3 days remote.


Cost Accounting
Execute cost accounting procedures for X-Rite production operations including standard costing, overhead absorption, and inventory reserves
Assist in the development of the annual budget and standard cost roll.
Assist in product mix evaluation for forecasting and the impact to gross margin.
Perform month-end closing duties such as account reconciliations, manufacturing variance analysis, and financial reporting packages within established timelines
Research large cost variances from expected results with Operations team to develop holistic understanding of financial results for organization.
Prepare accurate journal entries and supporting schedules in accordance with US GAAP for inventory, E&O, freight, overhead allocation, variances.
Assist in the forecast and variance explanations around Gross Margin variances.
Plan and participate in annual physical inventory and cycle count audits/reporting
Maintain all accounting processes in accordance with GAAP and internal controls.
Prepare accurate Blackline balance sheet reconciliations to safeguard against accounting errors and instill a strong control environment.
Reconcile inventory residing at various X-Rite locations monthly and work with Operations team on necessary corrections.
Oversee Oracle / MAPICS transactional data batches and correct errors as necessary.

Supply Chain Operations Support
Support X-Rite Operations team through accurate financial reporting on inventory, purchasing and production efficiencies, inbound and outbound freight, and other costs of goods sold.
Partner with Operations Global teams to ensure control system around inventory levels, spot buy premium spend, and freight expenses.
Develop insightful financial reports for trend analysis and daily management as needed by X-Rite Operations leadership.
Carry out special projects and operational reviews as needed.


3+ years of accounting or relevant experience.
Experience within a manufacturing environment is preferred, but not required
Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance or Business-related field
Oracle / MAPICS experience is a plus
Strong Microsoft Excel skills
Ability to manage time effectively and prioritize to meet deadlines
Proven ability to solve problems using independent judgement and analytical skills
Able to work independently and within a team in a fast paced and high-volume environment with emphasis on accuracy and timeliness


Comprehensive benefits package (medical, dental, vision & more) eligible on day 1 of employment
Permissive paid time off policy emphasizing flexibility and trust
14 paid holidays!
Annual bonus as well as annual salary review
Training and development opportunities including Development Days
Tuition Reimbursement
401K savings plan + company match
Attractive employee referral program
Paid parental leave
Danaher Wellbeing Program, with rewards
Employee Assistance Program (legal, financial, and counselling resources)

You can find detailed information at https://www.danaherbenefitsinfo.com/ . *US ONLY

Title: Bioinformatics Analyst II
Job_Description:
DANAHER CORPORATION OVERVIEW:
Danaher is a global science and technology innovator committed to helping its customers solve complex challenges and improving quality of life around the world. Its family of world class brands has leadership positions in the demanding and attractive health care, environmental and applied end-markets. With more than 20 operating companies, Danaher's globally diverse team of approximately 60,000 associates is united by a common culture and operating system, the Danaher Business System, and our Shared Purpose, Helping Realize Life's Potential. For more information, please visit www.danaher.com .

Typical EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE:
BS or BA Degree in Finance or Accounting required; CPA is strongly preferred.
Experience in a public accounting firm is required; large international accounting firm is preferred.
Strong global business perspective with understanding of a multinational organization with multiple business units is preferred
When you join us, you’ll also be joining Danaher’s global organization, where 69,000 people wake up every day determined to help our customers win. As an associate, you’ll try new things, work hard, and advance your skills with guidance from dedicated leaders, all with the support of powerful Danaher Business System tools and the stability of a tested organization.
Openings for Manager, Corporate Finance
Manager, Financial Reporting Operations

Senior Financial Analyst


The candidate for this position will be a critical member of the finance team and a principle financial advisor to our businesses and senior management. This individual will be responsible for reviewing and validating financial results for actuals, forecast, and budget submissions. This position is a unique blend of financial planning and analysis with classic accounting skills. This individual will analyze, classify, and review financial data and provide interpretation of results for use by all levels of management.

The candidate will work closely with corporate personnel and will be a key point of contact for operating companies (Opcos) in regard to accounting and reporting issues. Career progression opportunities exist within the finance groups of our OpCos as well as the corporate finance group in financial planning and analysis as well as controllership roles.


Reviews and validates each OpCo’s actual and forecasted financial results on a monthly basis and provides analytical reports of business performance to senior management.
Prepares reports of core value drivers for distribution to senior management.
Participates in and supports monthly actuals and forecast processes.
Participates in and supports annual budgeting process.
Prepares annual intangibles impairment review using OpCo submissions.
Reviews monthly debt schedules.
Prepares and reviews monthly account reconciliations.
Reviews the weekly sales and bookings submissions by OpCo, and distributes results to CEO, CFO, and other senior management on a weekly basis.
Prepares control sheets (journal entries for intercompany transactions).
Navigates within OneStream and pulls financial data directly from OneStream in Excel (through OneStream XF) on a daily basis to either distribute to various parts of the Company or perform analysis.
Prepares ad hoc financial reports in a timely and accurate manner for business CFOs and Corporate Finance leadership.
Acts as a resource for OpCo personnel in interpretations of Danaher’s Finance policies.
Plays a leading role in evaluating and implementing changes to improve processes within the organization.


Detail oriented
Fast learner who can rapidly adapt to Danaher’s culture and gain the confidence of the Danaher Leadership Team.
Ability to manage competing requests and prioritize on a real-time basis
Must have high intelligence
Be able to influence peers, subordinates, and superiors
Ability to analyze complicated issues and boil down to the key points, develop action plans, and implement them


Passion for results and attention to detail without losing sight of the big picture.
Capability to function as both a team member and team leader.
Capability of operating in a fast-moving, ever changing environment and ability to make tough, difficult accounting and financial-related decisions.
Ability to analyze and translate financial information and results into workable information for communication to operating management.
Ability to conduct detailed business and financial analyses to identify potential problems, determine root causes, and recommend appropriate solutions is necessary.


A working knowledge of US GAAP is expected.
Proficiency in Planning & Analysis and accounting are expected.
Must have strong interpersonal and communications skills.
Ability to work independently yet manage multiple projects simultaneously.
High energy and able to handle conflict.
Ability to work well in a cross-functional, matrixed organization.


BS or BA Degree in Finance or Accounting required; CPA is strongly preferred.
Experience in a public accounting firm is required; large international accounting firm is preferred.
Strong global business perspective with understanding of a multinational organization with multiple business units is preferred


Reports to the Director, Corporate Finance & Accounting


Chief Accounting Officer
Vice President – Corporate Controller
Vice President – Finance
Vice President – Investor Relations
Vice President – FP&A
Senior Manager – FP&A
Assistant Controller, Treasury
Assistant Controller, Financial Reporting
OpCo CFOs.

Title: Bioinformatics Analyst II
Job_Description:
Our vision is to transform the customer experience with industry leading self-service digital tools driven by rich data. We need your help to build and maintain our database and enable best in class solutions with data. You are responsible for executing a structured approach to the collection, creation, and maintenance of master product data in our content management and PIM system supporting the Business and digital team of Hengstler-Dynapar in the EMEA and US region. You will be a Power User responsible for the integrity of the organization’s master product data systems. You will drive data integrity through data governance, change management, data ownership, and quality assurance.

You will be accountable for maintaining and managing the product information in our content management and PIM systems. You will work Business and digital team of Hengstler-Dynapar. to ensure data is available to be consumed by customer facing systems such as online systems including website, ecommerce and site search systems and offline assets such as product datasheets and catalogs. You will also partner with internal subject matter experts such as product management and engineering to understand key attributes for all product types, collect and implement attribute data for all SKUs.

This is a remote role with limited travel


Be the Power User and advocate the use of centralized data/PIM platform
Acquire and maintain product data from multiple data sources. Manages and executes data requests in support of business processes, new product sales initiatives
Drives excellence and ensures continuous improvement in quality of data through cleansing and best practices for data construction
Make data available for use in CMS and front-end website systems by partnering with web developers, agencies, and IT
Reports KPIs related to material master data management and drives a system of actions to complete requests in accordance with Data management process
Understand, adapt, and improve document management process to enable more efficient data updates and partner with stakeholders to establish standards, governance, and system administration where no processes are in place
Upload images and product documents into asset management system with all necessary metadata to maintain system search standards
Create, review, edit, and upload product content/media with a goal of achieving complete and quality data for all product groups
Works collaboratively as a data steward within teams to ensure clear understanding of business requirements that are managed in concert with PIM data
Work with regional teams to ensure that data translations are completed within the required timeframe and to a high standard.

Support and train stakeholders and local users on centralized data platform


Bachelor’s degree and at least 2 years of experience in e-commerce or PIM systems with a strong track record in working in ecommerce/digital space. Preference given to previous experience with major PIM solutions such as Akeneo, Salsify or Perfion.

Fortive is a diversified industrial growth company comprised of global businesses that are recognized leaders in attractive markets. With more than $6 billion in annual revenues, Fortive’s well-known brands hold leading positions in field instrumentation, transportation, sensing, product realization, automation and specialty, and franchise distribution.

Fortive is headquartered in Everett, Washington and employs a team of more than 24,000 research and development, manufacturing, sales, distribution, service and administrative employees in more than 40 countries around the world. Our team grows by tackling challenges that accelerate progress and further their careers. With a culture rooted in continuous improvement, the core of our company’s operating model is the Fortive Business System. For more information please visit: www.fortive.com .

The position is with Specialty Product Technologies (SPT). Specialty Product Technologies (SPT) has grown to be a global leader as a core technology company comprised of several strong product lines. SPT designs, manufactures, and markets innovative products, services, and technologies to deliver manufacturing/operational efficiencies, cost-effective solutions, and high-quality products demanded by today’s industrial automation marketplace.

Every SPT product line has earned a “best in class” reputation and has been built on a solid foundation of achievement over a long period of time with proven reliability in the most rigorous and demanding applications. Each product line is considered essential components in the markets and applications they serve.

Founded in 1901 as the Veeder Manufacturing Company, the company joined the Danaher portfolio in 1986 and has continued to grow. Today, SPT is part of the Fortive Corporation. The SPT product lines encompass the solid brands of Eagle Signal, Joslyn Clark, Namco Controls, Superior Electric, Thomson Nyliner, and Veeder-Root. SPT product lines can be found in a wide variety of applications and industries.
